Reviews.Title: “Modern, impecable, great location!”
Reviews.Author: italiancajun
Reviews.Content: Too bad we only stayed one night. This was my first stay at this hotel, it is a really beautiful hotel connected to the superdome. Grand staircases, smart elevators, great restaurants and bar area, great food even in the on-site convenience store if you're in a rush or after hours. The open spaces are great just for hanging out with friends. The room was beautifully decorated and clean, the king size bed was very comfortable with plenty of comfy pillows. Although small, the bathroom was very clean and inviting, tile floors, marble counter tops, sliding glass shower door, tile shower. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pre-paid room and upon arrival told were sold-out”
Reviews.Author: perlani
Reviews.Content: If you are a conference planner and thinking of reserving this hotel, please DO NOT. I'm a very unhappy conference attendee. I reserved my King room online with my conference promo and paid by credit card a month ago. When I arrived, they said that they were sold out of rooms and they only had their "suites" available that would have a pull-out sofa bed. Which sounded fine. But the nice Russian-accented lady did not fully explain is that there in this suite, there is no bed! This is a meeting room with a pull-out couch. She said the rest of the hotel was all sold out. Two other guests checking in with me also were assigned these meeting rooms with no beds. So I've now been waiting over 30 minutes for housekeeping to bring sheets so that I can make up my pull-out bed. There is no bed, no sheets or pillows. Space set-up is crazy. 3 escalators and then walk through the bars and restaurants and then up the elevator to one's room. There are no direct elevators. If you are a meeting planner, seriously stay away from planning your event at this hotel. Your conference attendees, like me, will appreciate getting a good nights' rest in a room with a bed!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but average”
Reviews.Author: JandKinGeorgia
Reviews.Content: I write this as someone that usually stays in 4-5 star hotels. It is nice. It is clean. There isn't anything "wrong" with it. The staff seems very nice, especially Gaby when checking you in, and the restaurant staff in the bar, very nice, but it is a complicated hotel. The elevators work on a scan system that is hard for many people to be "comfortable" with. When you get in the rooms, you are greeted with some sort of weird TV interface that takes a bit to figure out. I had a small suite, no balcony, and the A/C vent is totally blowing in the living room area but not in the bedroom and there is such a difference in temp that I had to take it down to 61 just be be comfortable in the bed area. I guess overall this is a very nice, high end hotel. I just (as well as others) didn't like all the modern bells and whistles about it. :) I might like a more traditional hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: fred s
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, lovely staff, valet (Mike) and front desk (Angela), the bellman Franklin was Great!! best service ever!!, He took the time to explain everything, was very professional he made our stay amazing always greeting us. and gave us a lot of great recomendations. He was our favorite. I had a great stay and will be back for sure....

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: traveler53449
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a long weekend planned for New Orleans over Labor Day weekend. We arrived Saturday after Issac came thru town. We were very fortunate in that the area we stayed in,near the Superdome did not lose power. Even though many of the staff did not have power in their own homes they went above and beyond to make our stay very relaxing. We were able to get a very nice and quiet corner room. We very much liked the location of the hotel as we were near the French Quarter, the Garden District, and the Central Buisness District. We've been to New Orleans many times and this was one of our better trips. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel... bad timing...”
Reviews.Author: jannster
Reviews.Content: Dates: 08/26/12 - 08/30/12 First of all, let me tell you that these travel dates include dates for Hurricane Isaac. Overall, the hotel was very very nice. First day, I called to see where the pool was, and they told me it was closed. Bummer, but I guess that happens. Next day, the hurricane started moving in. We were there for a conference, which was canceled. We elected to wait out the storm at the hotel - and we felt safe. I'm not going to comment on that part, because it was mother nature. The hotel did a very good job at taking care of their stranded guests. They were running on a skeleton crew and doing the best they could under the circumstances. We had full power, so I was thankful for that! My biggest complaint were the rooms. They are really really small. We had a King bed, but to me, the room seemed really small... just sayin. I loved the beds - they were awesome. We had a fridge, which was great. Internet worked well. The shower (no tub) was large and nice. Very very clean! Shout out to John in the bar... YOU ROCK! Made our miserable stay during the hurricane way more interesting!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: jmleon72
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency New Orleans for 3 nights over the Labor Day weekend. Because this was right after Hurricane Isaac, the hotel was very full with many locals who had no power and with many electrical contractors there for work. Despite these bookings, the hotel seemed a bit understaffed as room service deliveries etc. were very slow. On check-in, the staff acknowledged my Diamond status, but our Diamond amenity never came and we were not allowed to have as late a check-out as we would have liked. Overall the service was mediocre at best. With respect to the property, it's huge, clean and impressive. However, the surrounding area and views are depressing. We were advised that it was safe to walk to the French Quarter during the day, but not at night. Also, the Internet was unreliable and wouldn't work at times and the hotel computers for checking into flights weren't working. We used a suite upgrade and we felt like it was a complete waste. Our suite (room 2424) was poorly designed. It was essentially one large room with a dividing wall between the living room and the bedroom. The problem was that the air conditioning and vents were all in the living room portion of the suite with no vents in the bedroom portion. So we had to run the air conditioning at 60 degrees in the living room just to have a minimal cooling effect in the bedroom so we could sleep at night. Because we had to keep the living room so cold, we really didn't get to use it. We would have been better off with a standard room and saved the suite upgrade for a different property. Overall, this was a disappointing stay and I don't think Hurricane Isaac can be blamed entirely. Not sure that we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: schen8
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend staying at this hotel. It is walking distance to Canal St, the superdome, and all of the restaurants. We did not drive anywhere. They were charging around $40 per night for parking though, but we dropped our car off at a friends house. The car entrance didn't seem as if it could accommodate all the vehicles on a busy weekend. We were there for Mardi Gras. The hotel is very impressive when you walk in, high chandeliers, curvy staircases, great bar area, very nice people, and great service. The room was very clean and comfortable. Everything looked brand new. The glass elevators were pretty high tech, they are optimized for efficiency, just scan your room key, no hitting buttons. The fitness center overlooked the city. I would highly recommend staying at this hotel. Oh, and the John Besh restaurant, Borgne, first floor of the hotel. It is a must do! The food there is delicious!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: GreatEyes
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at this hotel recently. I was pleasantly surprised given the reviews. I experienced a very pleasant staff, a well styled room and comfortable bed, and good quick food at the lobby bar. The hotel is walking distance from the Superdome. The only issue I had was finding the entrance since there was so much construction on the streets at the time of my visit. But in spite of that since I come to NO often and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Reviews/Very Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Sonja M
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical after reading the reviews if this was a good choice. But we were attending a game at the super-dome, so I gave it a shot. I was not disappointed on any level. Valet was an easy process on drop off.(Expect to pay $40 per night for it, but it is New Orleans, parking is difficult to find). I pre-checked in online, so getting the room keys were easy. My rooms were ready upon arrival. They do require a deposit of $50 for incidentals, but most upscale hotels do. Luggage was promptly delivered. I loved not having to tote luggage through this large hotel. I had a king club and a double queen. The king had a spectacular view of the superdome. Breathtaking was more like it! The other had a city view, not spectacular, but still nice. Reviews made it seem as if navigating was impossible. With that in mind, we actually found it easy to get around. Saturday was game day, and there was a convention, so it got really busy. But this is the price you pay for proximity to the "dome". It just requires more patience and planning. Room service was on-time, and good. Staff was friendly. Valet was a little slow at check out, but remember there was a game and convention. Pre-plan ahead to check-in and out at non-peak times. Simple pre-planning can make your stay more enjoyable.This will definantly be my hotel of choice in the future for games. Big-YES, Crowded on game day-YES, Easy access to the dome-YES. Woth it-ABSOLUTELY! (This hotel also offers a GULF discount for residents of Gulf States-it made my rooms VERY affordable! That is a huge plus. Paid 1/3 of what I paid for a room in the quarter. Walking to the quater wasn't that big of a deal...but wear comfy shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: Jeepgirl30
Reviews.Content: We booked a queen room for a Saints game. Traffic was a nightmare as to be expected and it took a while for the valets to get to us. However, he was quick and very friendly. Even though LOTS of people were checking in, there were numerous desks open and we were able to check in with no waiting. Front desk staff was exceptionally friendly, helpful and quick!! You have to hike a little ways to the elevators but again, no waiting even with a crowd. My only disappointment is how tiny our room is. VERY small, but well appointed and the view of the Superdome can't be beat!! We'd definitely stay here again, especially for a game and at the great price we booked.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff/Bad staff”
Reviews.Author: Kepnitreel
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Very informative young man helped us to our room. Check-in was fast and easy. Pricey- nothing is included in the stay! Not parking, breakfast, internet, no coffee maker or microwave in room. Stingy with towels, washclothes and glasses. Three guests in the room and only enough towels, glasses, etc for barely two people. The glasses hadn't been changed in two days- I sat them in the floor indicating I would like clean glasses. My friend staying with us was in the room at the time informed me that the maid held the glasses under hot water and wiped them with one of the towels and placed them back in the cabinet. Elevators and walking was not a problem. I feel parking was over charged in comparison to other hotels of equal value. $40 per night @ hotel, $27per night next to hotel. Bed was comfortable. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location is minimun 20 minute walk to anything”
Reviews.Author: CityCoupleLovesParks
Reviews.Content: A large beautiful, modern, security conscious hotel next to the Superdome. Your room card gives you access to the elevator (fast) and takes you directly to your room floor. Lots of friendly staff around that proactively help guests unfamiliar with how to use the room card. Good business hotel with a nice size on-site 24 hr combined gift/deli/convenience store. If you want to venture off site, be prepared to walk 20+ minutes to the French Quarter, World War II Museum, etc.. This hotel is in the Arts/Business area but the fine art and craft stores were few and spaced too far apart for a casual walkabout. Either you walk or take a cab. Cabs are inexpensive and convenient. The area promotes their streetcars but while I saw the tracks I never saw a streetcar working though I saw "tourists" waiting for bus/streetcars. Also, this is hurricaine season (August) and it rained heavily or threatened to rain everyday (5 day trip). Hotel will provide upon request big loaner umbrellas at the bellman area, however, If I come to New Orleans during this time of year again I'll bring rain boots too.

Reviews.Title: “Meeting Planners beware!”
Reviews.Author: joks1
Reviews.Content: Just attended a nearly 900 business event at Hyatt near the Superdome. So incredibly disappointed with the Hyatt's planning. Only two bars, four small food stations. long lines of people waiting for food and drink, EMPTY condiments stayed empty for over an hour, empty food bars/stations were not kept up with, conventioners where just stacking dirty dishes everywhere including the floor because simply not close to enough staff to keep up with the demand. Over all the event was a terrible showing on Hyatts part. Now the building itself is Beautiful and the renovations outstanding. I am sure if you were just staying overnight at this property it would be fine. IF you are planning an EVENT from out of town...there might be better places to look.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Time Better Than The First”
Reviews.Author: Janice S
Reviews.Content: I attended a Non-business convention with some friends. This is the first time I've been to the hotel in ten years, but I really like this better than the last time. It is beautiful and I received great service. It's right next to the Superdome and the Arena, so it's great for business, conventions, and sporting events. The ony thing I really missed from when I stayed there before was they no longer have the trolley to the French Quarter-Riverwalk area which is an inconvenience since we had a long work to reach that area and the streetcar to the Garden District.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the Super Dome”
Reviews.Author: BillandBobAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We had a nice weekend stay during the Essence Music Festival. You will pay for internet access and there are no vending machines on each floor even though there are signs for them. Getting used to the elevator system is another issue. You can go down to the Starbucks in the hotel to use the internet for free.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency New Orleans 601 Loyola ave”
Reviews.Author: RADDY7022
Reviews.Content: Positive , but some Negative. POSITIVE: Had a "corner" King Size room, which was very nice and a great view of the DOME. Checking in was GREAT. One of the managers engaged in conversation with welcome information and great recommendations, which was appreciated. The staff was very professional, knowledgeable and friendly. The hotel is located next to the Dome and their is a nice grocery store five (5) minute walk from hotel. The downtown area was approximately 8-10 blocks (trolley), French Quarter and Waterfront further, Market area even further and Frenchman Street much further. SO PUT YOUR WALKING SHOES ON, if you don't mine walking. We walked EVERYWHERE! If you are NOT a walker cabs are "plentiful" in front of the hotel, but that could be "costly." If you are a fitness person, you will LOVE the fitness area. Brrrrrrrr! the pool is NOT heated. The staff "always" greeted you with a smile or pleasant conversation. Attended a convention, this is a good convention hotel, WELL I THOUGHT SO. NEGATIVE: Everything went well until day four (4). I arrived back in my room around 4:35 p.m., my room had not been CLEAN/REFRESH. On day five (5) leaving out even EARLIER (8:00 a.m.) and not returning until 6:40 p.m. again me room had not been CLEAN/REFRESH. I realize then that the housekeeping staff was still CLEANING ROOMS and their was NO system with the housekeeping staff. I realize that numerous conventions were being held back to back. The hotel was "overbooked" and LOGISTICALLY couldn't accommodate the crowd. HELP!! The bottom line, Hyatt Regency has "GREAT POTENTIAL."

Reviews.Title: “Agree! Fantastic hotel indeed!”
Reviews.Author: howler5
Reviews.Content: My son and I spent 3 nights recently attending the Arena Bowl August 10, 2012. Excellent location for walking to/from the New Orleans Arena. A good 8-10 block walk to downtown but we didn't mind it and had no problems even walking at night. Hotel staff were super-friendly & helpful. We were immediately upgraded to a room with a view of the SuperDome and Arena which my son thought was awesome! Also, it is a beautiful hotel, recently re-opened in Oct. 2011 after the Katrina disaster required a total remake. One of the largest hotels I have stayed at, and very beautifully decorated. The queen beds were comfortable. The hotel elevators worked great--swipe your room key at the kiosk outside an elevator and it immediately showed you which one to take--and then quickly shot you up to your floor. Ours was Floor 22 & it only took seconds to get there. Breakfast was included each day with our stay on a AAA rate & was an unbelievable good value at only $98/night. Scott, the restaurant manager was super friendly and we enjoyed the attention he paid to all the restaurant customers. Also, two mornings Lora was our server and she was superb! The breakfast buffet normally sells for $21/pp & had about everything you could imagine to choose from. We enjoyed the omelet station each morning in addition to the wide selection of fruit and other items. We wouldn't hesitate to return. The only negatives were (1) wish the housekeepers would have left us clean drinking glasses each day. We had to use the same ones all three days. Also, (2) watch your final bill! Ours had a $28 error on it--some type of charge for the breakfast which was supposed to be included in the room rate. It was probably accidental, and the hotel staff quickly removed it when it was called to their attention--but still, just watch your bill and you'll be okay.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential”
Reviews.Author: JComeaux
Reviews.Content: There are plenty of positives, but a few negatives. We enjoyed the overall atmosphere. Once you learn the hotel layout, everything is easy and convenient. You could spend an entire weekend there and never leave the hotel. The two negatives that we experienced were housekeeping and the noise from the weekend jazz musician. I requested extra towels and left a note for housekeeping. Not only did we not get extras, we didn't get any. After a hot day outside a nice shower was all we wanted. I did call and they sent some up. There is a jazz musician that performs on the weekends and performs in the open atrium. All rooms surround the atrium so there was no escaping the music. I would return only if there was a good discount and the street car was complete. We spent quite a bit on taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Very solid stay”
Reviews.Author: Pauliee_Dee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable about the city. Upon my arrival, the clerk made a bunch of recommendations of what to do in NOLA. They were all good recommendation and I wish I had time to do them all! The room had a nice view into the city. We had two flat screen TVs, a nice cozy big bed, and a comfy couch. The overall experience was pretty good. However, there are three things that I would recommend improvement on: 1) my husband ran out of coffee, and it took several calls for the staff to finally bring more coffee and cups to the room. 2) While the bathrooms were nice, the clear shower doors are awkward... you literally see yourself showering. 3) The clear glass shower doors do not shut completely, so they leak. At the end of the shower the floor is very wet... not cool. Nonetheless, it was a nice place and a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!!! THEY WILL TAKE YOUR MONEY!”
Reviews.Author: hayjay123
Reviews.Content: DO NOT DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT STAY THERE! Unless you like getting charged for something you did noy buy! When we checked out yesterday morning and were told we were only charged $127 with tax. But when we called before we checked it we were told a price on $80. When we arrived and told the lady she acted like we were lying! She acted like she didn't care! I just found out they hold $50 but don't tell you! Then when we wanted to park valet is $40 but you can do a self part but don't ask the workera anything about it b.c they have no clue. What so ever! If its not their problem then they just don't care! The nicest person we experienced that night was the person who walked around checking the floors. The next morning the staff was much better. But they said their printer wasn't working so we didn't get our receipt but was told it would be emailed to us. It wasn't. Then that's when we found out they hold $50. If ur the kind of person with all the money in the world to blow then have fun but if ur a sane person stay far away!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay from Hell”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I arrived to the Hotel and had a 20min wait to Valet Park for $40 per night. I had to travel up 3 escalators to get to the elevator level to get a elevator to go to my room. The elevators are automated with the room key and there were hundreds of people trying to use the same group of elevators at the same time. Chaos, pushing and shoving with no security in sight. The automated room service worked very well to order, but did not have anything available. Tried to call front desk and they never would answer nor would guest services answer. Read in brochure that there was a 24hr deli/sundry store open on second floor which was only accessible by stairs. 2 bottles of water, 2 candy bars and a bag of chips $32 dollars. Had 2 free breakfast coupons, but restaurant was closed. 45 minute wait to get car from valet to leave hotel. I hope Hyatt Regency enjoyed the money I spent, because I will never stay there again and will recommend to everyone I know not to stay there. Never, ever again!!!

Reviews.Title: “So Much Potential!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ohtobeinsandiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully renovated, all brand new furnishings, new restaurant area, interesting bars. But it is HUGE and not very convenient to the French Quarter or Bourban Street. It is not too far from a great market, Rouses Supermarket. They have everything you need for a nice dinner, snacks, or whatever. The hotel, on the otherhand, has a shop called Lagniappe, that charged $3.59 for a 20-ounce Diet Coke and $6.50 for a 1 Liter bottle of Evian. Things that were good about the hotel, front desk staff very courteous, as were the staff in the sports bar and the room rate was $78.00 per night. Things that were bad, no coffee maker in the room, took 4 hours and two calls to get one. One drinking glass and no laundry bag, note pad or pen. Second day, neither the glass or coffee was replenished by housekeeping. Called for both and 1 hour later, neither have arrived as I write this review. They have a nice hotel at a good value, but really need to work on execution. And the A/C is one of those that switches on and off, so it wakes you up frequently. And room was very dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Globettotter
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the negative reviews, I really questioned of I'd made the right choice in hotel. Our purpose for going to New Orleans was for a concert at the Superdome, so this seemed to be the best place- and it was! Despite horrific traffic due to concert-goers & detours from adding the trolley line in front of the hotel, along with an extremely busy lobby, check- in was relatively easy, but I was thinking about all of those reviews and felt like I was living them. My husband dropped me while he parked at the $27 self- park adjacent to the hotel which was easier than valet considering the wait for it. Besides, it's cheaper, so you may as well park there. I do suggest you divide & conquer like that because you will end up on level 2 of the hotel from the garage & will just need yo go up one level to the rooms. Once my family & I met back up on level 2, we just needed to hit an escalator to level 3 to the room elevators. Let me explain that this hotel is deceivingly huge. There is a lot of walking just to get to your room, but you're amidst beautiful furnishings & it's fun to people watch as you pass the restaurant & bar. The kids loved the glass elevator & the cool view you get if the Superdome as it takes you to your floor. Speaking of which, these elevators are not confusing. You push the number of the floor you're on, and it tells you which door you're going to use instead of you trying to figure out which door is going to open. You only need your key after 10 pm which is a good thing. After a night at the casino, we discovered we didn't have ours. There is an attendant at the elevators at this hour who is happy to help all of the drunk people staggering in. We were no exception. She took us to our room on the 23rd floor and made sure we belonged there. It sure beat traipsing back across the hotel to the lobby to get another key, especially after walking around the French Quarter all day. The service was great unlike what some reviewers said. It was particularly great when we finally got into our room after battling the traffic, the crowded lobby & parking garage, the trek to the elevators & our key didn't work. I was about to cry because we already arrived late & the concert was starting shortly when the door to the room opened. It was already occupied! Now, for many of you, I realize this would merit a horrible review. However, the hotel manager himself came up to put us in a different room. When we entered that room, I realized it didn't match the description on the website which indicates a queen/queen with a sofa. After bringing this up and pointing it out to the manager, he had a rollaway bed sent to our room without charge. He also had our keys coded to enter the 32nd floor to the Regency Club where there are daily snacks, hors d' ourves, desserts, coffee, soda, an honor bar, and a great view of the city. This helped to supersede any negativity. Once the trolley line is in, this will be a premier hotel not only for conferences and concerts, but for hitting the Riverwalk, casino, & the French Quarter. Until then, expect to walk. A lot. Otherwise, this is a modern, clean (although our room was vacuumed during our stay), hotel with lovely service. If you have complaints, you are either a prude used to he Ritz, or you don't get out much.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Darryl S
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is the most modern hotel I have ever stayed at. There arent even any buttons in the elevators. Scan your room key and it tells you what elevator to take and takes you to the proper floor. The Room Service Menu is on the TV. The decor is very contempoary. There are good bars and restraunts. and a sandwich shop along with a Starbucks. Right across the way from the SuperDome a great place to stay if you are going to an event. You will need to take a $6 to $7 Taxi ride to the French Quarter. So be prepared. Make sure the Cabbie runs the meter. I was charged $10 from one who didn't and heard over their radio in a different taxi that peole were disputing fares ( ok bit off track there) but still worth knowing. This hotel has many ammentaties , but I like coffe in my room! I would give this a 5th star had the location been a little better and the coffee thing! I recommend this Hotel it is very reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel but long walk!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnysideoftown
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights beginning August 3rd. The hotel is really nice but location is a long walk from French Quarter, riverwalk and Bourbon. Great place to stay if you are attending something at the Super Dome.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your walking shoes!”
Reviews.Author: John P
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was very nice. The staff interactions I had were pleasant enough. For the most part everything went pretty well during my stay. One issue I had was that check in time was 3pm (late in my mind) but my rooms were not ready until after this. No big deal, we were out in the city and it didnâ€™t make a whole lot of difference, but it could have. My major gripe and there is nothing that can be done about this is the location of the guest elevators. Get ready to walk miles in this hotel. The actual guest room elevators are located on the second floor and are in the back of the building, it's a big building! While I am on the elevators just ask another guest how to use them! I know I am a bumpkin but if there hadnâ€™t been another guest there to tell me which elevator to use, I may still be trying to get to my floor. The hotel caters to conventioneers more so than guests. Be sure to Priceline your room and do not pay full price, it definitely isnâ€™t worth it! Overall it is a nice place but just know up front you are going to have to walk and walk and walk. And negotiate your price, 1300 rooms are hard to fill.

Reviews.Title: “15 days of hell at the Hyatt Regency Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: NMTravelerCerrillos
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at the Hyatt Regency hotel in New Orleans from July 8 to July 24, 2012 on business travel. I stayed in this hotel for 15 nights and accumulated charges of $3,550.76. During this period, my client also had many other business travelers staying at this hotel. I estimate that the total charges were more than $50,000, perhaps $100,000.00. I travel and stay in hotels about 100 to 150 nights per year around the world. I have never had a worse experience at any hotel anywhere in the world compared to the 15 nights that I spent in the Hyatt Regency New Orleans. The hotel has so many management flaws and inconsiderate staff that is hard to remember all of the issues that I had with my stay. Repeated calls to the front desk and the management about these problems were simply not corrected. I was always reassured that things would be fixed or improved, but they got worse instead of better. It was an experience that I will never forget. As best as I can remember, here are the management and quality problems that I faced during my stay. 1. Maid Service. My room was rarely clean during my stay. I called the housekeeping manager on three successive days in order to get the floor vacuumed for the first time after I had been in the room for 10 days. It took three calls on three days! The floor was never vacuumed after that. The sheets were not changed for 10 days until I called repeatedly to request a change in linens. The cosmetics were not replaced after I used them, even when I requested a replacement. The rubber bath mat in the tub (a very slippery surface) disappeared after about 5 days, and despite my repeated written notes and requests to housekeeping, it was never replaced during my stay. I'm glad that I slipped only once. I repeatedly asked for additional laundry bags and slips and had to speak with the manager on duty in order to finally get a second set delivered to my room. The replacement of towels was so random that my colleagues and I joked about it just about every day. Sometimes none were replaced, and sometimes one or two. There was rarely a replacement of the cloth bath mat. On some days, there was no service when I returned to my room after work at 6:30 pm. 2. Elevator service. The elevator system in this hotel is not adequate for the number of guest rooms and guests in the building. On 6 days during my stay, I entered my floor number (18) on the third floor after work and received the response: "Try again later." This essentially meant "go away, you cannot use the elevator today to get to your room on the 18th floor." I had to wait 15-20 minutes on each of those days before the system would accept my request for floor 18. While this was highly annoying, it was especially annoying to me since there is no way to get from floor 18 to the gym on floor 32 without first going down from 18 to 3 and then back up from 3 to 32. I did this every day for 15 days and on 6 of those days the system told me to go away. 3. Repairs. During my stay, the bathroom ceiling fell in above the tub and the toilet in the bathroom ran continuously. I reported both of these and both were repaired. 4. Wake up calls. On several occasions, I received no wake up call at the time I requested it. Fortunately, I set a backup alarm on my cell phone or I would have been late for my client meetings. 5. Noise. The Hyatt Regency New Orleans is not a business-friendly hotel. It is a convention hotel and the level of noise in the hallways sometimes is overwhelming. My calls to security never helped quiet the noisy people in the hallway as I was trying to sleep at 11:00 pm or later. One day the music in the 32nd floor gym was turned up so loud that I could not even hear my own music in my earphones. I called the front desk 3 times before it was finally turned down to a reasonable level. It is impossible for guests to control the level of music in the gym. 6. Laundry. I used the laundry service three times -- or at least tried to use it three times. Twice my shirts came back with stains and the third time, my laundry was lost. It was my last day at the hotel and they finally found it (undone) at the front desk on the day I left. I had left the laundry at about 8:00 am, well before the 9:00 am cutoff. A surly person delivered my dirty laundry bag to my room after repeated calls. No apologies, no nothing. 7. Internet service. The wireless internet service was spotty and would often simply cut off in the middle of a work project in my room. And when I check out, I found that you had charged m $5.00 plus tax on several days for "movies" that I had never watched! 8. Good service in the block 8 restaurant. The service in the block 8 restaurant for breakfast was consistently good. Servers were exceptionally competent and helpful. The cost of the buffet breakfast, of course, was absolutely outrageous, but due to the location of the hotel there are very few alternatives for breakfast. They certainly take advantage of your monopoly of place and charge twice what I am used to paying at other similar hotels on my business travel. Bottom line: save your money and stay somewhere else. There are lots of good hotels in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Nice Nice”
Reviews.Author: Nursequita
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean, and the place to stay!!! TV top of the line. Access into room top of the line. Hotel decor and set up top of the line. It's pricey but you get what you pay for. Pool is small but NO has little space for anything anyway... For the games, it's perfect. Not for the games, it's kinda away from the happenings an no close streetcar??? We used a taxi $10 each way or walked which was not good... Overall the hotel is again nice...

Reviews.Title: “Hair in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Redgravi
Reviews.Content: First night in the hotel and not sure we will stay a second night. Little things are making this visit unpleasant. I checked in after a long trip and rushed to the bathroom, I went to lift the toilet lid and saw pieces of hair all over and got a little grossed out thinking how they cleaned that toilet. Than I go to my balcony and it has at least 20 cigarets butts in a supposed non smoking room and or property. We thought it was a bit cold and asked another blanket, after 2 requests, and after almost two hours, we got our extra blanket. The staff is nice but little things are adding up. We decided to take a drive and right now I am sitting at the lobby cause I got tired of waiting, I understand is Friday night but we got here an hour and a half ago. Should I even mentioned I calle ahead and they told me 15 minutes ? Which I did wait before coming down . I don't like to read long reviews but I thought this was important . Room is nice, staff is friendly, property is pretty with convenient restaurants and I took a picture of the little incidents.

Reviews.Title: “What a Mess”
Reviews.Author: 406mbeach
Reviews.Content: Nothing about this hotel works the way it's supposed to. The simplest things like air-conditioning and tvs in the rooms are not functional. Service in any of the bars or restaurants takes forever. There are some very eager and energetic staff members trying to make things right, but it's painfully apparent that this hotel is not ready for prime time.

Reviews.Title: “Less than it could be”
Reviews.Author: RHF67
Reviews.Content: We visit New Orleans about once a year so we are frequent tourist so when my organization's conference was located there this year I was doubly happy. The hotel has been nicely redone and I didn't think the walk to the elevators was too bad but the bellmen could have been quicker to offer assistance especially to our older members. Which I guess is the basis for my disappointment the regency staff offered none of the hospitality we have found in previous stays in this city that thrives on the tourist trade. We were caught in a tourist trap. Stay away from the convenience store once premise its super over priced and the food is nuked. A real starbucks is a great addition and having fedex office right there is awesome. The smart elevators are nice when its not too crowded but this is a convention hotel and they were constantly getting stuck and running slow. Beds were wonderfully comfy, but watch what they put on your card without telling you before they charge you. Incidentals are $50 per night and even if you want to pay cash and just have incidentals placed on your charge don't be surprised to find they've floated the entire bill on your card anyway. This happened to several members and to my husband and I. Don't even bother trying to use the Hyatt gift cards, personnel haven't been trained in the use and even though the web says you can use them within the hotel we were only able to use at the front desk and then it took 3 ppl to figure out how to credit us for $50. Close enough to french market and bourbon that you can walk even on really hot days. I should have been raving about my home for 5 days but instead it was the thing that almost ruined a wonderful visit to one of our favorite cities. Thanks, however to the cleaning lady who recommended La Bocca and La Bayou. Two great restaurants. Conference food during meal functions was terrible, but the special Sigmatinis were delicious! I certainly wouldn't stay again there are much warmer less corporate places to stay that will make you feel like a welcome guest and not a money tree ripe for picking. Did I mention not free WiFi in room and $40 a night parking and I'm a gold card member.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel personnel lazy and not helpful”
Reviews.Author: Helen W
Reviews.Content: Tried to check in to the room and it was not cleaned from the night before. The hotel management did not bring toilet paper to our room for at least four hours. The service was terribly and I do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Strange designs through stylish interiors and finishes.”
Reviews.Author: Mae C
Reviews.Content: Never have experienced side tables with fake drawers before. No bars to hang towels, only hooks on bath door. No tub (I do prefer showers, but when on leissure travel like to have a soaking option). Elevators have no number buttons, so if you miss your floor you have no fall back option. You are going to the 2nd floor. Nice pool,but you have to search for it. Like that cabannas are free. Valet parking is $40! So self park for $27. Unless you are doing business in the vacinity, you have to hike anywhere else...Quarters, Convention Center, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel, a bit impersonal & elevators that are much too clever for me”
Reviews.Author: thewizeone
Reviews.Content: I was staying in the hotel for a big conference for two nights. The location is not ideal for the French Quarter and the main tourist bits of New Orleans - it is close to the Superdome. I think I was put in the least glamorous part of the hotel - i think was called the west tower. Most of the rooms are off a large very high atrium - but mine was tucked away. I got lost going to my room and the staff weren't very helpful and I got the eye rolling treatment from one of the people I asked. The room was OK - but the view was really bad - concrete jungle roof top with workmen doing some building work. One of my friends had a much nicer room off the main atrium with a great view of the city - so might be worth asking for a room off the main drag if you are staying here - it will be easier to find! To use some of the elevators you had to press the floor you wanted before the elevator arrived - probably very fancy - but I never seemed to get on the right elevator and ended up in the wrong place... The communal space in the hotel was very impressive with very high ceilings and modern feel. But it didn't feel very cosy or welcoming. Not really my cup of tea. Next time I am in NO I'll probably stay in a smaller hotel closer to the French Quarter. But it is a good hotel for a big conference - lots of space and good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs training”
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the NALEO conference. When I checked in, I was basically yelled at by the clerk for not having my credit card ready when I gave her my ID, She said It's people like you who hold up the line. She never even smiled. I asked if I could have extra pillows in my room and she rolled her eyes and said to call housekeeping when I got to the room. She then told me my room wasn't ready and to come back in FIVE HOURS to recheck in. When I walked away she said to another guy behind the counter This Mexican group is driving me nuts. Well, I wanted to tell this clerk that she drove me nuts The rooms were new and clean but the bathrooms are small. It takes a long time to get from the lobby to the elevators. My keys wouldn't work each night and I had to keep going back to the lobby to get new keys made. They kept telling me it was my fault and that I was keepign the keys to close to my cell phone. I keep my keys my coin purse which is nowhere near my phone. The staff needs training. I've been treated nicer by bill collectors!

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Hotels - Most everything else decent to good; elevators and restaurants poor”
Reviews.Author: djlund999
Reviews.Content: I felt that I should write 2 reviews for the same stay. On the good side - rooms are updated, with modern, understated decoration (not expected in the town known for gras & carnival). Ask for a corner room (i.e. room 1450), which provides 2 sides of windows and an alcove-like closet for extra space. Staff were very personable - I had 4 staff greet me in the hallways within the first few hours. On the poor side - Elevators! I've been to many hotels during busy times and busy conferences the elevators were the worst I've experienced, horribly uncontrolled and overwhelmed. It's almost as if the hotel knows they can't support big crowds, but they fill the rooms anyway. Most people relied on stairs to go down, and many resorted to stairs going up after 15 minutes of chaotic waiting in a cramped elevator lobby. Seriously, why would you expect the guest to tolerate it. At some times, it was so bad that I swore I would never stay at a Hyatt again. Restaurants - of the 3 restaurant visits, 2 required manager intervention to save the experience. Food was always good, just very delayed or mis-ordered. Location - good for access to the superdome, and for some of the downtown. Not convenient to french quarter, french market, or convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not ready for large conferances”
Reviews.Author: MonkeysMom614
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group as part of the Evangelical Lutheran Church in America's National Youth Gathering. When we were checking in I overheard them tell multiple groups that they had oversold rooms and that others were not yet cleaned for check in. Our rooms (3) were available and we had no problems. Our rooms were very clean and nice. My room however was not cleaned one of the days we stayed. The biggest issue we encountered was that due to the majority of our groups activities being let out at the same time there were major problems with the elevators. The elevators are designed to assign you and elevator based on the floor where you room is. After you are assigned then that elevator will just stop at the floors in which people in the elevator have been assigned. This is not a problem in normal circumstances but it is when large groups are all trying to get elevator assignments then the cars fill up before assignments which causes people to be assigned to elevators with large groups already standing in from of it and people just taking whatever elevator they can get on and then walking up/ down floors. The restaurants were very fast and the pizza was very good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...unconscionable!”
Reviews.Author: donk93953
Reviews.Content: Flew up from Mexico to spend a wonderful night in NOLA! I've been a diamond or platinum member of Hyatt for over 25 yrs. Confirmed my reservation 2 days before arriving. I entered the hotel and was told they had over sold the hotel and I didn't have a room. Management would not come to the front desk. Management left staff to take the brunt of many angry customers. They offered me a room 30 minutes away at the Travel lodge Called Hyatt customer relations, they couldn't believe it. Front desk manager appeared to talk with his staff. I alerted Hyatt on the phone..."we want to talk with him"..manager said, he wouldn't..."I have nothing to tell them any different..." and made a hasty exit. Interesting that Hyatt NOLA new they were over-sold 3 days before my arrival. If upon entering, Hyatt would have said they were oversold and had already booked us a room of equal quality at another hotel, we would have been fine. After a 2.5 hr wait. They offered us a bed in a 2 star hotel...we missed our dinner reservations. The good news, Hyatt paid $60 for our room and we got 2 taxi vouchers! I'm questioning my 25 yrs of loyalty to Hyatt. Anyone have the phone number for the Ritz Carlton

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel & lousy customer service”
Reviews.Author: Travelsalot76
Reviews.Content: I am staying here one night for work. I got to my fancy room on the 26th floor and it was dirty. There were multiple hairs of different types in the sheets. The toilet seat had pee spots on it and the bowl was dirty. The carpeted floor has nail clippings and other dirt in it. Less importantly, there was a half-empty water bottle in the fridge and dirty glasses for use. I called downstairs when I got to my room at 11:50. There were no rooms available to switch to and only one housekeeping person who was 'very busy right now.' The manager obviously didn't care and didn't return my call to inquire about changing rooms. The housekeeping manager Terrence was kind and professional enough to help with my problems. He seems to be the only person employed here that cares about guests. But it was still 12:40 when my room was cleaned (50 minutes after arriving at the room.) My key card expired prior to my sheduled checkout time today so I wasted an additional 15 minutes taking care of that with a front desk person who said 'she knows' when I told her about my room problems and poor response from management. I would never spend the money to stay at this hotel that only seems very nice on the outside.

Reviews.Title: “great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kay H
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. It is within walking distance of downtown and also Bourbon Street. The views out of the upper floors of the SuperDome are amazing especially at night. BUT the most important asset are the employees. They are exceptionally friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility -- but service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: Steve V
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the Superdome in a nice location. If you are looking for a place to stay and are unconcerned about service, I would recommend this hotel. However, if service is a requirement for you, I would go elsewhere. I arrived at 2:30 and was told my room wasn't ready. Two hours later, since the check-in time had come and gone, they let me check into a room on the "club floor". I'm not sure why this room was called the club floor as it didn't seem any different than other floors. My wife and I were staying three nights. After two nights, our small bottles of shampoo and body wash were empty. We left them on the counter thinking housekeeping would replenish them with new bottles. No such luck. We had a function that evening and had to call down multiple times to get them delivered to our room. On top of that, housekeeping hadn't left any fresh wash clothes or towels (but had taken our used ones). On our checkout day, I made the mistake of leaving some articles of clothing in the room. I realized my mistake after arriving home. We called and left messages, were promised by the front desk that someone would go check the room, etc. Five days later, we received an e-mail from the operations manager stating that they hadn't found anything in the room -- so sorry. -- This could be a 4 or 5 star property with the appropriate service levels, but the poor service lowers my overall score to a 2.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lone_Traveler777
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for few nights on a trip to NOLA. The hotel is very modern decorated and all facility is impressively equipped with latest technology. I didn't get a chance to dine there so I cannot comment much on food/service but overall it is a great hotel. It is not too far from downtown as well but it might be too far to walk in a summer day. I will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iamathew
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt was hosting a conference I attended so the first three days of my stay were for business and then my husband flew down and we stayed there for the weekend. This really is a beautiful hotel. The food was good. There were many different places to get a drink or sit down for a minute. Everything was clean and pretty. Every Hyatt employee I encountered was very friendly and very helpful. My room was really nice and very clean. The walkways to the rooms on every floor are open to the big atrium which is really cool and when there is music playing, it travels up and is really nice. There's also a great view of the Superdome from the elevators. I would have to say my only complaint about my experience is about the elevator system. They have a modern, high-tech elevator system in which you wave your room key card at a station, it registers what floor you are on and then tells you which elevator to stand in front of. When you get on the elevator, there are no buttons to push as the elevator "knows" which floor you want to go to. This worked fine and was no big deal (kind of fun even) for most of the time. However, it was a gigantic nightmare during the conference when a thousand people would get out of the conference and need to get up to their rooms to get ready for the evening event and get back down. It seemed there was some sort of malfunction or overload and the elevators were not coming and the line to "check in" to the elevator was getting longer and longer. One night I had to walk up to my room (10th floor) because I was in danger of not getting back down in time for transportation to the night event. But this was really my only complaint. I very much enjoyed my stay at this Hyatt. We had no trouble getting anywhere around to the touristy spots since it was just a short walk (a couple of blocks) to a streetcar line which is a fun way to get places and really affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice mega-hotel”
Reviews.Author: salbolt
Reviews.Content: I'm not usually a fan of huge convention hotels, but I enjoyed my stay at the Hyatt Regency New Orleans. + decor is sparklingly new and very chic. + excellent buffet breakfast in the atrium. + great dinners at Borgne restaurant on the ground floor and a good happy hour there from 5pm-7pm. - pool is adjacent to massive, industrial strength fans (from the hotel's AC system, perhaps?), so it's not a relaxing experience to lie out by the pool - cleaning staff threw out things in my room that were neatly arranged on a side table (magazines, newspapers, news clippings, mardi gras beads) - no bath, shower only, in my room

Reviews.Title: “Modern and plush”
Reviews.Author: brboze
Reviews.Content: We visited here as a family of 3 when my husband had a conference in the hotel. While much of the hotel is clearly geared toward the business traveler, there is plenty of fun to be had by kids and families as well. The room was comfortable and spacious (though the bathroom was a bit small by usual hotel standards), and the housekeeping service was friendly and quick whenever we made a request. My three-year-old and I really enjoyed the pool area, which was large with plenty of chairs, towel service, and cabanas, and was never overcrowded. A real plus of the pool here is that it is shaded for much of the day, thanks to the multiple tall buildings surrounding it (the pool is on a 5th-floor deck). The hotel has a lot of modern enhancements, including "smart" elevators that whisk you to your floor after waving your room key at a keypad in the elevator bank. We had a view of the Superdome from our 20th-floor room, which was interesting at night with all the colored lights that changed constantly. Valet service for the car was pricey at $40 per night, and the valet worker we talked to actually fudged by saying they would be responsible for the car (as opposed to self-parking at $27), when the valet ticket clearly stated that they are not responsible for the car, but I guess that's to be expected. Their are several restaurants within the hotel, and while they are a bit expensive, they were first rate, especially the awesome breakfast buffet at 8 Block and the John Besh restaurant Borgne on the first floor. All in all, we'd highly recommend this place, especially if you can find a deal on the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great service extended to all who pass through”
Reviews.Author: glmarketingdude
Reviews.Content: Great location, away from clamor of the French Quarter, yet close enough to be a starting point for many Big Easy adventures. Beautiful design, well appointed, fun 3rd floor "lounge" lobby with restaurant and cocktail services. A Starbucks on the 2nd floor, (Yes they accept SB card and are normally priced as any 'Bucks!). More places to eat in the area surrounding this hotel. The Quarter - we supped at Mr. B's Bistro one night, then traveled uptown to the quiet, but "too die for", Brigtsens. The Hyatt's spacious and well appointed room was a welcomed resting sight for the pace that is uniquely New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Decor, Clean Room, But Didn't Feel at "Home"...”
Reviews.Author: KPat1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at they Hyatt Regency New Orleans for 4 nights on business. In general the stay was OK. My room was spacious, clean and nicely decorated. The bathroom was small. The bathroom products were nice. The bed was very comfortable. The view was nice. What was missing were a coffeemaker, a fridge was present, but no microwave. The property is very large, getting to and from the room took some navigating. There was no free wifi, which was terrible! There are too many other hotel options, not to offer free wifi, especially for guest attending conferences. We ate at one of the restaurants/bars in the hotel (started with a V). We had pizza which was not good, the drinks were expensive. We at the BBQ joint in the hotel which was delicious! And reasonably priced. It's also a little far from the French Quarter. Although, I appreciated the clean room & comfortable bed; don't think I would stay here again. The amenities available did not meet my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Expected much more from a hyatt”
Reviews.Author: harshagc
Reviews.Content: Expected much more from from a hyatt. The common area is fun and nicely made up. But my room did not live up to the expectation. It was just plan. The bath was small. The only good bit I thoroughly enjoyed was the Starbucks. And yes if you are in New Orleans do visit the French Quarter and Pat O' Brian's. The alligator bites are a must.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Wherever the cheap fares take me
Reviews.Title: “Disappointing series of incidents (later remedied), otherwise decent stay”
Reviews.Author: antonius66
Reviews.Content: The following is a review I posted immediately after my stay. I originally gave the property 2 stars based on my experiences, but they took it upon themselves to reach out to me after I completed the standard post stay email survey I received. They went out of their way to address the issues and take care of me, so I felt it only right to remove the original 2 star review and replace it with a more accurate sentiment based on my feelings overall after their post stay actions. Below is the original review, as I still do not think that the original review should disappear, as my reasons for my dissatisfaction still happened, but I also don't think it is fair to ding a hotel online and not adjust it for any followups they take later to fix the problems or address customer dissatisfaction. I wish Tripadvisor let you update reviews. I booked 2 rooms here for 3 days on a Hyatt promo rate, which included free breakfast every day for 2 people and the 3rd night free. I booked both rooms in my name and got one for myself and wife, and one for parents. Upon arrival, the hotel was super busy, and check in was fairly slow. There were numerous people standing in line, and there was a Diamond/Platinum check in line, but it was not being staffed by any of the 3 people at the counter. When we checked in, the gentleman who checked us in was very pleasant and accommodating, although he did take quite a while to process the check in. I won't really fault him, as he was, as mentioned, very nice and did his best to handle it properly. The hotel itself is pretty nice...it looks newly renovated and has a lovely spacious lobby with a variety of art. One thing that is strange...to get to the rooms, you have to go up 2 flights of stairs (escalator or elevator is available) and then walk past a few restaurants to get to the room elevators. The elevator system is kind of confusing at first, and a little inconvenient. The room was nice enough, as it was a basic room. It had a flat screen TV and a comfortable enough bed, although the pillows left much to be desired (more on that...). The bathroom was large and spacious and the shower had satisfactory enough pressure and the water was very soft. Overall, just considering those factors, I would say the stay would have been a 4 star stay, since it was a pretty nice hotel, with a comfortable enough room and was well located enough...but then the problems began. First off, there was a bottle of Aquafina in the closet, on a tray with 2 glasses next to it. There was NO label, NO price tag, NOTHING to indicate the water was not complimentary (as MANY quality hotels provide 1 bottle of water free). We consumed this bottle to find out later it was not free. Second, after a miserable night trying to sleep with the pillows which were too firm for us, we asked if there were other pillows. The front desk said they had some foam pillows and they would send some up. That never happened. I had to call again later that night, several hours later, because they never brought them the first time. Third, we went down to the restaurant for the buffet breakfast which was included in the promo rate and had to wait about 15 minutes. Now, this alone would not be an issue, but when we got in the restaurant, there was literally about 40% vacant tables. We asked why it took so long and why people were kept waiting and they said they lacked the staff to handle it, although our server, polite and friendly as he was, looked like he was bored and trying to find stuff to do. On a busy holiday weekend on a Sunday, they should have staffed better if that was the problem. However, I will say the breakfast was very good and for the $21 sticker price, it would be a very good value as hotel breakfasts go. Fourth, we had a very early flight on the departure day, so we went to the front desk to check out and make sure everything was handled the night prior. When I got the bill for the first room, I found a $4 charge for the bottle of water we used...although it was charged to the OTHER room I had. That room did not even HAVE a bottle placed in it at any time, although my parents later showed me a $4 tag that said "hydrate" which they found in THEIR room, but without any bottle of water. That tag was missing from my room. Next, they charged me for breakfast on one of the 2 days, which I had to have taken off. Now, they took it off, but that irritates me...I hate hotels where I have to analyze every corner of the bill for stuff like that. Next, I noticed a tax charge on the breakfast, and was told by the front desk that the breakfast was free, but the gratuity PLUS THE TAX was not. They charged me the added gratuity I put on it (thats fine..although many hotels cover that as well) AS WELL AS the sales tax??? Seriously? I have never heard of anything so ludicrous...the breakfast is free, but hey you owe us $3.22 for tax? Pathetic. Fifth, I asked twice at check out if I needed to request a taxi for the next day or if there would be one waiting. I was assured there are ALWAYS taxis ready, which was important because when you are already getting up at 2am to get to the airport on time, every bit counts. Of course, when we went to get the taxi the next morning, they had to call one, which took another 15 minutes, and we ended up with a DIFFERENT cab, which happened to show up by chance, not even the one they called. Unreal again. Overall, the service was friendly, the room was decent (nothing great, but not bad), and the breakfast was very good. However, no attempt was even made or offered to remove the $4 for the water which was NOT labelled and even charged to the WRONG room, one mistake or bout of incompetence after another just really marred the stay. We paid $340 plus taxes ($390 total) for 3 nights with 2 breakfasts, but based solely on this experience, I would not stay here again. However, they did reach out to me after I completed my survey via email about my stay and addressed my complaints and refunded me the water charges. Overall, I would say that based on the customer service post stay and the overall quality of the hotel itself when subtracting out the complaints, I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Shiney & New but lacking”
Reviews.Author: miechy
Reviews.Content: It isn't any one thing that earned this a 3 star but a hotel like the Hyatt has high expectations. The lobby is huge and uninviting. The colors are severe. The elevator set up is weird and can be really annoying if its very busy. You call an elevator and it directs you to a, b, c, etc depending on your floor. That elevator is full sometimes. Do you call another one? wait? Regular elevators are fine:this is a ain't broke don't fix it issue. Conference facilities were impressive, lighting, video, sound, all top notch, though I was an attendee not a presenter. Didn't eat at any of the establishment in-house as we chose to go out. Front desk and Concierge service was fine. Food service was a little lacking. Ran out of eggs at breakfast. One day all the signs describing what was on the buffet table were wrong. Totally wrong. Internet is pricey, I used the free Wi-fi thru the conference. Taxis are abundant. Location is good though a hike to the east French Quarter. Rooms were small. Not sure I had a "REspite" room but I woke with a stuffy nose and puffy eyes daily so they can't be too hypo-allergenic.

Reviews.Title: “Respire Room ~~~ A Step in the Right Direction”
Reviews.Author: ProKenneth
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my recent overnight stay at the Hyatt Regency New Orleans. I've never been one to go on about staying at a Hyatt, but noticed they had Respire, "Allergy Friendly" rooms and had to check it out. As far as the actual room goes, it was comfortable and well appointed, though small. But the allergy free factors helped make it wonderful, and I'll be sure to plan on such stays in the future. I cannot begin to say how many times I've had to check out of hotels shortly after checking in, due to allergic reactions to something or other. Whether it's chemicals in the carpet, gallons of air freshener or carpet refreshing dust, etc., etc., which all starts in with watering, itchy eyes, headaches, tightness of chest and wheezing, some of us just have to plan ahead and make sure we're getting an allergy/asthma friendly room. This Respire trend is helping a lot! Even the soaps and shampoos were hypoallergenic, so there were none of the irritations which can go with that. And the Healthway air purifier worked wonders with particulate removal. I'm not sure whether or not it emits/removes ozone and gasses or not. However, this is a major step in the right direction for anyone suffering with respiratory allergies, reactive airway disease/asthma, I will definitely recommend this to everyone I know who suffers with any of the above. Other factors in the hotel are a super friendly and helpful staff, who went out of their way to make everything comfortable and easy. Though, the refrigerator in the room did not work, and when I went to turn off the TV later at night, it would not shut off and a technician had to come up to fix it. While that went fairly quickly, it did involve getting dressed again when I would rather have been in bed sleeping. They seemed to act as if this were a common occurrence, so, if you're TV is having an issue at all, such as not being able to connect to room service to complete your order (no comment,) don't do what I did and ignore it, thinking everything is fine. Call early and tell the desk you believe there's an issue with the PC card on your TV. While the food is typically pricey, it's no higher than comparable establishments. There is also a Rouse's Supermarket only two blocks away which is quite safe to walk to, and which has a great selection of foods, deli items, wines, beers, liquors, all at much more normalized prices. All in all, it was a great stay and I would definitely recommend the Respire room to anyone interested in it.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Warner0188
Reviews.Content: The renovations made to this hotel are absolutely gorgeous! The rooms were perfectly clean and very well appointed. The decor is luxurious but not stuffy. The staff went out of their way to help with anything from directions,dining suggestions to hailing cabs and carrying luggage. We got a great room rate through Priceline and would love to stay here again. Other cool things: workout room on 32nd floor has a panoramic view of entire city. Pool has great cabanas with full lounges at no charge. Views from elevators of the Superdome. Location is walkable to French Quarter but it's borderline. If you don't enjoy a long stroll take a cab. Not so cool: must use valet to park on the property at $40 per day (we used the public lot one block away for $12/ day) Food and drink is pricey. Breakfast buffet was $21pp. We chose to eat at local authentic restaurants instead.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanetFincher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a bit overwhelming at first. It's huge. Very modern. It take two escalators to get to the main bank of elevators, but not a bad trek past very cool futuristic bars and restaurants. Banked seating with TVs, glass shelf see-through walls, large dominant forms. The art was good. The elevator banks are dialpad--you tell it where you want to go and a computer voice assigns you an elevator. A little sci fi , but I liked it. Glass elevators are still the traditional Hyatt high rides up a track. Nice views. Half look into the atrium, the other half the Superdome. Main restaurant/bar sits at the bottom of the 27-story atrium, awesome. The breakfast buffet is there, expensive at $21 but a nice selection (plus omelet bar). I give the staff high marks for hospitality and helpfulness. There is a Starbucks for a quick coffee (soul music soundtrack). The business center was set up for boarding passes. My room was comfortable, well-furnished. Loved the bed. They added a little extra security at the ends of the double horseshoe hallways with a keyed vestibule. End rooms have a corner view too. All in all, the only drawback is the long walk to the French Quarter. I mentioned to the desk clerk that a hotel of that magnitude might run a shuttle and they told me they plan to have a shuttle in the near future. The only other improvement they could make is to add some life and color to the atrium. Do a light show. Hang a super mobile. Show movies on the ceiling. Right now it's a bit severe. One of my fellow passengers in the elevator thought it had all the warmth of the Death Star. Still, for a ginormous convention hotel, it's very classy and the staff rocks. To a person, they were all friendly, helpful and cheerful.

Reviews.Title: “Undue bad rap for location. Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravels710
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review after returning to this hotel at about 10:00 pm... And I must say that the negative reviews of this place in regards to its location now seem a bit exaggerated after having done a night ( albeit early ) walking to Bourbon myself. Even with construction, I felt totally safe returning to the building on Loyola after dark. Please don't let a few bad experiences dictate the overall perception of this beautiful property. I know I had a knot in my tummy after receiving my Priceline bid acceptance and reading the reviews for this Hyatt adjacent to the Superdome, but seriously, I don't understand. The French quarter and Riverwalk areas are totally walkable for anyone in good health, and the hotel itself is truly gorgeous (if not a bit overindulgent and cavernous in some spaces). Scary, it is not. Please don't fear this area as it is really VERY nice, though a bit fun to navigate to through the current Loyola construction by car. The elevators were no problem for us, even post-Bourbon. The architecture and surroundings, especially at night, are gorgeous and a very cool modern contrast to the old-world feel just a few blocks away. Check in was a breeze, very friendly staff and a very speedy explanation of how to get to our room. I couldn't be more pleased. I guess I should also mention that we ended up on floor 17 of the main tower... No trouble with the AC noise mentioned by other guests. 5 star experience at a 3 star price courtesy of Priceline, though I wouldn't hesitate to book here through property website in the future.

Reviews.Title: “a bit lacking for the price”
Reviews.Author: MzLadybug
Reviews.Content: ok so what is the deal with no coffee in the room? I guess they want you to go down into the lobby and buy from the starbucks? No, thank you... The layout is a bit confusing and there is really no one there to help you to find the elevators (up the escalator two flights and pass the bar then around the corner) when you check in on a busy friday. If i werent for the self check in and out kiosks, then this place would be unbearable. If people are going to New Orleans for the southern charm and hospitality, then this is not your best bet. The room was ok..will bring my own small coffee pot next time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: ecuamajo
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff is extremely friendly, clean, overall is a really nice hotel. It'll take you good 15-20 minutes to get to Bourbon St. The only bad thing is the construction going on right in front of the hotel, it makes it a little hard to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience to date”
Reviews.Author: kayceez
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveler. Mostly for work. As stated by other reviewers, yes this is a large hotel. Running down to the front desk will take you a good 10 mins. But man is it a gorgeous & scenic walk. Everything is very high tech & the decor is amazing. The location itself is off the beaten path a bit but if you don't mind a little walking then you won't need a car. 10-15 mins by foot to Canal and Bourbon street. 30ish to the French Market area (which was our FAV) part of town. The rooms were spacious & beautifully decorated. The bed is VERY comfortable. The highlight for me though was the service. Everyone was incredibly friendly and really made us feel 5 star. Special shout out to our bellman Johnathan. This guy deserves a promotion! He took at least 20 mins to explain the city to us, making recommendations on places to go, where to eat & much more. He was just amazing. My company will be holding the same conference again next June and I'm already looking forward to it. This was my 1st trip to NOLA and this might very well be the only hotel I ever stay at. The bar was raised just that high....

Reviews.Title: “Okay ... if someone else is paying the bill”
Reviews.Author: galuppi
Reviews.Content: In brief: Bad stuff - no free wifi, small room, small bathroom, noisy AC, slightly dodgy neighbourhood. Good stuff - extraordinarily helpful staff, delicious fresh fruit at the breakfast buffet, good conference facilities. We were there three nights on business. My overriding impression is a hotel with staff taking a lot of trouble to make guests comfortable, but hotel systems and services that don't work very well. We arrived very late at night and were allocated a room on the 17th floor. Judging by comments from other guests and other TripAdvisor reviewers, we must've had a smaller than average room. The slight lack of room space didn't trouble us, but the bathroom really was cramped and there wasn't enough desk space for a laptop and a notepad. The worst sin (in my opinion) is a 'business' hotel that charges $45 dollars plus taxes for three days of wifi access! And then it's only for three devices. So once the laptop, blackberry and iPad are connected, you then have to force off one of those devices with an IP logout to log in with the second smart phone. Or pay even more! The air conditioning system was extremely noisy. Louder than a window unit each time it roared into life. Loud enough to cause me to use earplugs to sleep. Loud enough to cause us to switch the AC off when making telephone calls. It was LOUD. And that wasn't just our room. Others complained too. The location is fine for an in-hotel conference and for short forays into the tourist districts. (Or if attending an event at the Superdome which is immediately next door.) It's a ten-minute walk to the edge of the French Quarter, restaurants and the St Charles streetcar. The area felt safe enough to me, especially in daylight, if not a particularly pleasant neighbourhood to wander. But beware, a group of three men was mugged during the conference in the hotel area at night. Of course, this could have been a horribly unlucky incident that could happen in any city, but there is much more of an overt police presence in the French Quarter. The layout of the three lower public floors is very confusing. Obliging staff willingly interrupted what they were doing to escort us to Starbucks, conference rooms, the BBQ place but you have to allow time for getting lost. Once you find where you're going, the myriad conference facilities are excellent. The final snippet I'd offer is for anyone who loves fresh fruit for breakfast. The breakfast buffet is quite pricey as you'd expect for the vast array of food on offer. But the buffet includes the most exquisite selection (which changes daily) of fresh fruit. They also have fruit on the a la carte menu but it's adulterated(!) fruit with sugar and cinnamon and muffins etc. After explaining that I sincerely only wanted a plate of just fresh fruit from the buffet, the restaurant staff came up with a reasonable price for me. It was absolutely delicious and a pleasant place to eat each morning. Oh, I almost forgot ... If you like a super-soft mattress, we had the perfect room! The mattress had an extra-squishy layer on top that made it quite tricky to extract yourself to roll over or get up! Unfortunately I like a firm mattress. Next time I'll be sure to request a firm mattress.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel. Modern, Clean - everything you need”
Reviews.Author: v b
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days for a conference. Easy to get to from the Airport, around $35. There is a lot of construction taking place in the area, but once inside, you do not hear anything. The hotel is very big, and for the first half a day, its confusing, having to take escalators to the 3rd floor, then the lift to your rooms. The lifts have no floor buttons on the inside. You have to use a keypad outside the lift, or simply wave your keycard under the keypad and it will tell you which lift (out of 8) to go to. My room was on the 14th floor, and whilst you could hear atrium noise whilst walking to your room, once the door is closed, everything is fine. The bathroom had plenty of space and a walk in shower - body wash, shampoo etc are all provided. The bedroom itself had a large TV which you can control via the remote or a keyboard. You also get a in-room safe and a fridge. My room had a little sofa, workspace, side table and one of the most comfortable beds I have every slept in. As far as the room goes, the "highlight" for me was actually the way the room was serviced every day - the staff have a sense of pride and went out of their way to tidy things up (even though they were tidy to my standard - they just made it neater) - going the extra mile to delight the client. 2 choccies on the pillow each night was nice too. The room also has an iron and ironing board, 3 drawers and 1 wardrobe with enough space for a weeks worth of clothes. The only thing it did not habe was an in-room coffee maker. Had to go to the starbucks on the 2nd floor for a coffee fix. Onto the other parts of the Hotel - the conference facilities were very very good. lots of flexibility and we never felt cramped. There is a sports bar, which was showing the Euro 2012 matches, so was busy - food was so-so though but the Abita beer made up for it. There is nothing much nearby, canal and bourbon street are a good 10-15 min walk away, but a cab will cost you less than $10 Price we paid was "discounted" and probably too high for me if I was paying it myself Also, no free wifi which is a shame

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nanners2000
