Reviews.Content: We received a deal on this hotel which made the experience even better since it was normally at least twice as expensive as we paid. The hotel is newly renovated and it shows. It's very modern decor and very clean. The rooms were large and very comfortable. The location was excellent, with just a 10 minute walk to canal street and the French Quarter. We drove in from out of town and arrived close to midnight and our key only took the elevator to our floor which was very reassuring (for safety reasons). (During the day, you could get to any floor though.) The gym was spacious and had a really good view from the top floor. The Starbucks downstairs was very convenient. The staff were very helpful...including our valet who advised on one of our possible excursions. Parking, however, was expensive (about $40/night). Overall though, we loved our stay here. I would highly recommend this hotel for it's modern and clean decor, roomy and comfortable rooms, great location and convenience, and wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Modern & BIG & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: topgun151
Reviews.Content: This is a convention style hotel. It is very big. If you don't like to walking too far to your room, would suggest staying elsewhere. That being said, this hotel is very modern with a huge atrium going up around 30+ floors. Would suggest getting a high level to avoid any atrium noise. The elevators are fast and plentiful, so you wont have to wait too long for them. The gym on the 32nd floor is a great "hotel" gym and offers beautiful views of the city while you are running on the treadmill. Walking to the French Quarter is very doable and safe as I did it often. If you are here for an event in the Dome, there is no better location for you to stay, this hotel looks right down on it. Overall, Hyatt did a great job reinvesting back into this hotel after the Katrina damage. The result is a modern, mini-city like hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: MarinaBoy
Reviews.Content: There was no hot water in my room the first night. I called for help and 1 hr later had not heard a response. I called the front desk and they said they forgot to call me back and tell me the engineer said my water was not repairable. Then the engineer showed up 20 min later to say he still had yet to check the water. At that point, we had agreed I would move rooms so I had packed up all of my luggage and had to leave at 11pm. When I moved to the new room, I accidentally broke a glass in my closet. I called to have the glass cleaned up twice and no one ever came to clean up the glass the entire week I was there. On the third day, there was a fire alarm test on my floor that I was not notified about. I had gone up to do a conf call for work, and no one came to turn off the speaker in my room - the speaker was blaring. On the last night, we had dinner in the seafood restaurant off the lobby. One of the restaurant workers who was in the women's restroom came in, used the faclities, and left without washing her hands. I would never stay or recommend staying in this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and noisy”
Reviews.Author: reprof
Reviews.Content: A bit quirky for its stars: a 100-foot hike from front desk to escalators, then up two floors and, walking by bar, another 200 feet to elevators to guest rooms. Wi-fi is not freeâ€”which in todayâ€™s world is a good reason to choose another hotel. One of two glasses, a bit hidden in closet, was chipped. No place to hang towels in bathroom. Location near Dome felt isolatedâ€”not much nearby; it is a bit of a hike to Canal Street, French Quarter, etc. Air conditioner (heat pump) in room is noisy; I had to turn it off in order to sleep. Stylish but not very comfortable or convenient.

Reviews.Title: “NOISE”
Reviews.Author: Yellowlab3944
Reviews.Content: AtRium design plus concert means all sound reverberates upwards. It's Friday night in New Orleans, but if I wanted loud music I'd go out. Hotel staff not interested in doing anything about incredible noise. On 15th floor I was awaken at midnight by lobby concert.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: Derrick W
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very upscale. Room was extremely clean and modern. The only drawback to this hotel is the parking. $42 per day, However, there is an overnight Central Parking Lot located a block up. I paid $30 for 3 day pass....I was very thankful...The hotel is a $7 cab ride to the French Quarter. Great getaway

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Ricocas
Reviews.Content: Very Large Facility. Check in was Very Quick and I was giving complimentary items. Room was Clean and very nice with a great view of the Superdome. The Hotel sushi restaurant was Nice surprise. Very Pleased and will stay here again for sure. My only complaint is the circle drive hotel entrance was always filled with vehicles. I intercepted the valet @ the street to avoid getting stuck in the circle drive traffic. The young lady @ the Front desk was very polite and made us feel very welcomed - Thanks for that & the comp items.

Reviews.Title: “Seeing Was Believing...Unfortunately for the Hyatt”
Reviews.Author: SavvyTraveler50
Reviews.Content: I am a Hyatt Gold member and despite having read the reviews, just couldn't believe what guests were saying. Well, seeing believes. Our check-in went quickly and without incident. Although the guests do have to go up a couple of escalators and past the restaurants to the elevator, we did not find that a problem. Our room was actually quite attractive. Accordingly, on first blush my husband and I thought that in fact, the very negative reviews of the hotel were undeserved. Well, when we turned on the air conditioning, it is fairly loud. TO be fair, it does not sound like a "jet engine", but does sound like one of those cheaper box fans you buy from almost any store that carries fans. The air also blows so hard it seems like a kind of wind machine is on in the room. However, the biggest problem is that it STILL doesn't cool the room. The thermostat read 71 degrees, but my husband and I were so uncomfortable and we figured out that it was because the air conditioning system was not taking the HUMIDITY out of the room. The lobby is very cool and dry, so I can't figure out why they can't cool the rooms. We were in room 2033 if you are taking room notes. Worst of all, our room was never cleaned. We stayed Friday night to Monday morning. When we arrived, the room looked clean. We left the room at 9:30AM Saturday morning and did not return until just before 5:00PM. Our room had not been cleaned. We were told the staff could come back at around 7:30PM. We re-arranged our dinner plans to be our early enough to have the room cleaned. Someone showed up at 7:00 when we were in the middle of dressing for dinner. Because we were not "ready" to have the room cleaned, we were told we could not get service that day. Sunday we left the hotel at 10:30 for brunch. We came back at about 3:30. The bed was made, but the floor had not been vacuumed. Upon closer inspection, we found that the bathroom had not been cleaned either. How did we figure this out? We had been running late for brunch, so my husband did a quick shave over the sink and didn't think to rinse it out. The beard stubble that he'd tapped out of the shaver was still in the sink. Towels were still in the bath tub where we'd left them to ensure we got a clean set. There is almost no excuse for not servicing room at all; there is absolutely NO EXCUSE for pretending to service a room by making the bed, but not doing the basic of rinsing out the sink and tub. This review is also posted under Frequent diner1 *************************************************************************** I called down and the front desk gave me a one night credit, but there is no way to come back from this one. Finally as many have noted, there is no vending because they have a little sundries store on the second floor. This is the most expensive sundries store I have ever seen in a hotel and that is saying a lot! A granola bar that was less than an ounce (trial size) was $1.49; a regular size granola bar was $3.00. Because of the location, there is nothing else for small purchases around (closest pharmacy/walgreens/cvs is about eight really hot blocks away). Give me a break Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “Pricy Hotel - Beautiful, but FAR Away from Downtown”
Reviews.Author: PerkiAngel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled April 12-16. I planned the trip and booked our hotel using priceline (which I will never use again). I was given the room at a discount, which was still better than some of the other prices around, but the hotel was far away from everything we wanted to see and do. For this hotel being so upscale, I would have thought they would have more perks for their customers. My first disappointment was finding out that they offered no hotel shuttle to and from the airport. For the cost of the rooms and everything else located in this hotel, you would think that would be the least they could do. My next disappointment was in the room itself. Upon arrival, we had to wait about a half an hour to get checked into our room. The trip up to the elevators was not terrible, but it was confusaing to figure out the elevators at first. Also, no one told us that if you go up to the work out room after 10:30p.m. (I think that was the time) you can't go back down to a lower floor unless you have your room key for the elevator. The air conditioner was loud as stated by many other reviews but it helped drown out the loud children in the room next to us. Looking out our window, we had the view of the lovely city block which was very disappointing. If you want a nice view, the Dome is at least pretty to look at with the colors changing, make sure you request a room on that side. Another main point of disappointment is that I did not feel that the staff did enough to inform of us how things worked and events going on in the hotel. I think that upon checking in we should have been told that there is a buffet breakfast available every day in the one hotel restaurant. They also had live entertainment that we were never informed of either. We wanted to rent a car and told the staff that was what we wanted to do. No one ever told us we should rent it the night before because there may not be one available on the same day we wanted it. Once we rented the car it took us over a half an hour to have someone get the vehicle for us which was parked right in front of the hotel until a valet took it to the parking garage after he was given the key and told to bring it up to the door. It was a real trial of patience on our part. The rooms were beautiful and well decorated and the beds were very comfortable. However, for people who are staying for a period of time, there is no place for you to put your clothes, no drawers. There is a wardrobe that has a few hangers and three shelves (one of which has the ice bucket and glasses stored). The bathroom was also a disappointment in that it had no shelf storage either. Your hand towel had to lay on the sink top over the edge to dry. There was a music fest going on when we were there and, according to the news, this was the next largest group of visitors since Mardis Gras. Since we were so far away from everything, we tried a cab on our first night (why the hotel doesn't offer a shuttle is beyond me). It took us twenty minutes to go about twelve blocks and twenty dollars for the ride as the cab driver twisted and turned every which way but the way we really had to go to get to our destination (quite the scam). The next day we decided to get a three day transportation pass that can be used on any trolleys, busses or shuttles. It did come in handy, but if you were not at one of the first stops, you ended up standing because of the number of people getting on and off. Also, because of the number of people, it took longer riding the trolley than it did to walk while in the main part of town. We know because we did this one evening when we were waiting for the trolley and it was taking forever to get to us, so we started walking. The last night we were there was the only night I felt unsafe as we walked from the main street to our hotel because we walked past the library where there were about two dozen homeless people settling in to sleep. There were a few small groups gathered in different areas and when there are mobs like that and you are in a strange place you have never been, a little voice inside you starts to get a little paranoid. All turned out okay, but it was a somewhat scary situation to be in with no police or other people like us walking around. If you want to stay in a hotel that is pretty and costly with no perks and far away from everything, then this is the place for you. Otherwise, there are many other nice places to stay in town.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed!”
Reviews.Author: Janice S
Reviews.Content: We had heard that this hotel was high-tech, and we weren't disappointed. From the valet staff, front desk clerks, and other staff, each responded to our "lost" looks and requests. Our "city-view" room was very plush, with windows on two sides and a triangular dressing room! While attending our two-day convention, we had opportunity to eat in nearly all of the restaurants. I was "wowed" by having a personal message on the "already-turned-on" television when we entered the room. When I checked out via the television, it turned off to our access! The meeting rooms were not too cold and provided plenty of room for our Plexus organization. Other groups were also meeting at the hotel on other floors, and not once did we feel crowded by them.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it even at a discount.”
Reviews.Author: richard l
Reviews.Content: We went down to New Orleans in April 2012 for a weekend getaway. We stayed at the Hyatt on a priceline deal. When we got there, the hotel was newly renovated, which seemed promising, however, everything else was sub-par. For starters, the layout of the hotel was inconvenient and confusing. After checking in, you had to go up two escalators and walk a horseshoe around the hotel just to get to the elevators to the rooms (this was because of a redesign in light of katrina). When we got to the room, the refrigerator didn't work and the TV didn't work. In order to even turn the TV off, we had to unplug it from the wall. Before you say, "he was an idiot and didn't know how to use the remote," I'll tell you that a) I am extremely electronically inclined and b) my buddy who was traveling with his wife who is an engineer with a degree from GA Tech also couldn't make it work. Our friends that we traveled with had the same problems. Add to this the front desk being rude to us when we complained and the space-age elevators (digital keypad outside the elevators to choose your floor before entering the elevator which then directed you to one of the eight elevators) broke down so that only one elevator was working, and it was not a great experience. The hotel has been open for over six months since the renovation, so you'd think they would have worked out the kinks by now. Fail. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jebredar
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend the Hyatt Regency New Orleans @ 601 Loyola Avenue. The hotel is approximately 15 to 20 minute walk to the French Quarter. If you walk, there are bars along the route which offer a place to cool off from the heat with plenty of choices of refreshments. Try a Hurricane!! If you choose, take your beverage along for the walk, alcohol is permitted. A taxi from the Hyatt Regency to the FQ is only $6.50 + tip. The hotel itself offered a great first impression. It began with the friendly door man opening the taxi door, to the eye catching main lobby area with lots of seating, a circular grand staircase, chandeliers, piano, and escalators. The service at the front desk was quick and friendly on Thursday at 5:30 p.m. Friday night on the Memorial Day long weekend was extremely busy with line up. We asked for a room with a view. We were given room 2102 which looked directly upon the Superdome. The tv had a personal welcome greeting. We had 2 comfortable queen beds with various pillows, mini bar fridge & safe, the bathroom was clean and the shower accessories were lovely. Our stay included a complimentary breakfast each morning. The restaurant is full service. We had the choice of having the buffet or ordering from the menu. We chose the buffet which was $20.95 which as I said was complimentary. The buffet included a custom omelette station with lots of meat, veggie and cheese options; a hot food station with extensive choices such as scrambled eggs with cheese, several choices of bread puddings with warm caramel and chocolate sauces for drizzling, oatmeal, grits, bacon, alligator sausage, warm fresh biscuits, thick sliced ham with sauce; cold cereal bar; salad station with greens, dressings, sesame seeds, dried cranberries etc.; fresh cut fruit (melons, pineapple, strawberries, grapes); yogurt with side of strawberries, raspberries, blueberries & blackberries; a station with various cheeses (smoked gouda, goat etc), various deli meats, baby dills, etc. I've surely missed many items from the buffet but you get the picture. It was extensive and one of the best I've had in North America. Back to our stay, the elevators were unique with respect to operation. Our room key allowed access to a few floors (21 - where we stayed), the 3rd floor (restaurants) and 5th floor (pool). At the elevator area, there are 8 elevators labelled A - H, you scan your electronic room key on the electronic pad which will activate one elevator for your use. The electronic pad lights up a letter (either A - H) which tells you which elevator to use. Once you're on the elevator, it takes you directly to the floor you are staying on, hence, no buttons to push in the elevator. There were never any lengthy lines or long waits for an elevator. They run efficiently and quickly. Check-out can be completed at the front desk or electronically at terminals located in the lobby. If you had the complimentary breakfast, I would advise checking out at the desk. The reason being that as per hotel policy, breakfast will be billed to your room and deducted at checkout. It is my advice that you check your bill thoroughly before leaving the hotel as it is much easier to correct in person. As a footnote, our bill had not been adjusted. We brought it to the attention of the clerk at the front desk, who was most accommodating and corrected before we left the hotel. There are courtesy terminals in the hotel lobby where you can check flight information and perform an early flight check-in. Final notes: Bourbon Street is lively, especially on Saturday night. For dining, we highly recommend the Red Fish Grill for their crawfish boil. Pricing is very reasonable. The waitress took the time to show me how to take apart a crawfish and which part to each (first timer). Also, Felix's Restaurant @ 739 Iberville St. is family owned and has absolutely the best grilled oysters. Arrive early as you can expect line ups out the door for popular restaurants. Royal Street is a must for those interested in European antiques, estate and fine jewellery collecting.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in chic new hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rene-SanDiego
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is a beautiful modern hotel with a great staff. The hotel was virtually brand new when I stayed there for a conference for a few days. Enjoyed my room, especially the large, comfortable bed with premium bedding. I was very impressed with the service from the start. The employee at the front desk who checked me in was top notch and even came out from behind the desk to give me my room key and explain where my room was and how to use the elevators. Well, she tried anyway. But after a long flight, I guess I didn't think I had to listen that carefully to how to use an elevator. When I got to the elevators I just stepped into one that was available, expecting to wave my room card inside because I recalled that I would need to wave it somewhere. So after my elevator ride to the top floor and down, I discovered that amazingly enough, you need to wave it at a screen OUTSIDE the elevators to see which of the 8 or so elevators will take you to your floor. Really??? Evidently, there are only two hotels in the world with this "incredible" high-tech design and all I can say is Thank God! It seems nearly everyone I talked with during my stay made the same mistake. At least it serves as a conversation piece between hotel guests. (Sorry if I ruined the surprise for you!) I really liked virtually everything else about this hotel. Great food, bars, shops and all the staff I encountered were very helpful and friendly. But if you're hoping to stay in a cozy small hotel or be near the French Quarter, I'd recommend you keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “3.5 star stay during Memorial day ladies weekend”
Reviews.Author: shondad1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, will be a lovely choice for a wedding/reception. Everyone we encountered was very nice and helpful with directions and general information. We were split into two rooms, albeit on the same floor (which was best), on the same side of the hotel, BUT at opposite ends of the floor. My friend and I had a lovely corner room facing the Superdome (which changes colors at night) room 1106 and our other friends had a corner room, rm 1122. We could look out of our windows and wave at each other. The room was nicely decorated, not over done. Comfortable beds. Everything was fine, except housekeeping did not seem to sweep the bathroom, as I saw the same hair on the floor from one day to the next, we were there for three nights. Even though the elevator situation is a bit confusing, it is nice. It tells you which car to take among other things. Not really a complaint, but there is construction right in front of the hotel, which takes away from it. My only complaint about this hotel is the PARKING. I expected one exorbitant amount, however when we arrived I was advised that the rate had increased from $38/night to a staggering $42/night. Yes $42 per night, coming out to around $44 with taxes and they offer valet only. HIGHWAY ROBBERY!!! Ridiculous. Good thing there is the Entergy parking garage attached to the hotel @ $25 for 24hrs. BUT do not lose the ticket or it will be a whopping $100 for a lost ticket. I only stayed here because I bidded on Priceline and this is what I got, but overall I was pleased. My friends enjoyed the Starbucks they have here. They had other things to offer, restaurants, live jazz, an all night gift/snack shop to name a few. I had to use my GPS every night to get back, as (maybe it was just us that lost our bearings) I got turned around in the dark I guess and I don't drink. Next time I will opt to stay out of the CBD/French Quarter/Warehouse/Downtown area. There is more to New Orleans than these areas.

Reviews.Title: “WORSE HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN!!!”
Reviews.Author: SherilleB
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the Hyatt for memorial day weekend May 26, 2012 upon arrival the hotel was overbooked so our reservations were not good. The front desk clerk asked us to come back in 30 mins and she guaranteed us our room, not to mention while in line the front desk staff told 3 other guest who had reservations the same SORRY story, "they overbooked and probably will have to stay at another hotel"....REALLY, VERY POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE for such a pretty hotel. After arriving back @ the hotel, we received our room key to #611...after getting to the room with so many different escalators SOMEONE WAS ALREADY IN THE ROOM, back down the stairs we go again to the front desk. After 3 hours of frustration with checking in to the hotel we receive our room. The valet parking is OVERPRICED not mention you have to wait like 45mins-an hour for your vehicle. This was the WORST experience I've ever received from a hotel. I expect this type of service from a MOTEL 6, but needless to say my stay @ a MOTEL 6 was far better than this....not to mention BETTER & FRIENDLY FRONT DESK CLERKS. Its not the guest fault that the hotel was OVERBOOKED, in ALL REALITY ITS YA'LL(HYATT REGENCY) FAULT.I've even called the assistant manager and haven't received a call back YET!!! I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE!!!! The ONLY good thing i can say was the SUPERDOME view was PRETTY... AGAIN WORST HOTEL I'VE EVER STAYED IN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “"Seeing" Was Believing -- Unfortunately for Hyatt, Bad Rap is Deserved”
Reviews.Author: Frequent_Diner_1244
Reviews.Content: I am a Hyatt Gold member and despite having read the reviews, just couldn't believe what guests were saying. Well, seeing believes. Our check-in went quickly and without incident. Although the guests do have to go up a couple of escalators and past the restaurants to the elevator, we did not find that a problem. Our room was actually quite attractive. Accordingly, on first blush my husband and I thought that in fact, the very negative reviews of the hotel were undeserved. Well, when we turned on the air conditioning, it is fairly loud. TO be fair, it does not sound like a "jet engine", but does sound like one of those cheaper box fans you buy from almost any store that carries fans. The air also blows so hard it seems like a kind of wind machine is on in the room. However, the biggest problem is that it STILL doesn't cool the room. The thermostat read 71 degrees, but my husband and I were so uncomfortable and we figured out that it was because the air conditioning system was not taking the HUMIDITY out of the room. The lobby is very cool and dry, so I can't figure out why they can't cool the rooms. We were in room 2033 if you are taking room notes. Worst of all, our room was never cleaned. We stayed Friday night to Monday morning. When we arrived, the room looked clean. We left the room at 9:30AM Saturday morning and did not return until just before 5:00PM. Our room had not been cleaned. We were told the staff could come back at around 7:30PM. We re-arranged our dinner plans to be our early enough to have the room cleaned. Someone showed up at 7:00 when we were in the middle of dressing for dinner. Because we were not "ready" to have the room cleaned, we were told we could not get service that day. Sunday we left the hotel at 10:30 for brunch. We came back at about 3:30. The bed was made, but the floor had not been vacuumed. Upon closer inspection, we found that the bathroom had not been cleaned either. How did we figure this out? We had been running late for brunch, so my husband did a quick shave over the sink and didn't think to rinse it out. The beard stubble that he'd tapped out of the shaver was still in the sink. Towels were still in the bath tub where we'd left them to ensure we got a clean set. There is almost no excuse for not servicing room at all; there is absolutely NO EXCUSE for pretending to service a room by making the bed, but not doing the basic of rinsing out the sink and tub. I called down and the front desk gave me a one night credit, but there is no way to come back from this one. Finally as many have noted, there is no vending because they have a little sundries store on the second floor. This is the most expensive sundries store I have ever seen in a hotel and that is saying a lot! A granola bar that was less than an ounce (trial size) was $1.49; a regular size granola bar was $3.00. Because of the location, there is nothing else for small purchases around (closest pharmacy/walgreens/cvs is about eight really hot blocks away). Give me a break Hyatt!

Reviews.Title: “New and shiny”
Reviews.Author: Tigerlight206
Reviews.Content: This is a nice new hotel with all the modern conveniences. Expensive valet parking and other "big city big hotel" issues. That said, it's modern, chic, and not horribly priced for what it offers. It is a VERY LONG WALK to the French Quarter and thus plan on paying for cabs and/or hiking a good mile and a half or more (in the heat).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful visit back to New Orleans!!!Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: crazygirl37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went back to New Orleans for Memorial Weekend. Last year we stayed at a bed and breakfast in the Garden District but this visit wanted to stay in a regular hotel.(I like modern were as my husband doesnt care as long as its priced right and clean). We decided to stay at the Hyatt in the Warehouse district and I am so glad we did. This hotel just reopened after being closed for over 5 years after Hurricane Katrina and it was worth the money. Very modern with several restaurant choices and tons and tons of areas in the hotel to get away from everything!!! We had a basic queen/queen room and it was great. If you look at the pics online it looks very much like it. I read a few reviews about check in and housekeeping issues but we didnt have any problems the 3 days we were there. Matter of fact housekeeping in our room was wonderful!!!Tons of fresh towels, new soaps everyday and beds very clean!!! We also ate at the restaurants and vitascope hall restaurant/bar. Pretty good but is a little pricey but not any different from most hotels. We will for sure stay here in the future!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Huge business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fivestargypsytwitter
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was full of business people, having functions. It was like being in a Vegas convention center. The lobby is a long was from the rooms. Great Gym with views over the city. Nice club lounge with great views as well. It is on the fringe of the city and a walk to the french quarter. If your there as a tourist I would stay somewhere else, unless you have diamond status with hyatt

Reviews.Title: “Tech-nical”
Reviews.Author: DeanG697
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency New Orleans for 3 nights for a mixed business and recreation getaway. First and foremost, this hotel is not near the French Quarter, but rather near the Superdome. It is a convention hotel, very large, and obviously caters to that clientele. The hotel rooms are nicely laid out, with very comfortable beds, big flat screen tv, and some high tech extras that you can access through the television. The hotel elevators are hard to get used to, and require some intelligence, which is difficult after returning late from Bourbon St. After a few tries, it comes easy though. The hotel is very clean, but very large. To access your room from the front desk, plan at least 20 minutes. You need to go up two sets of escalators, then figure out the elevator situation, and if you are at the end of the hall (like me) it takes awhile. The food is good, and the concierge room and the bar are great. The view from the concierge room is outstanding, particularly at night. Overall, nice hotel, and nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: InflatableBoat
Reviews.Content: Tried to call repeatedly on the way to find out if they had a shuttle from the train station-- they don't answer the phone. Check-in was a mess. Between the bellboy moving us from line to line, an automatic check-in that didn't work, and incompetant staff, it was an ordeal that should have been streamlined. 2 hours after we went to bed, the smoke alarm in our room went off. Front desk was suppose to send someone but after 15 minutes, it stopped on it's own. 2nd day, called and called to ask where the business center was. When they FINALLY answered, they gave the wrong info. At the aquarium gift shop, we found out we got a hotel discount. Good thing they were on the ball because when we asked about the aquarium at the hotel, THEY never mentioned it. It's not all bad. The cleaning staff is flawless and timely. The giftshop is fabulous, the restaurants are great. The front desk staff ruins it for everyone else though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice renovation”
Reviews.Author: DGR1968
Reviews.Content: All fresh and larger than ever! This place will accommodate a large (100ppl++) meeting. Rooms are nice and the property is chock full of bars and restaurants. Only negatives are thin walls in the rooms and no coffee makers. 15 minute walk to the French Quarter and next door to the Superdome.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but FAR from French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: RoyalCafe
Reviews.Content: Price not bad but unless going to a Saints game must take can to the French Quarter and valet parking over $40.00 a night Very new and hip but long walk from lobby to 2 different escalators to get elevator

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating Stay”
Reviews.Author: MindyKH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for one week surrounding the 2012 Final Four. The renovations to the hotel are lovely but be warned, it stops there...The walk from the lobby to the guest rooms is VERY long. You have to take two escalators in order to access the guest room elevators. We stayed in a corner room with a Super Dome view which was small, especially the bathroom, but nicely appointed. The hotel was totally unprepared for the 100% occupancy which was incredibly frustrating! I felt sorry for the staff that was on duty as they were inundated by confused and frustrated guests. From restaurants not being staffed to serve guests to elevators that were sometimes working and sometimes not (we had to walk 10 flights of stairs one evening to get to our room!) to room service in a supposed 4 star hotel that does not have lunch service...I've never heard of such a thing! To the pool area not opening for the season until most guests had already checked out from the events of the week (the temps were in the upper 80's & 90's the entire time we were there!). They totally missed the boat on this one, it was the premier hotel for one of the premier events in the country and they failed at almost every turn. I suppose if you were to visit when absolutely nothing else was going on in the city you would be fine but I would NOT recommend staying here during a big event in the city...what a shame!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oxanatracyfox
Reviews.Content: We go to New Orleans every year and stay at different good and boutique hotels. This time had 3 nights at Hyatt and 1 at W New Orleans. W was almost 3 times more expensive and seemed like a fancy place to stay!!! And NO, it is not. Terrible service, dirty, smelly and expensive without a reason for it!! Their " roof top pool" is a joke- it fits 5 people maybe:)) and maybe 10 around!!! And Hyatt on the other hand is gorgeous!! Huge, beautiful design, fresh orchids everywhere in the lobby!! Wonderful stuff- super professional, friendly and willing to help!! Rooms are very clean and Rooftop pool is big and clean!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of my life !”
Reviews.Author: maddog6198
Reviews.Content: Worst experience of my life ! I reserved a king room, I got room 2444 which had 2 queens along with a broken toilet, reaked of cigarettes, and someone had urinated on one of the beds. They sent up a maid to confirm "yes, someone peed on the bed". The Manager said they had king room on the 6th floor, when I got there, it was a double queen room # 766. I took this trip as a getaway with my wife and it was a complete and total disappointment. Next time, I'll go to motel 6, at least they change the sheets by the hour !

Reviews.Title: “Great deal using Priceline however'”
Reviews.Author: BobOhio
Reviews.Content: Great deal using Priceline however, parking will not help your savings!! Great place. Should offer free wi fi.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome venue for conference!”
Reviews.Author: RUDisney
Reviews.Content: I reluctantly returned from my trip to the Hyatt Regency for the Service Now Knowledge 2012 conference on Thursday night. I had such a nice stay at this hotel.. First of all, the hotel is HUGE! The elevator situation that people have discussed on here is unfounded. Once you get the lay of the land (not hard to do) the elevator system is the most state of the art that I've seen. I felt more secure knowing that only authorized people could access the guest floors. Yes, I know, someone could sneak on with a real guest, but I never felt unsafe in this hotel. Since this hotel was recently remodeled and reopened, there are virtually no cosmetic flaws. The food served at the conference was very good... especially the crawfish sauce that was served at breakfast one morning. I could have just had a bowl of that! The room was very comfortable and if I had to complain about any part of my experience, it would have been the loudness of the air conditioning. Each time it kicked on, it was loud. I kept turning the TV up and down as the A/C cycled. Not a deal-breaker, but unexpected. I'd recommend this venue for Saints games, since it's right across the street from the Superdome or as a lovely venue that is not in the hustle and bustle of the French Quarter, yet close enough that you can have your cake (or hurricane) and eat (drink) it, too.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel, but maintained very well”
Reviews.Author: bebe624
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights for a conference in April 2012. Yep it's true this hotel is BIG. I liked the big open spaces in the lobby, bar and common areas ... I heard some people complaining that it's a little weird that you need to go up 2 escalators to get to the elevator but come on people it's not stairs. Just hop on and hop off ... no big deal. The elevator was a little confusing the 1st time. You scan your room key and it will tell you what letter elevator to get on. So there are no buttons inside the elevator to select your floor. These are some smart elevators, maybe too smart. All the employees that I dealt with were always very nice, but I think the majority of them were working our conference as well so we might have gotten extra special service for those few days. I woke up one morning and went to the gym located on the top floor. Great view to work out to and all the machines were fairly new. (See my photos) Overall this place looks like it was just remodeled, everything seemed modern and well maintained. All the common areas were nice with lots of places to hang out or to meet someone for a drink. The rooms were average nothing spectacular but definitely was up to Hyatt standards, and my standards :)

Reviews.Title: “Oversold my prepaid, guaranteed room”
Reviews.Author: scott m
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business - multiple cities a week, 100k+ annual airline miles and never have i had as disappointing an experience than this Hyatt. I traveled to New Orleans for a conference, had a supposedly guaranteed, late check-in, pre-paid in full room but when I arrived just before mid-night i was informed they didn't have any rooms left. i give them credit for arranging my stay at another local hotel - but it was a dump, it took almost an hour to sort through, and the manager on duty was literally yelling at cabbies who wouldn't accept the Hyatt voucher to bring me to the next hotel. Worst yet, despite multiple calls to hotel management at the property, no one appears compelled to return my phone call. Hyatt might be a nice chain and i've had good experiences at other locations, but the management and staff at this location needs some serious training on customer service and professionalism.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, minor inconveniences”
Reviews.Author: Upas12
Reviews.Content: the hotel has been recently redone and it looks beautiful. we stayed here for a conference. the only thing weird is that the setup is strange, you have to take 2 separate escalators to the 3rd floor only to transfer to the elevator. the elevators are key activated from the outside, you scan your key and it tells u which elevator to take to the floor. this can be annoying b/c when you come into the hotel you have to keep your key out and if you have a few bags gets inconvenient. the gym was great has all kinds of equipment (kettles, balls, etc) and machines. the restaurant and bar in the hotel was great. the room is simple, nothing crazy. bourbon st is only a 15 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but location”
Reviews.Author: laurapok
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hyatt first weekend of May for Jazz Fest. Stayed 4 nights. Beautiful hotel. Everthing new, nice restaurants, Starbucks on site (love). The hotel is HUGE but the amenities make up for it. Staff was friendly and responsive. Our room was fine, nothing special. Spacious. Air conditioning system is kinda loud as it cycles on, but we got used to it. I was surprised how quiet it was at night! We are light sleepers and were delighted by this. Very soundproof. Elevator system is great and very efficient when it is working. Very secure. The location is a bit out of the way but we did walk to our dinner at Herb Saint. Taxi ride to french quarter was quick. The dinner we had at Borgne was the best we had all week. The spaghetti with oysters was amazing as was the cavetelli with crawfish. Try the duck poppers. Wowee. All in all a nice, fun hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Nikon2kool
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I had a 5 night stay at the Hyatt. We arrived around 1AM and were greeted by very friendly staff. On our way to the room we were surprised with all the action going on in the bars and restaurants inside the hotel. The place was hopping. We were in NOLA for a wedding and it just happened to be the same time as Jazz fest. Because of Jazz fest the prices were higher then usual but thatâ€™s to be expected. ROOM: Our room was very quite and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was a bit small but the quirky part was the way the door opened in the bathroom. It was difficult to get in the shower when the door was open or if there's more then one person in there. House keeping did a good job giving us fresh towels and changing the sheets everyday. They did have one slip up on the last day however. They changed our sheets, made our bed but left the dirty sheets in a pile in the room. The major negative was hotel's Internet situation. They charge $19.95 a day!? In today's day and age that's a little ridiculous. As a whole we didn't spend much time in our room but it would have been nice to use my laptop instead of iPhone the whole time. There were plenty of power outlets for my electronics, which was a plus. HOTEL: The hotel itself is great, it's huge and there's lots going on. The bars and restaurants are very nice. Everything is very new because they remodeled the hotel after the hurricane. The elevators are fancy, you just wave your room key at a sensor and it takes you to the your floor. The bartenders were friendly and made a pretty good drink. TIP: There's a Starbucks on the 2nd floor if you don't want to pay a lot for breakfast. POOL: We sat out at the pool a few times and it was quiet and very relaxing. There are plenty of towels and seats. They even have a waitress you can order food and drinks from and sheâ€™ll bring them right to you. GYM: The gym is great! It's on the top floor and looks out over the whole town. They have state of the art machines and plenty of space. There's lots of water and nice clean hand towels for all to use. It's one of the nicest hotel gyms I've worked out in. LOCATION: The hotel was quick 20-25 minute ride from the airport. It's RIGHT next to the Superdome, which is cool, looking when lit up at night. It's a 10-15 minute walk to Bourbon Street or a 5 minute cab ride. TIP: Always ask the cabbie how much it's going to be before leaving the hotel. If they don't turn their meter on theyâ€™re likely to rip you off. We usually took cabs during the evening and walked during the day. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Hyatt. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the hotel was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully remodelled and convenient to the Superdome”
Reviews.Author: cvdhmd
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just reopened this spring, 5 years after Hurricaine Katrina blew out all the windows. Room was great with a wonderful view of the river. Good internet connection in the room and lots of outlets for all my electronic gear. Superb service. Only quibble is that they could have a few more weight machines.

Reviews.Title: “Fell short on our expectations”
Reviews.Author: angelram75
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed after a two day stay at this hotel. The hotel itself is nice but the room feel very short of our four star expecation. We had a horrible view of trash on top of a building from our "balcony view". There was no free Wifi. There was an option to pay $19.95 per day. The bathroom was very small. The room was average while the hotel itself was very nice. If you want to have access to the French Quarters, this is not a good location. While, we did not mind the 15-20 min walk because we are avid runners others may opt for a closer hotel. Breakfast was good but expect to pay about $50 for buffet breakfast for two. Valet parking was ridicious for over $40 a night. We were overcharged for an extra overnight parking which we were not there. The room was way overpriced for quality and location of the hotel. We will not be returning to this Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price paid”
Reviews.Author: jecguila
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel on a Sunday afternoon around 4:30pm. I tried to check in and was told that my room wasn't ready. They told me that if I gave them my cell phone number, that they would call and it should only be around 20 minutes. An hour later and still no call. I finally went back up to the desk and asked if my room was ready yet. They said it was and I was given my room key. I was at the hotel for a conference, and found the staff working the meals for the conference very friendly and helpful. This is the only reason that I gave this hotel two stars and not one. The other issue I had with this hotel, was that the floor of the bathroom never seemed to be clean. There was a lot of hair on the floor and on the last night there, there were several dead bugs. I wouldn't stay here again even if there was a conference booked here. There is a Drury Inn 3 blocks from here, I would recommend staying there and save yourself some money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kmjr2008
Reviews.Content: I was in town on business and stayed at the Hyatt. The atmosphere of the hotel was great. Staff was very friendly. Very good gym and new equipment to get exercise in AM or PM. Walking distance to French Quarter in daylight and short taxi ride back at night. The hotel bar was great , This being a convention hotel , there was always a good group of people to have conversations with. My room was small , but the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mcollant
Reviews.Content: I am an avid Hyatt customer and stay almost exclusively at their properties. Far and away the Park Hyatt in Paris is my favorite property. I am just returning from a 3 day stay at the New Orleans Hyatt Regency and can say that this is now my favorite property in the US. My stay was fantastic, the hotel is beautiful and the staff was great. My room was spacious with a nice view and the amenities are awesome. The pool was wonderful and if you are lucky enough to be on the Regency club level it is open 24x7. Can't say enough about how great this hotel was.

Reviews.Title: “Good Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimgev
Reviews.Content: We attended a large conference at this hotel. The decor is quite nice. It is obvious that large sums were spent after Katrina to refurbish this property. Located next to the Superdome and within walking distance to the attractions of the French Quarter, the hotel has a lot to offer. The check in and check out processes were smooth and quick. The staff attentiveness was very good. Food at theresuarants and served at confeence evenrts was also very good. The only "difficulties" were in navigating the confusing layout. There was always the "you can't get there from here" problem. Floors were divided so access to certain places could only occur by going up or down and around. A better interior mapping system would be very helpful in trying to find your way around. Despite those challenges, the facilities for the conference were quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Very swish”
Reviews.Author: Tommy Rhino
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews but gave this hotel and the staff the benefit of the doubt as it is still pretty new. Check in was swift and simple. Yes you do have to trek up a couple of escalators and pass by the bars to get to the elevators. The card access system to use the elevators is a bit different, but not difficult once you figure it out. There was a staff member on hand to help those who couldn't. Awesome views of the superdome or the hotel interior depending on which elevator you take. Our room was clean and comfortable. We stayed in a twin double and the beds were the best I had slept in. So much so we never made it out before late morning! The hotel is definitely geared up for conferences and I'd seen people whinging on previous reviews about the location in relation to the French quarter. So what? It took us a leisurely 15mins to walk there whilst soaking up the nice weather. On the way back we stopped at an Irish bar (Happy's) for some light refreshment and free WiFi. Location wasn't a problem and there were plenty of cabs if you were too lazy to walk.

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: jessilynn28
Reviews.Content: It's sort of ironic that I stayed at this hotel prior to hurricane Katrina. It has changed quite a bit since the last time my husband and I stayed at this hotel. However, I'm not sure all the changes were for the better. The hotel itself is nice and clean. However, the layout is very confusing and weird. You have to either take an elevator or escalator, then walk quite a distance, to access the hotel room elevators. It is quite a distance to get from the check in desk to your room. They use an electronic hotel key card system for their hotel room elevators, which is very confusing. The idea is great for security purposes, but a lot of guests seemed confused including myself. The hotel rooms are nice and clean. The beds were comfortable. I was happy to see a fridge in the room. The bathroom was standard size. I would have preferred the bathroom be a little bit larger and have a ventilation fan, but overall it was a nice bathroom. The check in process was fairly normal and was fast, but we did get there at a slow time. All staff members were curtious. Be aware that the hotel nickel and dimes you for everything. Internet is almost $15 a day. We paid $38 for valet parking. I don't think my husband realized that there were other parking options besides valet, so that was our own fault. We ate at one of the hotel restaurants called Borgne. It is a John Besh restaurant. The food and service was good. I would recommend trying it out. The hotel is rated a 3.5 star and my opinion is that it is like that of a 3 star. Our visit was during Jazz Fest, so the rooms were extremely overpriced. But all the hotels in the area were overpriced because of this. That happens wherever you go when there are large events. We did experience some issues during our stay. They put us in a room that had guests still inhabiting the room. So after getting to our room I had to take the long jaunt back to the check in desk to notify them of their error and all I got was a very weak apology and then had to be put into another room. I was not all too impressed with this situation. I don't think the people whose room we had access to would have been very pleased either. Even though it was an accident, you are comprising the security and safety of the guests room we accidentally had access to. Another issue was our room was not cleaned during our stay. We were gone most all of the day, so there are no excuses for not having our room cleaned. Since our room was not cleaned I had to call housekeeping for towels. I asked them for three large towels. After a very long wait housekeeping arrived with one large towel, two hand towels, and a wash cloth. I didn't realize this until after they had left. I had to call housekeeping again and request more towels. After waiting for yet another long period of time my husband had to call housekeeping again. After that phone call we waited yet again for another long period of time. My husband actually left the room to try and find a housekeeping cart, because he was so tired of waiting around. My husband is pretty laid back and easy going and he was pretty angry with the housekeeping service and it takes a long time for him to reach this point. This hotel is located in the Business District. We spent most of our time in the French Quarter. So if you plan on spending most of your time in the French Quarter, I would highly recommend getting a hotel that is within closer proximity to that area. We spent a lot of money on cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “Probably will not return”
Reviews.Author: MEGJE07
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for the French Quarter Festival. There are many things to like about this hotel, it reopened last fall, but we did not have a good visit. Book a room if you are attending a conference there, an event at the Superdome or you have business at one of the university hospitals. There are far better options if your visit is for other events in New Orleans due to its location and size. The streetcar expansion will carry guests throughout NOLA but it will be quite some time before it is complete. The Hyatt is huge which requires a lot of walking to your room, to find the shops or meeting rooms. We like to walk but after several days at the festival the hotel was a bit of a challenge. The staff seems stretched -- although our meals were delicious the room was not straightened until very late in the day and we had to request towels and washclothes. The rooms facing the pool and air conditioning units are noisy with thumping music well into the night. Request a room in the high rise for a quieter stay. The rooms have refrigerators and there is a Rouse's Supermarket nearby with a large selection of prepared foods and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel, although location is OK only”
Reviews.Author: mushrooom288
Reviews.Content: Wow, this hotel is stunning. The 20 floor glass atrium with hotel bar and restaurant, the stunning glass lifts that look out over the Superdome. Wow! The service was also excellent, check-in staff were well trained, quick and helpful, hotel rooms are modern, and very comfortable, we did not want to leave the hotel! The location may work for business travellers, but if you are visiting New Orleans for sightseeing its a bit of a hike from French Squarters (15-20 minutes). Other downside is overnight parking was about $20.

Reviews.Title: “Not our choice”
Reviews.Author: Brian_and_Fiona36
Reviews.Content: While the building is impressive, we found the hotel cold and impersonal, reception more akin to a zoo and, in general, a bit of a rip-off. We stayed two nights. It was the only hotel on our trip which charged for wifi and the only one which appeared to offer a complimentary bottle of water but with a $4 price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect great service”
Reviews.Author: Deanna Y
Reviews.Content: As far as design and decor this hotel literally blew me away. However if you're looking for good service to match the impressive interior, you won't find it here. During my stay this hotel was overbooked for Jazz Fest so they offered to put me in a Parlor room with a pull out sofa. This was not uncomfortable so I requested a rollaway bed at approximately 9:20pm Thursday night. How long do you think it would take to get a rollaway bed at this time? If you guess 1 hr 20 mins - you would be right. I was desperate for sleep as I had to wake up at 5am to work and after about 4 phone calls to front desk and many excuses from housekeeping, I finally got the bed and was able to sleep at 11pm. On top of that, finding this hotel was an ordeal due to to construction on Loyola. Took me an extra hour to finally get here even after I called the concierge for directions. I expected the concierge to know the area well enough to direct me, but his directions were wrong! I can't turn left on Claireborn from Tulane! Please get to know the traffic signs and streets Hyatt staff!

Reviews.Title: “Back from the disaster”
Reviews.Author: irbflyfish
Reviews.Content: Located right next to the Super Dome, but a bit of a walk to the casino or French Quarter. They rebuilt this post Katrina, and it is a fine example of quality rebuilding after the destruction of mother nature. Great location for your convension or meeting.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: TCritic
Reviews.Content: Thsi hotel is fantastic for a pre-cruise or stay ! As the place is brand new...everything is in working condition. The rooms are well appointed, rooms comfy and the interactive TV is great and big-screen ! Food is expensive but very well presented and room service is efficient and the presentation was a wow factor...breakfast was neat With the other reviews, it's really easy to find these rooms and there is no complexity...the bell staff are great at giving tips There is a great supermarket about 5 mins walk away and if you are staying for more than 3-4 days a great place to stock up for cheap drinks and snacks rather than pay the mini bar price

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with all amenities.”
Reviews.Author: TLW6407
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights for a conference April 17-20. Nice spacious clean room with 42" flat screen, balcony overlooking nice pool area. Comfortable beds. Wing I was in was very quiet. Conference held here also â€“ nice banquet rooms, meeting rooms, etc. Friendly, helpful staff. Good food served at lunches, receptions and dinner. Since the hotel is not close to other shops, grocery, etc. the 24 hr shop with snacks, pop, sandwiches, etc. was handy (a little pricey but pretty usual for hotel-bought items). Starbucks on second level. Nice bar and restaurants (didn't eat there but they look nice/upscale). Short taxi ride to French Quarter or very walkable also, especially in nice weather and in a group. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.com”
Reviews.Author: lwatson601
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say that this is the best hotel that I have ever stayed in. The staff was very cordial and eager to help. And kudos to me not having to stand in the long checkout line at the counter. A young lady came up to me and checked me out on a tablet. Awesome!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Find another hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: norcalman95628
Reviews.Content: Why I will never stay here again: 1. No newspaper at door in the morning 2. No coffee maker in the room (but they will bring one if you request it, but that implies, for courteous travelers, a tip to the hotel staff that is the same cost as going to a coffee shop for a cup of coffee). 3. Unkempt floors near elevator (at least in the North Tower) -- should have been vacuumed 4. Very confusing hotel layout -- booking a conference here would be a mistake 5. Disorganized check-in line -- not a unified approach but more old-style bank structure where you pick a line and see how it goes. Very lame. Get with the times, I recommend. Even the concept of picking a line was disorganized -- you couldn't tell who was working and who was not. 6. As other reviewers noted, water pressure very low but manageable (and understandable given the location). 7. If you are looking to go to French Quarter/Bourbon Street, plan on taking a cab as the walk is about a mile (or so) and colleagues of mine who undertook the walk said it was shady (implied unsafe) at best. A cab is definitely recommended ($10-$12). 8. In the main tower, the elevators are highly automated and, based on conversations with colleagues of mine and other hotel guests who were forced to navigate them, more than confusing. Trust that you will yearn for a traditional "pick your floor and push the button approach." Positives: Housekeeping staff very courtesy and accomodating -- room look great after each night. Superdome is across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Karl G
Reviews.Content: Arrived Thursday, April 19th for a state conference. There were a couple of other conferences taking place at the same time and the hotel manager thought our conference was to take place a week later. Hmmm...hotel staff shouldn't be confused about dates that were booked months in advance. I have to say that the hotel was very clean and the staff was pleasant. By Friday afternoon, many attending our conference were fed up with the service and just about ready to return home. Some didn't get into rooms until that evening. When I left my room, house keeping was just across the hall. When I returned that afternoon, our room had not been attended to, which meant no clean towels or wash rags. After four phone calls to the front desk within a 5-hour periold and a threat to speak with the management, we finally received towels at 12:30am. At night, we attempted to turn the thermostat down a couple degrees, however, it would automatically reset itself to 68 degrees regardless of desired sleeping comfort. No bath tub, simply a walk in shower that would leak a half gallon of water on the main bathroom floor. Tap water would get so hot that you could make coffee without a coffee maker, which by the way was a special order item that had to be requested. For such a nice looking hotel, I was very dissappointed and have no reason to ever stay there again. Be prepared to pay for a cab if your interested in going to the French Quarters. Too far to walk!

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel but very hip with very friendly, professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Paul G
Reviews.Content: Recently reopened after multimillion dollar renovation. Rooms are very shiek and spacious. Only issue was low water pressure in the shower. Nice gym with new equipment and spectacular view. Close to Superdome, but a hike to the convention center or French quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Back from Katrina with the nicest staff I have ever found!”
Reviews.Author: Skiders
Reviews.Content: Attending a conference at this hotel, I found a higher level quality in the food, rooms, and staff than encountered before Katrina. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice place. A bit expensive a hefty walk to the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: PhillyAl
Reviews.Content: This recently remodeled hotel was very nice. The lobby and check in were a little slow. When I got in line, there were one person in front of me and it was still a 15min wait. Once you check in you have a long walk back to where the elevators are. The elevators are modern technology. You hit a button and it tells you what elevator to report too. Very cool and very fast elevators. The rooms were recently done and are very clean and comfortable. The only things I did not like was how expensive it was to get anything to eat or drink at the hotel. Also, no free wifi?!?!?! I could get that at any budget hotel. Why not have it when you pay hundreds a night? Overall, I would recommend it for business but not for heading to New Orleans to enjoy the French Quarter. If so, bring comfortable shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmp8
Reviews.Content: Just attended for a conference and it was a very clean, modern hotel. There was a main tower for rooms, but then another back wing where my room was located. Do not stay here if at all possible. Try to get a room in the main tower. My room was on the 9th floor, but it felt like the basement. It was tricky to even find my room the first day or so. It smelled damp like a basement and my toilet didn't work when I first arrived (which they promptly fixed). Room was built weird and a little right compared to the rest of the rooms. Bed was REALLY comfortable!! Besides the room, the hotel was lovely - super huge and great bars and great food. Walkable to downtown Bourbon street in about 15mins.

Reviews.Title: “frindly, new place.”
Reviews.Author: travelholl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a week before Mardi Gras. It had recently re-opened, and it shows. Fantastic and friendly customer service. The location was good; very close to a new Rouses supermarket, where we bought snacks and drinks for the room. We requested a coffee maker, which was brought up right away. Parking was ok; we used an outdoor lot across the street, as hotel valet we found too expensive. Next time I will request a room with one view of outside. We had a corner room, and it got a little cold, even with the heat blasting. Not a bad price for the time. The buffet on the weekends had a variety of food, very good.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale Hotel/ Staff Friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Mary D
Reviews.Content: My friend and I just recently stayed & attended a Nursing Conference here. This Hyatt is HUGE. Has everything but a spa:( But considering the friendly service, good food, ambiance that did not matter. Room service is a little steep cost wise but the food was delicious, well presented and of a much better quality than exspected from that service. Location is within walking distance of the French Quarter (about 15 min) although some may choose transportation. Distance could be seen as a neg but considering how loud the waterfront got at night, we were happy to be able to retreat from that area to get sound sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views!”
Reviews.Author: danidy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyatt for a conference. There were actual several conferences going on during the three days I stayed in this hotel, but it was never too crowded in the restaurants or bar. You have to use the gym on the 32rd floor! The views over the Superdome and city are awesome! The staff was very friendly and helpful. That is important because I had to ask for directions within the hotel several times. The elevator system 'wizzes' you to your floor in no time. The French Quarter, Riverwalk and free ferry to Historical Algiers are all within a 15 minute walk or so! Definitely a great hotel with very nice rooms were a bowl of fresh fruit was awaiting me!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: MSJet_Setter1
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt did a wonderful job of renovation. Everything was top notch and met my expectations for the most part. However, it is a quite confusing place to get around...of course it is palatial but the elevator system does not help for smooth transitioning and takes a few tries to get used to. I must admit I was quite annoyed to have to use a digital system to choose floors and then be told what elevator to get on, but like I said, this was an annoyance. Also, the air conditioner in our room was very good but LOUD...so loud you have to turn the tv up very high to hear it, which I thought was strange. Don't know if it was like this in all rooms though. I was disappointed by the breakfast buffet, there is a unique and well thought about spread, but the hot foods that I chose were all cold, and I went to the buffet maybe 20 minutes after it began for the morning. I was also disappointed by the service, everyone was friendly, but scanty when it came to refilling drinks, things of that nature. We also ate at the seafood restaurant downstairs, it has quite an eccentric cuisine, so I don't recommend if you are looking for traditional things, but the service was good. You can choose from valet and reg. parking...the valet is a whopping $38 bucks a night if I do recall...and parking in the garage yourself is cheaper but not much. Despite those things, the room was very clean, I enjoyed the amenities and the vicinity to the arena and superdome are great, you can walk which beats having to park for any games.

Reviews.Title: “Overall nice and clean but a little far from the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: Jimking2
Reviews.Content: My company held an event here after which I extended my stay. Not sure if I like the way the elevators work. Let's just say its different. Overall the hotel was nice and clean. A little pricey, but that might have been because it was Jazz Feastival. Only real gripe is its quite a hike to the French Quarter. If your going to the Superdome then it's perfect as its right next to it.

Reviews.Title: “The Big Easy for less!”
Reviews.Author: noscreenname200
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent 4 nights in an executive suite at the Hyatt Regency in New Orleans on vacation. He had received an upgrade coupon as the result of opening a Hyatt credit card and we used this to upgrade to the suite but the price of the room was cheap enough: $98. He had received another coupon in the mail from Hyatt that entitled us to use the Regency Club for breakfast and in the late afternoon for appetizers. There are so many great places to eat in New Orleans that we only used the breakfast option on three days and the afternoon club one day. I used the pool daily tho and it was lovely, save for the noisy machinery close-by. The only downside to this hotel is the location. Unless you have an event at the Superdome which is next door, the hotel is a good 15-20 minute walk to the French quarter and everywhere else. The hotel should run a shuttle to the French Quarter, but there isn't one. The staff at the hotel was very friendly and service-oriented. The guys at the front door opened it whenever we approached, the attendant at the Regency Club couldn't do enough for us and the room was cleaned whenever we returned from a busy day of sightseeing. We particularly liked the elevator where you could use your key; made us feel secure in that everyone couldn't access the floors where the rooms were. All in all, we had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could cancel tomorrow's stay”
Reviews.Author: Storm1908
Reviews.Content: I am so disgusted with this hotel! I'm paying a discounted rate of $155 (including taxes), but $233 is being held on my debit card. The room is small - the 2 queen beds look more like full-size beds. We were given 2 washcloths & 3 bath towels for 4 people, all of whom are listed on the reservation. The toilet was broken when I entered the room. The nice maintenance man fixed it but left toilet water & wet tissue all over the bathroom floor. It's been more than an hour; I've called the front desk twice; and, no clean up has happened. I wasn't advised that the rooms are split between two towers; so, I wandered for a while. The host & hostess were nice at Vitascope, but I had to get a manager after almost 15 minutes w/ no service. And, the waitress ended up being rude! I'm so outdone. I really am. (AND, a bottle of water is $3 at Lagniappe.)

Reviews.Title: “Not on par with other Hyatts”
Reviews.Author: purpleinopp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several Hyatts and this one misses the mark. Average is not good enough to be named Hyatt. It's not a particular thing, but a conglomeration of things like amenities missing from the rooms, surly doormen, front desk employees extremely friendly but lacking that polished attitude, and a lot of wasted empty spaces that would contain some interesting sculpture or artwork in a traditional Hyatt, dirty windows, feeling like part of a herd instead of a valued, individual guest. If you are having some kind of convention within the facility, or are just going to an event at the Superdome, you might appreciate it more than we did. But although we had no problem walking to the riverwalk area, then down to Bourbon St. for the night, then walking back to this hotel, we thought the amount of walking necessary to get from the front door into a room was beyond excessive. I get vertigo on escalators and we could find no other option to get to the elevators, which START on the 3rd floor. What do people in wheelchairs do? At one point, we took a wrong escalator and got stuck on the 2nd floor. Ended up having to go back up to get to correct escalator to get to the lobby. To get from the lobby to a room, one must ride a 2-story escalators, walk a fair distance between 2 restaurants, then scan your room key/card to summon an elevator. I also do not like glass elevators, the only apparent choice. There are no signs telling you which way to go for elevators, restaurants, exit, we never did see the concierge, and got lost either coming or going each of the 3 times we left our room. Several times we chatted briefly with other guests who also said they kept getting lost. They should give guests a map of the hotel. We never saw the pool except from our window, and it looked as far away as if it wasn't even in the same building. It was surrounded by a huge area with lounge chairs and really comfortable looking cabanas. If we had been there for a longer stay, I'm sure we would have loved spending some time out there in the shade on the padded furniture. Our bellhop was friendly but some of the other people working around the door were surly. Check-in was speedy and pleasant, but the lobby had a heavy vibe of being disorganized, rushed, on the verge of chaos with packed luggage carts taking up much of the surprisingly small space around the check-in desks (and blocking most of the light from outside). The staff, although almost all very pleasant people, seemed powerless to overcome this and I'm not sure they were aware of it. Not the sereneness and sense of calm proficiency one would expect in the lobby of a Hyatt. We found a parking lot right around the corner for $25/day which nobody in the hotel seemed to know existed. It was well worth it to us to walk a few more steps to save the additional cost of valet +tip, and we did not have to wait for our car this way or have strangers driving it (not a rental). Excellent: - seriously comfortable bed - ample covered area out front for unloading/loading - huge window - tv - 19th floor is very quiet - no paying for wi-fi unless you use it Not as good: - finding coffee upon awakening, none in room - no place for ladies to put their foot while shaving - shower only, no tub - no vent fan in bathroom - 1 washcloth for king room booked for 2 adults - no plastic laundry bag for dirty clothes - shower head was more of a mist than a shower, no adjustment - tiny bedside tables - water so "soft" that I never felt rinsed Just because they put their name on it, doesn't make it a Hyatt. I paid what they charged but don't feel like they kept up their end of things. If they need to charge more to offer the "Hyatt experience" then they should. For about $25 less, we could have stayed at one of the cheaper brands and had more amenities, breakfast included, treated about the same, bed not as comfortable, and used the savings to pay for a parking spot after driving into downtown (and still saved money.) Luckily there are other choices in the same price range in NOLA and now we know better. The whole giant building is non-smoking, it's a long time-consuming walk to get outside & back up every time you want to smoke. Something you won't enjoy after all of the other walking you'll probably do in this awesome city. We were only in the room to change, then later for sleeping, but would avoid this hotel in the future for this reason.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel with a lot of things going for it”
Reviews.Author: barreg
Reviews.Content: + Very convenient if attending event at Superdome (though we werenâ€™t). We had a great view of the Superdome from our room and the dome was lit up at night with the color changing regularly. + Friendly customer service and they seemed to be trying hard. After the keys didnâ€™t work the first time, the front desk person walked w/me to our room to ensure they worked this time. + Has a Starbucks, though hidden away on the second floor + Flat screen TV w/nearly all channels available in HD. High-tech channel guide was nice when it worked. + Had a fridge in our room + Walk to FQ wasnâ€™t too bad if you donâ€™t mind walking. We generally walked down Poydras to Camp. + Very nice top floor fitness room with high end equipment and great views + Had heard mixed reviews of elevator system, but they were only a little funny to figure out the first time using. Nice views from the glass elevators. Drawbacks: -There was an awful â€œair freshenerâ€� in the lobby that stunk like Ambercrombie & Fitch. It became nauseating after just a few moments. -Bed had a heavy down comforter but the A/C couldnâ€™t bring the temperature down enough to be comfortable. It would have been nice if there was a thinner blanket available in the room (or if the A/C were more powerful). -On-screen TV menu didnâ€™t always work. I could envision lots of guests calling for help about using the TV or else giving up on it, since the software interface was not all that intuitive. After the first day, I couldnâ€™t get to the channel listing no matter what button I pushed (kept going back to the main menu). -No in-room coffee maker, though Iâ€™d heard one could be requested. Most in-room coffee makers (and the included coffee) suck, but it would be nice to have it available in the room. Have to wonder if they figured Starbucks would get more sales if they didnâ€™t include in-room coffee makers. I just had coffee at wherever we had breakfast. -Very long walk from the lobby to rooms and what looked like a lot of wasted space in the lobby (though very nicely decorated). Have to go up 2 escalators, past the restaurants and through the atrium to get to the main elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, recently renovated hotel...close to meeting but further to attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Rick J
Reviews.Content: I live in the area and stayed at this hotel when I hosted a meeting in the CBD of NOLA. Very nice hotel, awesome renovations and great restaurants/stores inside the hotel. A healthy walk to the FQ, bit there will soon be a streetcar line to Canal St, so that will be nice. Highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Super Super Dome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wileym1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in Dec 2011 for the Louisiana High school Football State Championship game. We had a great time at the newly renovated hotel. The rooms were exceptional. They were richly decorated and had the best mattresses. The restaurant had one of the best breakfast buffets I have ever had. It was rather expensive but well worth it. We had two adjoining rooms that were about $109 each per night. The place is VERY LARGE and is designed to handle LARGE crowds. I am not sure if would have liked it if I were on a business trip alone because of the sheer size but it was perfect with a group. Check out was hectic with a 1 hour wait for valet getting our car since everyone was checking out at the same time. If I go back I will be checking out early and I recommend the same to you. I have no complaints except for valet wait which I could have avoided.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best night's sleep ever in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: MinnTex
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was just from finally arriving at the hotel after a day of travel delays, but I laid down, said, "Wow this bed is comfy," and then awoke the next day. The room was quiet (small) and very comfortable. The elevators are key-enabled, which seems to be the thing in New Orleans. It is a long, long way from the lobby to the elevators to the rooms. You also have to use two banks of escalators. This is not an easy-in and easy-out place. I was there for a conference, and one bank of conference rooms is at a level that didn't seem to be served by either the escalators or elevators.
