I'm sure they had to be for ADA, but I couldn't find them (the stairs worked fine!). A number of people came in late because they also could not find the floor easily. As far as location, it is convenient to the Super Dome, but not much else. I walked a good distance to find a decent breakfast place. It was a beautiful morning, so that was fine. In bad weather, I would have had to dine at one of the hotel spots (which don't seem to be rated very highly). If I were looking for a hotel close to the sights, I think you can get a decent place closer--but this is a comfy place for sleeping when you get back!

Reviews.Title: “High Tech and Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: ritaNovato
Reviews.Content: We went to a Playboy Bunny reunion...and had the priviledge of staying here for 3 days. A 3 million renovation was just completed...and it shows!!! Everything from elevators to plasma TV's is sooo futuristic :) Restaurants were so diverse and in one restaurant alone you can get everything from fresh oysters and sushi to steaks and fresh fish...burgers are so good too! Can't wait to get back to this property. Oh, I must say that service has that "Touch of Hyatt"

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Place, Service is Lacking”
Reviews.Author: sbj35215
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a long weekend. The hotel itself is very nice. If you are attending an event at the Superdome there is simply no where better to stay. Super close. The French Quarter is a bit of a walk but not bad at all. The service is lacking. The rooms were no serviced until 6pm and when I called for a laundry bag the morning of checkout it never arrived. Also more signage is needed. The place is massive.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: EJAEIK
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we had no choice but to use valet parking which can add up when you need to use the car during the day The desk clerk upon checkin was very nice and offered us a choice of floors and views. We asked for a view of the superdome which is beautiful at night. It's hard to figure out the floors where the elevators and restaurants are located. I loved the elevators. You use your keycard which tells you what elevator to use and once you enter it only goes to your floor. I felt very secure using this elevator because I have had a bad experience where I felt like I was followed to my room in another hotel. The room is very modern with nice furnishings. The room had a safe so you can lock up valuables you don't want to carry around. I read the other reviews and I totally agree with some of them. The air conditioning was very loud and it was hard to figure out. The room was either too cold or too hot. The next day when our room was cleaned we had used the glasses which are in the closet with the ice bucket which I thought was odd. They didn't replace them and left them sitting out where we had left them. We had used the bath mat and they didn't replace it with a clean one. The shower is terrible, the water is never hot enough and the pressure is poor. It takes forever to get the shampoo out of your hair. The hotel is located too far from the French Quarter to walk back and forth at night for safety reasons but it's okay during the day. We used a cab and each way was only $10.00 including tip. The staff was very friendly and the hotel is beautiful but they need to work on some improvements in housekeeping and maintenance of their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brent F
Reviews.Content: Hotel has been rebuilt from the hurricans and would have to be the best hotel I have stayed in. The rooms are spacious and the technology used within the hotel is great. Facilities for families is great, along with the gym (Views to the superdome from the gym are spectacular). Would certainly recommend this hotel for business or holidays. Does have a lot of conferences at the hotel, which crowd the restaurants and bars, but thats not all a bad thing.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tutttravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency in New Orleans this past weekend. The location was great (it is right next door to the Super Dome) although you will need to take a taxi for transportation unless you have your own vehicle. I was very impressed with the renovation of the hotel, the decor, restaurants, bars, and especially the impeccable service. To top it all off, it was budget friendly. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but still room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: LondonRick
Reviews.Content: March and another conference! This time at the Hyatt Regency and again this place knows how to run a large event with great precision! Check in was easy and efficient, again always nice to meet friendly staff. I walked up through the hotel and was pleasantly surprised at the amenities, great big atrium bar and restaurant area, good atmosphere overall. Once I worked out the elevator system, clever as it is I went to my room and was delighted to see that it was a great size, well appointed and laid out with everything I needed. Wireless was complimentry ( for one device only, anymore meant upgrading your wireless package $15 a day). The bar and restaurant staff overall were excellent. Breakfast was great and the bar had a good "buzz" about it. I have to say drinks and food reasonably priced and good quality. There is a starbucks too in the conference area if you need a coffee and cake! The hotel also has a fantastic fitness center on the top floor so you can run on the treadmill looking out over New Orleans. This is a very comfortable hotel, grand in its appearence and really did exceed my expectation in nearly every way, yes there is a "but" coming.The parking is an issue, the only option available is Valet parking which is expensive at over $35 a day, adding tips to this every time you need the car adds up! There is a car park to the right of the hotel as you drive along the street, it has a board saying "hotel parking" but this has nothing to do with the hotel, its misleading. I did bring this up on check-in and apparently they are aware of it but didnt do anything during my stay and once you drive in you will have to pay to get out. My other niggle is house keeping, the room was never properly cleaned. When I checked in to the room I found a long black hair in the shower, very obvious and off putting. The room was never properly cleaned during my stay, water marks on the table never wiped off, floor not being vacumed and dirty towels left outside my door until 10pm. I did bring this up on check out and the staff apologised and were fantastic about it, taking notes and ensuring it would be looked into. Would I stay here again? Yes, with the caveat that the house keeping is improved, otherwise i'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: CANCUNCOOLER
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency the weekend of March 23rd. The hotel and staff were great .Hope to stay again in the near future. Great job Hyatt and staff.

Reviews.Title: “modern but futuristic and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nMilliff
Reviews.Content: My first time at any Hyatt, we only had a couple issues but other than that, this Hyatt was amazing to stay at for 3nights-cozy and comfortable and not just the inside of your room, the entire building! Loved the staff...didn't see one member without a smile. March 16th-19th. Took TONS of pics of just the Hyatt alone.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a place to consider”
Reviews.Author: Guypicard
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hyatt this past weekend. Had heard stories of how nice it was renovated but until you see it you can't appreciate it! Modern, chic decor. Really a nice place to stay!! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “New, highrise luxury hotel at the Superdome”
Reviews.Author: jkloc
Reviews.Content: My Gold Passport card got us into a very large room on the 23rd floor (the "Hyatt" floor). There is a complex and secure system of elevators to the rooms. The hotel opened in the fall of 2011 and is a big huge gorgeous hotel with a 23 story open lobby. The staff is very good and attentive. But the two strangest things were - there are no towel racks in the bathroom (if we are trying to be green, how would we dry towels?). Also, there are NO glasses in the bathroom. Hidden in the closet are two glasses and the ice bucket. We asked about these items and the staff didn't see anything unusual abt there being no towel racks nor glasses. Weird. We got a rate of $125 from hotels.com. Wi-fi was $10 PER PERSON, PER DEVICE, PER DAY. We found free wi-fi on the second floor at the bar and also on the second floor during conferences. The mini-bar was not stocked, but there was an expensive mini-mart in the building to pick up snacks, drinks, etc. Incredible flat screen tv with mouse, keyboard and multiple inputs. Great view over the Superdome. Very safe. Ultra clean and new. A/C difficult to set and alternated between off/stuffy and on/roaring. Hertz cars in the building with an electronic kiosk in the lobby. Concierge knowledgeable, but no rack of tourist info (just a few items behind the bellman desk). Other Gold Passport rooms got free newspapers at the door each morning, but not us. Food at bar was good. 15 mins. walk to streetcar. It's a very nice hotel, just take your own towel rack and some glasses or cups. Free wi-fi at Jamba Juice one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: GNOReading
Reviews.Content: Recently took my Mother on a Getaway. Hotel check-in was excellent. About 4 blocks walking from trolley on Canal. Nice stay. The air conditioner in the room was LOUD. (only complaint).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tmfoody
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome room! The staff was excellent. It was easily within walking distance to Bourbon street!

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable But Not Close to French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougewanderer
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt Regency re-opened in October, 2011. It is new, fresh, clean, and very comfortable. If you are attending an event at the Superdome or the Arena, you can not stay any closer than the Hyatt. If you are attending a convention, you will be very pleased with both the convention and the room arrangements. If, however, you are in New Orleans to visit the French Quarter, be aware that the Hyatt is not close enough to walk to the French Quarter. The breakfast buffet in 8 Block is very good, especially the omelet bar. Unfortunately, there is not a screen for the sunlight that streams into the restaurant. Make sure you are seated out of the sun. Otherwise, you will need to bring your sunglasses. I did have a problem checking in. I was guaranteed a room with two queen beds. The bed choice was a necessity since I was travelling with my family. Despite the guarantee, when I checked in I was told that only a single king bed was available. It took 20 minutes for the check in staff to fix their problem and give me the room I had been guaranteed. The wait was too long. Otherwise, the staff was very helpful throughout the hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Tnfuturedr
Reviews.Content: I don't know where these bad reviews are coming from. I loved the hotel. Its easy access to the arena and super dome. The elevators are not hard to work just swipe your room key and go to the elevator takes you straight to your floor. The rooms were nice bathroom is pretty small. Try and get a room with a view of the super dome. The valet fee is high $ 37 a night. There are 2 other lots that are on either side of the hotel that's cheaper. The walk from the hotel to french quarters is a nice distance but can be done. A taxi would cost around 6-10 dollars. I would stay there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jatl2008
Reviews.Content: From the start, this was an Excellent experience. This newly renovated and opened Hotel is directly across from the Dome and in good walking distance of Downtown, The French Quarter and many other area attractions. Dinner at Bourge was OUTSTANDING. Hotel services were very good and staff was very friendly and helpful!! Rooms were larger than expected and offered views of the city or Dome. We stayed on the 21st floor and had to Double beds. Very comfortable. TV was interesting as it operated like a computer, took a little getting used to, but was really cool. Hotel has a Starbucks and a 24 "general store" with food, drinks, and all sorts of things. Definitely take a look at this new Hyatt, gorgeous decor, elegance galore and the friendly staff make this a New Orleans gem!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt is Great!”
Reviews.Author: NanNanDaphne
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in New Orleans at the Hyatt. (March 23-25) Upon arrival we were upgraded and the whole staff couldn't have been better. From the greeter when we drove in to the bellman. We loved the Hyatt and will ceratainly return. The place is beautiful and supposedly by the end of the year the street car will stop right out front which will be great and save on cab fair to the Quarter. Thanks Hyatt for a great weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Should've listened to poor service advice from Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Ttalki2
Reviews.Content: Just checked in and already disatisfied from the check in process. Specifically requested King sized bed separately to the hotel after booking on priceline and said was not a problem. after arrival, they said because we booked through a 3rd party, they couldn't accommodate it. There was a "allergy freeKing sized bed room" available for extra $25 a night. Asked for it without the fee. The manager Karl was told about this situation and was indifferent about it, rejected. Not a happy camper already my first 1 hour here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Plush”
Reviews.Author: 1boiledham
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during SEC tourney in March. Beautiful hotel, very plush and great staff. The room was very comfortable for 3 but....we were only there one night. It was also fairly expensive for my pocket but very convenient to the super dome, which was our goal. The food was excellent and a great alternative if you don't feel like going downtown to eat. The breakfast buffett is $19 but if you are "brunching" even that is worth it!!! Would love to stay again but only if I could find lower rates thru groupon or living social.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful New Hotel with a Few Kinks to Work Out”
Reviews.Author: love2travelky
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are very nice. We were in a queen room with only one bed. We did feel like this room was very small and there was not a lot of space for clothes. No drawer space at all in this room. However, the view from the room was great. It faced the Superdome, which was beautiful at night. At the time of our stay, the hotel was hosting SEC Basketball Fans, Conference Attendees, and a Gala to benefit to New Orleans. So, I will give them a benefit that they had a LOT going on. As far as service goes, service at breakfast and at the sushi bar was excellent. We had Brian as our waiter one night, which was the best service we received while we were there. On a down note, housekeeping and service in bar area was not so good. We arrived back at our room one day at 4p.m with the room still not cleaned. When I called about it, I got no apology which was upsetting. Sorry, goes a long way. I am a HYATT GOLD PASSPORT MEMBER and I did not receive a paper in the mornings (other room on my floor did). I called the first morning to request one and it was delivered. There was never another paper delivered during our stay (4 nights). The location of the hotel was great. It was walking distance to the French Quarter and great for the games at the Arena. We loved the Starbucks! And the atmosphere in the hotel bar and restaurant was very lively! I would stay here again, but would like to have seen better customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tommymacdog
Reviews.Content: I just attended a conference at the hotel and was just really amazed. I travel a lot for business and this hotel is where you want to stay in New Orleans. The hotel was recently renovated so everything is clean, modern and new. Beds & pillows were very comfortable. The bathrooms have some very high-end fixtures on the sink and showers - and it's all about the bathrooms and having a good shower when you travel, isn't it? The rooms have excellent temperature control so I was happy to crank-up the AC and chill-down the room quickly. The breakfast in the main lobby restaurant is painfully slow, so I went to the shop on the second floor where they have some very nice breakfast sandwiches, Starbucks coffee, juices, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: dtbram
Reviews.Content: Perhaps because we came from staying at a gorgeous bed and breakfast, my first reaction was that the rooms were very sterile, apparently for ease of cleaning and allergies. No coffee maker was a drag, yet there was a refrigerator. The elevators are awkward and take some getting used to â€“ having to change elevators from the lobby to the third floor, to the room. Not pressing a button inside the elevator was definitely unusual. We had problems with a noisy air conditioner, the TV not working properly, and never getting four towels instead of three when we asked repeatedly for four towels. Robes are furnished when requested. Staff was accommodating when asked; we just wished we didnâ€™t have to keep asking. We attended the Night to Make It Right After Party which lasted until 4:00 am. Fantastic Event with even exciting performances by Seal, Snop Dog, Kanye West, Jamie Fox, and Rihanna! It appeared that Hyatt did a very job on the Gala and after party. You never saw the stars arriving, although we came very close to Brad, Angelina, and Sean Pean. It was fun seeing the place swarming with Kentucky fans. We didnâ€™t try the restaurants--only having room service before the after party. My steak salad was tasty, and ordering it through the TV link worked efficiently. This place is huge, so be prepared to walk through the conference areas and restaurants to get to your room elevator. The location is fine for sports events. However, it is a long walk to the French Quarter, so we took taxis more often. DH attended a conference, while I used the fitness center. Unfortunately there was no spa and the pool was closed. This hotel served its purpose for us--just wasn't as convenient/comfortable as we would have liked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic on every level!”
Reviews.Author: rogerandvirginia
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful. The check in was a breeze with staff that were willing to accommodate with a smile. We liked the high-tech elevator system. They operated by reading your key. Made me feel safe and kept elevators from being overloaded with stops on every floor. Our room was a suite that had perfect attention to detail. Not to over or under done. Bed was super comfy. I appreciate good pillows and linens. Every meal was delicious. Room Service was prompt. Can be pricey, but you are paying for the convenience of not leaving your room. Our visits to 2 restaurants in hotel exceeded our expectations . Great flavor and portions. Cold beer, can't think of a thing to improve on. We attended " Night to Make it Right", fund raiser. I can say this staff has "got it together" . To have the efficiency to take care of 1,200 people at once was quite impressive. We will for sure return for future visits. Nice to have access to the quarter without the noise while you sleep. It's just a quick cab ride away. Thank you to the staff who made our stay perfect from beginning to end. No need to question if you should stay here, the answer is YES!

Reviews.Title: “Aesthetically very pleasing.”
Reviews.Author: Rohan B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights towards the end of Mardi Gras. The first thing we noticed was the stunning entrance/lobby. The front desk service was quite efficient at check-in, especially considering how busy it was when we checked in, but I didn't really like being told to take escalators to the third floor, and getting on the guest elevators there. It just seemed a bit of an odd design. There was a queue at the elevator, but that was the only time during our stay that we had to wait to use it, the rest of the time there were plenty of free ones. We figured out how to use it easily enough, although it was somewhat frustrating to choose your store number and have the H elevator immediately open up 20 metres away, forcing you to run to get to it on time. I loved looking out the glass walls as the elevator went up or down though. I made two calls to the front desk, one for help in adjusting our stay length, which they took care of with no fuss at all, the second time was to ask for help with the in-room internet, but nobody came to help. That was pretty disappointing. The room was very nice if a little smaller than I expected. The bed was sublime, but the water pressure was little more than a trickle, and I would have liked a coffee maker to be provided. The staff at the starbucks were lovely, but the use of space on those lower floors seemed a bit strange. There were just large sprawling expanses of walls and carpets. It just seemed a bit wasteful to have so much space not being utilised. We tried the restaurant and the breakfast buffet, and the food was just ok, and the staff were a little disinterested. It was fun to look down at the tables below from the 23rd floor, although it felt like that design may be a slight safety risk. All in all, it was a most enjoyable stay and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “New Favorite Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: aandlinphx
Reviews.Content: I visit New Orleans regularly nad have stayed at the Sheraton on Canal, the Hilton, Marriott and the Ritz...this is now my preferred hotel in New Orleans. I usually like to stay in walking distance from the French Quarter but my client recomended the Hyatt as it connects to their building. It's georgeous, the room was very nice, the service was great and it's just a short cab ride to the Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the complaints are about!”
Reviews.Author: teho
Reviews.Content: My bid was accepted on Priceline and I immediately came on over to Tripadvisor to check it out. Well, that got me a little concerned after I read a few reviews. I have to say... I am not sure what they were complaining about. Yes, the elevator system is high-tech but not confusing at all. If you have a fairly basic understating of 21st century technology then you will appreciate that you don't have to wait on an elevator...the high-tech system has one waiting on you as soon as you tap the touchscreen and it does not stop on other floors! The hotel is very large, like a convention hotel, so there is quite a lot of walking to get to the elevators, but if you have ever stayed in a larger hotel then you won't be surprised. The staff is phenomenal! The front desk ladies were efficient and helpful. I requested a room with a tub, on a high floor, with a Superdome view...I got just that! The parking is really expensive, $38 a night with no alternative, but the valet staff was very quick and pleasant. My only complaints would be that it took forever for the hot water to kick in. The hotel was at low occupancy so we were apparently alone in our area. The maintenance staff told us that since there was no one using the hot water but us it just took a while to get to us. My other complaint is that the air conditioner was ridiculously loud! They have done a wonderful job of refurbing the hotel from the storm, but clearly they could not redo all the plumbing and a/c. Unfortunately you can tell that these things are older. Lastly, be sure to request your coffee maker when you check in, if that's important to you. I would absolutely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive Weird Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: runningboy68
Reviews.Content: Next door to the Superdome and a short walk to the edge of the French Quarter, the Hyatt is in a fantastic location. The building and its lobby are quite impressive, very appealing. The walk from the lobby to the elevators was much less so. And then there are the elevators. No buttons. You tell a touchscreen which floor you want and then the screen directs you to the correct elevator. A quirk in the computerized elevator setup means that you have to go down to the base (floors 3, 4, or 5) before you can go up (such as to the gym or the Regency Club). Confusing and frustrating, at least until you get the hang of it. The rooms are nicely appointed with flatscreen TVs connected to an interesting computer system, allowing the viewer to select hotel info, dining options, TV, etc. The remote control functions as a mouse, and the cursor's response time was a bit sluggish. Hyatt chose, at least for my room, to place the bedroom TV on a unit containing the safe and mini fridge. As a result, and due to the small size of the bedroom, there was no bureau/dresser for clothes. On a one-night trip, I will not care about this. But for two or more nights, I expect to unpack. There is an inconveniently located dresser-type object in the front closet.

Reviews.Title: “Good but Confusing Layout”
Reviews.Author: kcandedgardo
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel for a conference. Let me start by saying that I was impressed by the huge lobby chandelier. Check in was simple but then I was surprised because the checkin desk made a point of talking to me about the layout of the hotel. I listened politely and then after I started walking I realized how important that conversation was. There are two sets of elevators in the hotel, one for the first three floors and then another set for the guest floors. The layout was a bit confusing and the hotel is so large as to be overwhelming. However, the view for floor 32 is awesome while you are running and I loved (even though I was scared) to look down from my floor (#24) to see the central restauraunt on the third floor.

Reviews.Title: “Limited appeal”
Reviews.Author: BluesDoctor
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for Mardi Gras and Krewe of Endymion. As expected the cost was elevated due to demand ($350/night with all the add-ons) but the accommodations were just average. The room was nothing special. Basic amenities but, as with other "upscale" brands, no free internet or in room coffee maker. If you wanted a morning java you had to get dressed and go to either the Starbucks or adjacent in-hotel convenience store then trudge back to the elevator,etc. Parking is either valet or independent lot next door for $25-28. Location is great for the Superdome and Arena not much else. Won't stay again unless this location demands. There are nicer hotels closer to the FQ and CBD.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Hotel near the Superdome”
Reviews.Author: FLSteve
Reviews.Content: This hotel recently received a $285 million renovation and reopened in Oct 2011 after Katrina. There is a beautiful 25 story atrium inside the hotel with live Jazz on the Friday and Saturday evening we stayed. Although the music was still playing when we went to bed, the doors we had no problem sleeping. The hotel itself contains several nice looking bars and restaurants that we didn't use. It also had a Starbucks and free wifi access in the lobby areas. Hotel parking was expensive, like the rest of New Orleans at $27/night for self parking. We parked across the street and only paid $15 per night with in/out privileges. The hotel is next to the Superdome, but we had no problems walking around New Orleans. I'd definitely stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Hyatt??”
Reviews.Author: Peter W
Reviews.Content: I will say that the common areas of this hotel are beautiful, but that's where the compliments stop. We needed a room for one night before taking a cruise. I'm thankful I only had to spend one night in this dump. The room was in a complete state of disrepair. THe bathroom door didn't close or lock, filthy windows, cigarette butts all over the balcony (this was a $10 a night upgrade). The walls are paper thin (we could hear the people in the next room as though they were in bed with us). I won't even get into room service and the crappy burger and BLT that cost $45. I travel extensively, stay in a lot of hotels and this hotel is a dud. Avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful renovated room”
Reviews.Author: AmrendraRus
Reviews.Content: The room was wonderful, though there was some delay in check in. The bar is very good. It is a 10 minute brisk walk from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Work2TravelMore
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 3 nights - updated rooms are very nice, but pretty small. All the basics, feels very much like a Westin - but no in room cofee maker, robes, the little touches. The hotel itself is a fairly odd layout for a conference - escalators between some floors, elevators that only serve certain floors, etc. Ballrooms were well set up, but I don't think the food is up to par yet.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely appointed, great staff, and more Hyatts coming to NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Hotelguy992
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here about 15 nights over the last 2 months and here are some observations. Staff- They are top notch at all levels from the bellman (who recognized me as a frequent guest at another hotel he used to work at and gave me a tour) to the Front Desk people and Concierge Lounge gang. They go the extra mile to reach out to guests and project friendliness and competence. Elevators- OK, this is a SMART Elevator system. If you HAVE to press a button to get to your floor, you will probably not like these. Of course, I'd rather not wait 10 minutes for a DUMB elevator system to get me up and down, and this place's system is state of the art. Parking-Very expensive Valet and not a lot of low priced options. The valet is over $30 and the attached garage is $25 if you park over 10 hours. There is a open parking lot across the street that is a bit cheaper. Diamond Members- You get access to the lounge (Regency Club), which is a great place to take in the view of the city and have a drink. The breakfast is continental, so if you like eggs and meat and such you are SOL. Evenings is cut up sandwiches like Muffaletta and other stuff , plus some veggies like mushrooms and carrots. Good news is that they have free granola bars and mineral water all day long, which you don't see every day at other places. Bad news is that if you want a real meal you will be going elsewhere. Staff is great. Restaurants-Plentiful and varied all excellent, except for one thing. I don't need a half pound of cubed ham on my char broiled oysters, and at least the menu could mention that the char broiled oysters are ham smothered. Hyatt in NOLA going forward-They are committed, with 2 other properties coming online soon. Should be a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “I was double charged!!!”
Reviews.Author: BRE B
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay here through orbitz. After my stay I come to find out that the hotel instead of charging orbitz they charged my account. When you check in they ask for a credit card or ATM card for any incidental causes. NOW IT'S BEEN 9 DAYS AND NO REFUND!! Not to mention they are giving me the run around from one transfer to the other..... NEVER AGAIN WILL I STAY HERE! SO MUCH FOR TRYING TO STAY SOMEWHERE NICE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ..... good stay ....but ....”
Reviews.Author: Xacuti
Reviews.Content: We were at the Hyatt for a conference. Our stay at this very nicely appointed hotel was quite good and enjoyable. We had a nice room with a good view, and we were quite happy that we upgraded to the Regency Club. Otherwise, we would have felt quite cloistered. A number of guests appeared to have been challenged by the new elevator system. We were very comfortable with it and actually found it very efficient; those who had difficulty would have benefited if there was a hotel person at the 3rd level to guide them. There are road-works presently underway in the vicinity of the hotel, and the area is slightly messy and desolate. Hurricane Katrina appears to have wiped out all signs of life around the hotel. The front desk and concierge folks were great and so also were the staff at the Regency Club. For some reason, the house-keeping staff looked lethargic and the valets too slick to be the first and last folks one meets in a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel has great potential, but some really odd things”
Reviews.Author: javabuz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights for a conference in the hotel. It was pretty easy to check in. Everything is a hike in this hotel, so if walking is a problem, this could be a big concern for you. You MUST take 2 escalators and a long walk to even get from the front desk to elevators. I am a frequent traveler so there are a few things that are important to me: coffee is one. There is an in-house Starbucks that I found pretty efficient and fast moving even with a long line. This was a nice plus. The room was clean and had nice little extras. However, in the 3 nights I was there the maid service did not come until ALMOST 9 PM AT NIGHT! I have never seen that. Also, the shower had the worst water pressure that I have had in a long time. It was pretty frustrating. By far the MOST annoying feature of my ENTIRE stay was the elevators. I have never seen anything like it. You MUST scan your key to have it choose your floor. You can manually decide your floor from OUTSIDE the elevator, but in either case it "directs" you to what letter elevator you should get on, once you get on the elevator there are NO inside buttons, so you are stuck with wherever it takes you. This was cute at first, but over the course of the conference I realized how really terrible this design is. First, there was NO instruction outside the elevator on how to scan your key (we learned this from watching someone else do it.) Second, the elevator bases which letter elevator you get in based on how many keys are scanned. So when a group of us all wanted to go to the 11th floor, and another group wanted to go to another floor, it tried to put us on the same elevator. The only problem was with 2 key scans it was actually close to 20 people! The worst part was when large groups would try and get on the elevators at the same time (after they let out of a meeting, etc.) This process was pure chaos with scanning keys and listening for letter assignments. If you need to go to multiple floors (like drop a friend off, etc.) you are outta luck. It was SO frustrating. the one redeeming grace of the hotel was James, the concierge. A lovely guy, very helpful, kind and went above and beyond. Whatever they are paying that guy is not enough. Otherwise, I would never choose to stay here by choice, it had too many annoying features.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern Conference Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fondej
Reviews.Content: The recently reopened Hyatt Regency is an ultra modern high tech conference hotel. For those who like this type of hotel, this is top shelf. The rooms were quite small but well appointed. Beds were very comfortable. There was surprisingly minimal storage space in the rooms. I found the high tech amenities to be more of a nuisance than a benefit. All hotel information was accessed via the television. This was more cumbersome than convenient. The mouse on the tv remote did not work well and it basically made everything much more of a hassle than a convenience. The high tech coffee machine on the regency floor broke while I was there. This created a big line for coffee that was being prepared by breakfast staff cup by cup. I think everyone would have preferred an "old fashioned" pot of coffee. Even the elevators were more complicated by these techie innovations. Although this is a very nice hotel, I would not choose to stay there again. Too many tech hassles, too cold and contemporary design and too far from the action of the French Quarter and other touristy areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hyatt from Feb 19-21 2012 for Mardi Gras. Hotel is only a few blocks from St Charles, where we watched most of the parades, and directly across from the Superdome. Room was very nice, king size bed incredibly comfortable. Any staff we encountered were lovely. Liked: that there was toothpaste and conditioner as well as the usual stuff in the bathroom. The amazing bed. Didn't like: that it's very big and a bit soulless and generic.

Reviews.Title: “Billing system at its very worst.”
Reviews.Author: Marcus c
Reviews.Content: i checked in sunday and stayed 3 nights. My brother joined me monday night and had a rental car. They charged me for 4 nights parking ($38 a night plus taxes) even thou i stayed 3 nights and had a car for 2 nights. They corrected the problems very quickly and i was very pleased. Until i got home and checked my credit card. i noticed a $673.38 bill when the correct amount should be $117.54. Now i am calliing and of course i am in voice mail hell only the find that the office is closed, call back later. Take my advice and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Boutique”
Reviews.Author: QueenofMS
Reviews.Content: During our stay, the valet was pretty chaotic for the price you're charged ($38 not including taxes), but overall, this hotel is really nice. We had a view of the Superdome from our 11th floor, balcony room on the North Wing & the view was absolutely AMAZING @ night (displayed Mardi Gras colors). We'd definitely stay again as the Starbucks, Borgne restaurant (good food, but far from fine dining) & gym made our stay even more enjoyable. NOTE: TAKE BOTTLED WATER! Queen of MS

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - but completely overwhelmed by Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: CypressCarlos
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the weekend and the new remodeled Hyatt Regency in New Orleans. Only reason that I'm giving them 4 stars (wanted to give them 3.5) is that because of the location and size of the hotel, they should know how to better handle the crowds. The location, right next to the Superdome, is unbeatable for events at the dome or the basketball arena. Parking was on the pricey side ($35 a night), but you can park right next door for $20. The facilities themselves are gorgeous, as are the newly redone rooms. I don't particularly like that the entrance to the hotel was moved to Loyola from its previous location off-Poydras, as it is significantly harder to get in and out of the hotel. The service was super friendly, like it is in the majority of hotels in New Orleans, and the rooms are super clean and extremely well maintained. One current drawback is that they are right now experiencing "new hotel blues", which means that they are still trying to learn how to run a big hotel. I just received a "no-show" charge for a room that I had booked and canceled, and I'm going thru the pain of reversing that charge. The other issue is with the lack of experience on how to move vehicles in and out of the property. The valet system is literally in shambles and they need to come up with a better way of handling busy weekends. Even at its very high price, this hotel will be sold out for all the Saints games, bowls, and other events, so they will need to come up with a better system.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during Mardi Gras, and even during this busy time, the staff was able to take care of another Diamond Member! Keith at the front desk definitely hook it up! Rooms were great and updated. Restaurants was very delicious. The table of fast foods to pickup on the go was a great idea. Bloody Marys in the morning was a good touch. The breakfast buffet was very good. Tons of items to choose from! The lobby is huge and very spacious to fill in the tons of Mardi Gras invaders! The regency club location is great, I was able to work there, tons of drinks and coffee. Gym is also a great view of the place. The Hotel is also not far walk from bourbon street. only issue the amount of traffic from taxis and valet. Luckily I didn't valet a car! Rooms were very nicely designed, comfy beds, great pc style TV. A little tough to navigate the elevators to get to the first/second floor but otherwise it is fine. Definitely would stay here again and would recommend it. Saw a few other hotels and it didn;t look as luxurious as the Hyatt. lagniappe! The expression and the store (They heated up my pizza!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, new & great locale”
Reviews.Author: Traveler M
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for a meeting at Entergy. Great location- connected to Entergy's building and a short walk from the Superdome. Newly renovated with modern rooms and nice restaurants on the second floor. Hotel catering was also a good fit with lots of local style choices including King Cake. A good choice for events/festivals in New Orleans due to the great location.

Reviews.Title: “OK, But you have to wonder about some decisions”
Reviews.Author: Mysticyat
Reviews.Content: I was at the Hyatt recently for a conference. Not the best location - not walkable to either the French Quarter or the Convention Center, and cabs rides to either are very pricey. Had to question some of their decisions on where they spent the renovation money. They have this super-tech (and I'm sure super expensive) elevator system that they brag about - but you have to drag your luggage up 2 long escalators and through the entire convention center/restaurant row area just to get to the elevators that service the room floors. The rooms are fine - standard 4-star convention hotel rooms but the bathroom was SOOOOOOOO SMALL. I literally could not sit on the toilet if the door to the bathroom was open because the door would be between my legs. I expect much, much more in the bathrooms of a newly renovated "luxury" convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Modern Hotel. Good service, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: 1917scooter
Reviews.Content: 'Won' this hotel on Priceline. Obviously built to be an extension of the Superdome, which is fast becomming America's stadium for large scale national championship games. Very clean, very friendly service. Could appeal to sports fans/journalists only in town for the game, but worked well for me and my friends in town for the first week of mardi gras. 10 minute walk to the quarter through the CBD. Didnt mind the walk because New Orleans is such a walkable city. Actually the walk is a good thing after all of the drinking, eating and drinking during our stay. The city is building a light rail right in front of the door to connect to other lines in the city. In house restaurants are very nice, and very expensive. Why bother eating in house when there are so many other excellent food options a few minutes away. Only negative was that the room lacked mirrors and didnt have any scrap paper. Great shower and lots of well placed outlets for our electronics.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for sporting events.”
Reviews.Author: Candeeluve
Reviews.Content: If you are attending anything at the arena or superdome, this hotel is the closet. You are about a block from the arena and superdome, so there is no need for a taxi. Hotel is newly renovated and the inside is lovely. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Convention Service”
Reviews.Author: houstongal43
Reviews.Content: I recently attended a convention at the Hyatt. The location (in relation to Bourbon Street and The French Quarter) is terrible. I would not recommend walking and a taxi ride to The French Quarter is about $16.00. We had a large group, so the fare for an individual may be less (?). When we arrived (around 4:30 p.m.) our rooms were not ready. We noticed the lobby was full of people waiting. When we questioned why they were waiting, we were told the hotel had oversold rooms and they were waiting to see if they actually had a room (even though they had a reservation). I also spoke to others who said the hotel sent them to another hotel a few blocks away - very inconvenient when your meetings start @ 7:30 a.m.!! When we got to our room, it was musty-smelling and the air conditioning did not work properly. We had to call a serviceman to come look at it. He did arrive promptly and fixed the problem. The furnishings in the room (which are black) were dusty and when we moved the setee' over for the roll away bed, there were pennies and peanuts under it (??). The internet is not free and only one person in the room has access to it. I'm not sure if this was the hotel's fault, but on our first morning, breakfast was served buffet style and we had to carry our plates all the way across the hotel to our meeting room. What's up with that? Our food was cold by the time we sat down to eat! Then that afternoon at lunch (buffet style, again) they served right outside our meeting room (imagine the concept!) but they ran out of food!!! Gees! The final meal was delivered to us via wait staff - guess they got enough complaints about running out of food and carrying it all over the hotel! The meeting rooms were nice and the food was good. Thats all I have to say about that.

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice but not quite up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: TravelATL
Reviews.Content: Brand new, humongous renovation for humongous hotel after total Katrina damage made me want to love this place. It's a beautiful space, especially the 32 floor high window wall in front, and the lounge bar areas were stylish and comfortable. Unfortunately the service, although very friendly, was inconsistent. Things like no products in the bathroom one day, and the paper only delivered 1 of 4 days. There was a loud whistleing noise coming from the vent all hours of the day. I reported it twice, but nothing was done. In their defense, they may not have been able to do anything about this. Also, the gym was rather small for such a big hotel, but did have a spectacular view.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: CleosKeeper
Reviews.Content: The hotel is new, fresh and modern. The public areas Are chic and attractive. Our room was extra comfy. The mattress was perfect. I like the bathroom with the large shower. The magnifying mirror was a nice plus. This is a huge convention hotel. It is not in the tourist area. It would be best to take a cab back to the hotel late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property!”
Reviews.Author: pinkwaspy
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the Hyatt Regency New Orleans. The rooms were gorgous and large with nice amenities. I enjoyed overlooking the city from my 22nd floor room! The only drawback is the $38 valet but that's to be expected throughout the city. Everyone was really nice and the buffet was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, staff tries to make it work”
Reviews.Author: spike5882
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is obviously very new and modern. As mentioned in previous posts, there is high tech items throughout (most notably the elevator controls which I thought were pretty cool.) The rooms were nicely decorated and spacious, and the bed comfortable. I also really liked their toiletries brand. It is a very large hotel, and a large number of conferences were going on while we were there. Overall, they seemed to handle it pretty well. We had a bit of an issue the first day with check-in, getting our room in a timely manner -- then wrong room as promised. Ultimately, I ended up contacting the manager to let them know of my disappointment in a few of these items. Fortunately, they were very responsive throughout and tried to be accommodating, and ultimately they made sure we enjoyed the rest of our stay. Overall, I think there are some kinks still being worked out, but everybody involved was very friendly and certainly tried to correct any issue they could. So, certainly some props for that. As mentioned, the location is next to the superdome -- so night right near the French Quarters. I am a bit of an explorer and wanderer, and I love to walk. So, for me, the location was not an issue. In fact, I liked that it was between French Quarters and uptown, as it was easy to walk over to catch the street car on St Charles to head up to some of the great restaurants in uptown. Speaking of restaurants, we tried out Borge for lunch. The food was really great, and the oyster shell pillars were pretty cool. Definitely try the duck poppers -- we ate them all without even taking a breath in between each piece :)

Reviews.Title: “new hotel; needs a lot of tweaking”
Reviews.Author: pinotnoir22
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt opened in October 2011 and it is a beautiful hotel with state of the art everything. BUT there are many "bugs" to be worked out throughout the hotel and restaurants. We went to the lobby bar for a drink and the waitress never came to our table to wait on us. So my husband walked up to the bar and got our drinks. We stayed for about an hour and the waitress did not stop at our table at all. The was trouble with the elevator. Our keys did not work and we had to replace them twice. Valet service was very slow. However, on the plus side, the front desk was very personable, the breakfast buffet was amazing, it is located right beside the Superdome, there is a Rousse Market one block away (great selection of everything!), walking distance to Bourbon St and many fine restaurants. Hyatt has a reputation for quality and I think once the management gets a handle on the problems of opening a brand new, very large (32 story) hotel, it will be a 5 star review next time.

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL ROOMS/HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: twinter65
Reviews.Content: II do not understand the negitive reviews. My room was BEAUTIFUL!!! Maybe competitors are writing against this hotel.Yes I do agree is far from effecient. Overall though this hotel is beautifully decorated spotlessly clean and very modern.I stay in 4 and 5 star hotels. This hotel exceeded my expectations.The view from my corner room was amazing...so much so we left our curtains open all night. I asked for a coffee maker and it was delivered to my room.We watched the Saints playoff game in the resturant...WHAT AN EXPERIENCE!!! So awesome! Great people.It was sad to see them lose. New Orleans has so much passion when it comes to their football!This is a 5 STAR HOTEL....BEAUTIFUL!! There I said it again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel...but far from great!”
Reviews.Author: KIWIBOYCalgary
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for five days for business and a little pleasure. Overall the experience was okay. Front Desk: Pleasant but efficient it is not. Our room type was not available when we checked in (at 6:15pm!!) so talked the girl into an upgrade to a suite. (We had an event at 7pm that we needed to freshen up for after traveling 10+ hours). That was about the best service we got. Some of the team were staying for a couple of days after the business meetings and were consistently told to ask to come back the next day to check if rooms are available. For my workmate and I, when we did find a room, we had to change rooms. That was fine though. I had brought AE Travelers Checks with me and EVERY time I want to change them...no-one on the front desk knew they could change them. One didn't even know what they were. What service are you in again? WOW!!! They had to consistently ask their manager on duty. I think some time training their front desk staff is overdue! Check out was quick so I will give them that. Rooms: Okay, but nothing great...especially for the $$$ they are asking for. Bathrooms are small, someone else mentioned the sub-standard toiletry's, and surprisingly...no extractor fan in the bathroom. So the mirror kept fogging up of course when one showers. Beds were comfortable though. TV's were decent. Only other gripe is that I am a late to bed person, so if you are like me, be warned...there is no room service after about 1am. There is a shop below though, but the food is pretty poor. Cleaners: Ummm....yeah!!! Stayed for five days in two rooms....saw one cleaner, once! As mentioned above, we got a suite upgrade when we checked in and had to order a cot as the suites only come with one bed. I like my workmate, but there is a line :) The cot arrived fine, but one would think to oh I don't know...say, provide sleeping things like...a blanket etc. Had to call FD to get them delivered. Not rocket science people. We are not pigs so it wasn't a messy room, but cleaning it once or twice and making the beds now and again would have been great. Someone else mentioned a newspaper delivered daily...what newspaper? They must have been one of the special people who had their rooms cleaned, beds made etc. Hotel Itself: Overall it is a nice hotel. The lounge/sports bar is nice. the bar food is good...for bar food. Staff are friendly. It is an atrium set up so very open. I guess some may have heard noise in their rooms but we didn't. The overall look is by far...better than their overall service! Location: I found the location fine. Close to the Superdome which was nice as we went to a Hornets v Mavericks game. I found the walk fine to Bourbon Street, pleasant and not dangerous at all. We even walked to and from the French Q which was also a nice walk. Not sure what some are talking about with it being dangerous...it isn't at all. However, if you are a girl alone, then yeah. For safety reasons it would be best to cab it. But no different than any other city. Overall: Okay hotel but would only come back if their was a smoking deal on rooms. The cost of the rooms do not warrant the overall experience you will receive here. It is a good hotel...but far from great!

Reviews.Title: “Better than some reviews indicate”
Reviews.Author: mesier1111
Reviews.Content: I must first reveal that I use Hyatt ALOT. I stay in all kinds of levels from Hyatt Places to the Grands in Asia. After reading some of the reviews by other business people, I was a little hesitant to book here, but the price was reasonable and I have faith in Hyatt. Sure enough, my faith was rewarded with obvious improvements in service over some reviews from December. Overall, the food was both BETTER than expected, with the most reasonable prices I have ever seen at a Hyatt (this was for their sports bar type restaurant, I forget the name). The service was excellent here as well. My only complaints were that the at check-in I was not informed of where the various amenities were located, like the Club Level Lounge, so it took me calling down and asking a few times. I don't think this is a big deal, but as a long time Hyatt customer, this is not typical of Hyatt. Another complain was my room (1702) was close enough to the elevators that I could hear the humming of the elevator shaft when the room was completely quiet (no TV and no climate control fan on). The bell boys, and staff in front of of the hotels for arranging transportation and stuff were SPOT ON. Very nice, very knowledgeable and up to Hyatt standards. Also, the TV system that they use is a "little" temperamental, but love the idea as they work out the kinks in it. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, especially for those looking to find a place to stay for business that is close enough to Bourbon and other areas to fit in some site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Stunningly BAD”
Reviews.Author: Man99204
Reviews.Content: I find it hard to beileve that this property is a part of the Hyatt Organization. Not only is it BAD, it is STUNNINGLY bad. For the prioces this facility charges, you should receive a significantly higher level of service, and significantly better amenities It has by far the worst service I have ever encountered in any hotel chain. In January 2012 I spent two nights a tthe hotel. Our room was not cleaned at all the first day. Our room was not cleaned at all the second day. At 5pm on the second day, I called the front desk to complain. I can back from an extended dinner, and still nothing had been done. The internal noise level of this hotel is unbelievable. It is designed with an open atrium, all of the rooms front this atrium. They play live music at the bottom of this space. My room was on the 22nd floor. At 11pm, the wall of my room was vibrating from the music down below. The hotel is located in an awkward neighborhood. Too far away from the French Quarter to conveniently (and safely) walkdown there. It is positioned behind most of the major buildings downtown, so there is no view to speak of. You should also be away that there is so "self park" facility in this hotel. IF you bring a car you will be billed an additional $42.00 per day for valet parking

Reviews.Title: “Don't check in via email.”
Reviews.Author: AcajunAnna
Reviews.Content: This is a newly renovated hotel. I was disappointed that I was encouraged to check in via the interenet and was sent an email that my room was ready at 10:30 am, only to arrive at 2:30 and be told that my room was not ready. It took the clerk about 10 minutes, but she did find a room for me. Nice room, comfortable beds, lots of gadgets like a docking station for my iphone and an internet TV. The front entrance and check-in desk is very far from any elevator. We had to walk across the building to take 2 escalators and then walk the whole length of the building to get to the elevator that took us to our floor, then another long walk to our room, which was at the end of a hall.There was a nice bar and restaurants on the 3rd floor that were open late after our football games. Valet parking fee of $38 is charged to your room, even if you don't use it. We parked at the hotel and walked to the game, which was a long walk for a 75 year-old after walking all the way through the hotel. Next time, we will stay at a less expensive hotel farther away from the Superdome then drive to and pay to park at the dome the game.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans landmark struggles to be the best but falls short...”
Reviews.Author: SalemTravelBureau
Reviews.Content: I wanted to loved this hotel but it came up short. First, if you are going to a game at the Superdome there isn't a better choice. A true convention hotel, large hotel with services geared for thousands of guests. I would have no hesitation booking a huge convention at the Hyatt. The first impression is good, valet quickly took my car. Parking is expensive but unlimited in and out privileges. The front desk is modern with receptionists standing in front of their kiosks to welcome guests. The highest level of customer service training is evident. Easy check-in and quick directions to the guest elevator lobby. Up the escalator or elevator to the lobby level with a lobby bar, sports bar and restaurant. The elevator system is one of two in the US..the other at the Marriott Marqis in NYC. You wave your room key under a box at the end of the elevator bay. It will display an elevator..A, B, C, etc... The elevator then knows your floor and makes an express trip to your floor. (This high tech elevator system was not properly explained at check-in. A guest explained it when I.was looking for an up button that didn't exist). There were workers cleaning and touching up paint and trim. It is evident that the highest standards are expected by management for this hotel, it was clean and comfortable. My problems were with common sense and simple requests. I ate in the sports bar. The meal was good, not great. I had to send my wine back, it had the bouquet of bleach! I think the bar back forgot to rinse the glass after a bleach bath. The bar manager apologized and didn't charge me for this wine. Met this same bar manager the next night when at the lobby bar located across from the sports bar I couldn't get a red wine...I suggested they walk 15 feet to the other bar and get one from the sports bar. Another night I asked for a wine glass to take to my room and was told it would be in a plastic cup. When I questioned the statement, I was told on game days drinks are served in cups. No game and I was a sober lady in business dress who does not drink wine from a solo cup. Sometimes a lady would like a wine in the room rather than sitting alone in a bar. One apology later and I was on my way upstairs with a glass of wine. The next night I ate in the restaurant. Less than 15 minutes after being seated, the buffet was taken down without any notice. With shellfish allergies there wasn't much I could eat. My complaint to this same bar/restaurant manager was that someone should have either told me when I was seated or before they tore down the buffet that It would be removed at a specific time. No such notice was given any of the restaurant guests. Now for what was right...meeting rooms excellent, cool but very nice. The catering for meetings was superb, from Eggs Benedict with steak to New Oleans beignets our breakfasts were excellent. From breakfasts to lunch to cocktails the catering could not have been better. The hotel general manager spoke to our group. He is a man passionate about his hotel. He has seen it through Katrina to this long awaited reopening. I believe with his dedication that any service issues will soon be resolved. The guest rooms are very nice with an armoire and chair in a little foyer and behind this wall a luxurious bed, desk and chair with a nice reading lamp. I'd give the rooms and the bed very high marks. Again, if you are planning a convention, this is a perfect hotel. If you are attending a sporting event, perfect choice. If you are going to the French Quarter, you should plan for a taxi ride. There is construction in front of the hotel which will eventually bring the trolley line to the hotel. A $5 taxi ride to the casino. Not far but a little far to walk at night, especially when taxis are so affordable. Would I stay here again, sure!

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but nice furnishings”
Reviews.Author: michael p
Reviews.Content: Rooms here are on the small side, but the bed was new and comfortable and the bathroom was clean - as would be expected from a newly reopened hotel. It's a high-tech place with an internet TV and elevators that don't have buttons. Takes a little getting used to, but nothing too bothersome. Very convenient location for Superdome events, but you'll probably want to taxi to the French Quarter/Bourbon Street. Wasn't crazy about the bath products, which had no scent whatsoever. Maybe some people enjoy that. Did love getting a local newspaper every morning - big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option for Superdome”
Reviews.Author: ellen0206
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the Sugar Bowl - a PERFECT location if going to a game at the Superdome (or New Orleans Arena). This property has so many good things going for it - despite not being in the Quarter. The staff couldn't be more helpful and friendly - especially loved the checkout options via iPads (staff stationed around hotel so you didn't have to get in line at the front desk). The rooms were my favorites of any Hyatt at which I've stayed. Very modern, very well done. Absolutely love all of the services available by TV. Arrived after midnight and was able to order breakfast via TV options instead of getting up early to call it in or having missed the time for pickup via one of those menus hanging on the doorknob. Other perks: Starbucks on site, one of the nicer gift/convenience shops I've seen at a non-resort property and a nice bar scene.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but very hard to navigate and difficult access to rooms”
Reviews.Author: deekzee
Reviews.Content: I was here on business for 2 nights January 2012. The hotel is gorgeous inside. Really lovely, modern and welcoming. This was the most difficult hotel to navigate around in and get to your room Iâ€™ve ever experienced (including monster casinos in Vegas) You have to go up two sets of escalators, through a bar/lounge area with tons of people to get to your room (with luggage, mind you, not fun) I donâ€™t complain about much (isnâ€™t that what everyone says here?), but itâ€™s true. Then once you get to the elevator bank, you have to punch in your room number on this keypad, then it tells you which elevator to go in. I got lost many times trying to exit and enter the hotel. You have to exit to the lobby outside on the 3rd or 2nd floor and again, go through that bar area. Very annoying. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I would have liked easy access to a vending machine or coffee, but I had nothing and neither did the whole hotel. When I come to New Orleans again, Iâ€™ll be staying elsewhere. This was way too difficult (albeit a beautiful) of a hotel. The Fedex office (business center) was helping in delivering my packages to my conference room, BUT they charged $25/per box! Insane to go from one side of the floor to the other (didnt even have to go to another floor!)

Reviews.Title: “Bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: BaileyCR
Reviews.Content: Grand reopening about a week before our annual conference and they are not ready for anyone. be aware. Problems: staff are good at some times, mostly terrible but that is what i hear you get in the manpower pool in Nola. For a Hyatt regency, that's pretty bad. They have elevators that are 'smart' in that they read your key and they take you to your room floor. What if you want to go to meet a friend at their room? not good. It won't let you. Also, with 1700 people at a conference, they take over 20 minutes minimum to arrive and then they are full. You have to start over again. Try that when you have to be somewhere. Also,i love it when the valet tells you to go two different places for a taxi, then finally you are where you are supposed to be and they take everyone before you. I literally saw many folks going off on them because they were so un organized. I could go on an on but this was the final straw- i was given late checkout (thank you) but a male staffer kept coming into my room- yes literally entering my room and scaring me. So, I rushed out- leaving my jewelry. When I went to the front desk- because my key was now deactivated- of course the housekeeper 'didn't find anything..sorry'. Liars and thieves. Looks great on the outside but the inside is bad.

Reviews.Title: “Re-opened in Style”
Reviews.Author: Gunners14
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Hyatt Regency NOLA. I'm giving this review 4 stars, despite a couple of hiccups, because I know enough to give a little bit of slack to a recently opened hotel, especially in a city desperate for a quality workforce like New Orleans. To explain, yes, a couple waiters/waitresses were slow. Yes, a couple of the front desk people were difficult to work with. But I have faith in the Hyatt brand that they will filter through those people over the course of their ramp-up period and in no time at all, this hotel will be operating much more smoothly. The room was fantastic. We had a suite, spacious, great view. I don't know why there isn't a dresser, we had no where to put our clothes but on the couch and whatever we could hang up in the closet. But we didn't mind it too much. The restaurants/bars were great. really enjoyed the food and the prices. I like the location. Some people are complaining about the mile walk to the french quarter, but I'm a new yorker and I like that. burn off some calories and a couple beers each way. And you can avoid the hustle and bustle of the french quarter when you want to just take it easy for the night. Anyway, nice work to the owners for a job well done. Let's just get that wheel greasing a little more smoothly with the employees and you'll be golden.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Exterior, People aren't the best”
Reviews.Author: garyinmichigan
Reviews.Content: Nice new building but the waitstaff, front desk and maid service know very little about customer service. We were skipped once by the housekeeping staff and had to call multiple times to ensure our rooms would be cleaned. The front desk told us things that were untrue about the property and the wait staff at dinner and breakfast were far from friendly. One bright spot, the valet service was top notch (at $50/day).

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Go-Saints-in-12
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated Hyatt was outstanding. One of the top 5 hotels in New Orleans. Staff when out of their way to make everything wonderful. The place to stay for all New Orleans sporting events.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: KatherineGear
Reviews.Content: We arrived excited to stay at the newly renovated Hyatt NOLA for a getaway weekend and were very impressed by the entire hotel, the restaurants, service and the rooms. Our room was always cleaned, it was a tad farther than other hotels we've stayed at since we frequented the French Quarter, but it was about a mile walk, which is fine with us. We ordered room service, which was great- took awhile and was a bit hard to do on the TV. The rooms were spacious and clean, the only downside was the construction going on each morning that was so loud we were always up by 8 am. The restaurant downstairs was delicious, both food and drinks, and decently priced. There wasn't a view from our room at all, but we weren't paying for the great views or location, so we didn't mind. It's a gorgeous new hotel, the staff was very accommodating, although it was crowded we never felt like it was too busy for our taste. We will probably be back again next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Brand New Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Matt_UKTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hyatt Regency New Orleans, for New Years Eve weekend 2011/2012. Overall, the hotel is fantastic - spotlessly clean, new rooms, amazing atrium and great restaurant/bar. Pros and cons are as follows: PROS: - Newly renovated - feels brand new. - Great rooms - Good restaurant/bar. Ideal for watching sports / having drinks. - Best hotel I have stayed at in New Orleans CONS: - Location - a little far from the French Quarter. Need to take a cab. - Parking is a rip off ($38 per day) I would have rated the hotel 5-stars if it were not for the parking fee. This is outrageous and needs to be addressed. Self-parking is even $28, which is still too high. I would advise any guest staying here, to simply refuse to pay the exorbitant fee.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed :-(”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior73FLA
Reviews.Content: Arrived last Tuesday for a 4 day business meeting. As I understand it the Hotel just reopened ($200M+ renovation) after Hurricane Katrina. The hotel was beautiful but they must be having a very difficult time hiring in Housekeeping. My room was new but less than the quality of clean I would have expected; carpte needed vacuuming, there was a "wad" of hair in the shower drain that was equal to about a 2 year supply in the average home..pretty shocking first thing in the morning. What was surprising was the Staff's seeming uninterested attitude. I called after my first morning shower and complained. I fully expecting a thorough cleaning by the time I arrived back at end of day. When I arrived back to my room around 5P the bed had been made and fresh towels were in bathroom but hair hadn't been touched in shower. I called Housekeeping again and waited for 1/2 hour before I had to leave for group dinner...well no one came. So when I got back after dinner I phoned and DEMANDED someone show up. In about 5-10 minutes two people came, cleaned bathroom and apologized for it. I was very disappointed with my experience at a brand new hotel and one with the quality expected at a Hyatt Regency. I NEVER heard from Management during the remainder of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “First class place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Kansascloud
Reviews.Content: Just back from the New Hyatt. It is HUGE but very very nice. Everyone I came in contact with from the front desk to the people in the concierges lounge made a special effort to make my short stay comfortable. My queen room was really small but very efficient, perfectly NEW clean and very comfortable. If you are attending an event at the Super Dome this will be the place to stay as it is practically built on the Dome. My room had an astonishing vew of it. It was quite a sight at night changing colors. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BSC Weekend and NFC Wildcard Playoff”
Reviews.Author: Vfangue
Reviews.Content: The Hyatt is perfectly located for sporting events in New Orleans. We attended the NFC wildcard game and the BCS football games. Our room overlooked a tailgate party on the corner of Poydras and Loyola. Within walking distance was the sports bar&grill WalkOns and the Superdome and Champions Square. First our room was large and comfy and housekeeping friendly and helpful. The room faced that main atrium and was large and spacious. I was pleasantly suprised that we heard no noise from the open atrium in our room. The only drawback was the there is not a coffee pot in the room. After a night out, one does not want to walk down to the second level to Starbucks for coffee (and when the hotel is fully booked, the line at starbuck was VERY VERY long!) They ran out of bagels, cream cheese, danishes, fruit cups. Room service took over 2 hours to deliver breakfast!! I just needed a single cup of coffee! Lines were long everywhere at the Veriscope and the bar. It was congested at the front escalator as this is the only way to the ground level. On checkout, the line for valet parking wrapped the exterior block for your car. After this rant, I will say though that the hotel is lovely and we would gladly stay there on another weekend that did not have back to back events. BEWARE if you're planning to stay here for the Superbowl in 2012, it will be a chaotic madhouse! But isn't that they fun??

Reviews.Title: “Bigger than big! Like a city in itself!”
Reviews.Author: conniear50
Reviews.Content: The service supreme, the accommodations deluxe! Nothing was lacking from this stay with everything maxed out with quality. We thourally enjoyed the city and being able to walk to many of our destinations in the immediate area. The French Quarter and the Audubon Aquarium of the Americas, the trollies, great food and fun were right at our fingertips! Valet parking is pricey but parking is unreasonable throughout the city. Some may suggest seeking free parking at Harrah's casino there at the end of Canal Street. It would save about thirty five dollars. The other way we were able to enjoy this unique experience was to bid on this room and get it at an extremely reasonable rate,

Reviews.Title: “Pleasurable visit”
Reviews.Author: traveldukes
Reviews.Content: We just checked out of the Hyatt after attending the sugar bowl. Although the game didn't go our way, our stay at the hyatt was very nice. Upscale amenities, very accommodating staff, and technologically savvy folks will really like it. Great food in the sports bar before the game and after they set up a bbq station by the elevators, which was surprisingly very tasty. $10 cab rides to the quarter, or 20 minute walk. Wish they had a shuttle to canal street. If we are coming to another event at the superdome, we would be glad to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to Super Dome”
Reviews.Author: hammyone
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for the Sugar Bowl - considered staying in the French Quarter but glad we selected this site as it's so convenient next to the stadium. The renovation of the hotel was nice - great bar/seating areas. Rooms were clean and updated. Only complaint was poor lighting in the bathroom - modern fixtures but the lighting could use a boost. Only an $8 cab fare to the French Q. Workout room was good - lots of cardio and overlooked the city.

Reviews.Title: “The not quite ready for prime time players...”
Reviews.Author: Bagcoffee
Reviews.Content: I spent almost two nights a week in a hyatt last year for work travel and overall the chain does a great job of providing fairly even service across properties. This hotel, however, simply opened before it was ready a few months ago and is not showing signs of catching up. The renovations to the property itself are beautiful, but the service delivered is far from up to par. Check-in is chaotic and disorganized even for diamond members. Our club room has no luggage racks, no towel hooks or hooks of any kind in the bathroom, and other signs of just not being complete. The design of the rooms also have some issues such as the faucets not being long enough and barely clearing the back of the sink - washing hands is almost impossible without spilling all over the counter. The regency club is nicely appointed, but the entire bank of electrical outlets along the window wall are not activated making working with a computer or charging a phone difficult. You've been open over 3 months and haven't addressed something as simple as that? As a diamond member (as are any paying club room guests) we are entitled to complimentary breakfast and this morning we arrived at a few minutes after 9 amam and breakfast was over. No one told us a time at check-in and I just assumed a pretty standard 10 or 11 am, but no - 9 am! The other issue is that room service closes from 12-5 pm. You can't order lunch!?! In a new hyatt hotel this just seems incredible to me. We've asked for a few items at different times and staff said they'd take care of it and just disappeared never to be heard from again... My experience is every staff member I've spoken to just looks to send you to someone else to address your need - no one seems to want to take responsibility for anything to help a guest. If the reviews are pointing out the same things months after opening the cursory replies by management to reviews are clearly all they are doing to address it. Developing a organizational culture in a new property takes some time, but it is just simply not happening under current management. There are clearly top-down training problems that need fixing. If I were Hyatt I'd be worried having my name in neon over this property.

Reviews.Title: “very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mike2909
Reviews.Content: brand new hotel, very friendly staff and nice atmosphere, but i have to say that the valet parking fee is ridiculously high ($ 45 a day) specially for a place sorrounded by parking lots at a very competitive price. Also I must complain about having to pay for in room internet conecction, even in a recency club room.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome job”
Reviews.Author: Irish311
Reviews.Content: Took my fiance here for a suprize birthday trip and to propose, this hotel made our experince a memory. First of all looking at what they have done with the property since what the storm did, it's amazing what man can do. This is the best city location hotel I have stayed at so far in my life. The art and decor is great just the way everything is executed was just incrediable. Especially since they are recently opened, I can just imagine how much better it will be. Love the concept of the elevators I didn't even have to share them with anyone (wait why did they smell like mustard tho?) takes you directly to your floor quickly. Not to mention the whole ride up on the far side you can see the Super Dome (it was lit up green and red for Christmas). Our room was in the corner and gave us a spectacular veiw of the city on 2 sides it was amazing. Called for a toothbrush got it 15 minutes later.
