I lived at the concierge desk where Robert the nicest guy helped me find everything and get everywhere. Another employee a wonderful sales worker made sure everything with our stay was perfect. It really made our stay special and we are so grateful for it. The food was just great the lunch buffet isn't a buffet at all, it is just great food as the illusion of a buffet and the dessert selection on it will stop you cold in your tracks before you can even get to the quarter. A lot of people said the quarter wasn't in walking distance. It is really like a 5 minute crawl away through nothing but safe business neighborhoods. Unless your incrediably lazy which is fine to because a cab is $7 to the quarter, I however suggest the walk because you will eat so much food in New Orleans. I really can't say enough good things about this property, we just visted Hyatt Grand Cypress in Septemberish? and we thought it was our favortie hotel in south until we came here. I can't wait to see it completely up and running. If your going to New Orleans you have to choose this hotel it is 5 star luxury you'll love it. Oh and I always forget them but housekeeping my room was done so just great everyday, you guys never get enough love for making my stay more clean then my own home. Thank You Hyatt New Orleans will see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: msgrits
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a recent weekend getaway using our Hyatt points. The property hasn't been open since Katrina and has gone through extensive renovation. We were not aware that we'd booked our stay during a bowl game next door at the Superdome. As result, they were packed to the brim with fans. The staff handled it perfectly. Check in and check out were both a breeze. Smiling staff met us on the escalator with iPads to expediate checkout. The beds and pillows were comfy and the Regency Lounge is well worth the extra bucks of you aren't a diamond Hyatt points member. It includes a continental breakfast, snacks throughout the day, and cocktails in the evening. We had one hiccup in the Vidascope restaurant. Two you waitresses were so busy flirting with a table of attractive men that they completely ignored us. We also went the several times to ask for service but no one ever came. Eventually Jaycee, I think she's operations manager moved us to another section where Brian gave us outstanding service. We even got a little happy on room later. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, BUT......”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustatheart
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed overnight at the Hyatt Regency in New Orleans. We live within 50 miles of the property and decided to make it a week-end in the city to a college bowl game . As others have stated, the property recently reopened after being slammed by Hurricane Katrina six years ago. Everything is new so that's a plus. Our room was on the 26th floor, supposedley upgraded. Room was nice, clean, and plenty large enough. It overlooked the rooftop air conditioning system (ugh!). The bathroom is extremely small. Our room had a shower only which the desk clerk did not tell us as we would not have accepted that room. We found the staff very friendly. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet in the restaurant. However, be forewarned....valet parking is $38 a night (plus tax and tip) which I consider highway robbery. Parking in the city is expensive but $40+ a night is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.....BUT”
Reviews.Author: Douglas Reid
Reviews.Content: Where to startâ€¦â€¦I have always heard that you should â€œPat them on the back before you kick them in the rearâ€� soâ€¦â€¦ I am a long time user of this website and VERY seldom have I written a negative review. Even now, I want to give them credit where credit is due and I will compliment what I thought was good, but I wonâ€™t be staying in this property again. The freshly renovated property is lovely and very well appointed. Every facet of the construction states â€œquality and prideâ€�. From the moment we arrived, the staff in this hotel was as pleasant, warm, welcoming and helpful as they could possibly have been. Never have I experienced staff quite so obviously doing their level best to insure our comfort and satisfaction. Let me say right off the bat, all the basic functions in the room worked: there was hot water, towels and the AC/Heater worked, BUT, the thermostat in the room works backwards from that in your home so it is counter-intuitive. We had to be instructed in its use. How difficult would it have been to have installed thermostats which were easy to figure out? The troubles began to appear when we looked around our roomâ€¦â€¦no coffeepot, no, microwave, and, in an era of total connectivity, NO free internet. They charge up to $20.00 for total connection ($10.00 for basic internet). It isn't that this hotel doesnâ€™tâ€™ think you need the internet, the obviously do, I made my reservation over the internet, checked in before I departed for New Orleans on the internet, and even checked out over the internet while in my hotel room. This just seems a disingenuous way of raising the room rate in order to successfully compete with other hotels which offer this basic service free of charge. The internet thing seems simply cheap on their part and began to leave us with a feeling that we were going to be nickel and dime-d for everything. In fact, from the $38.00, per day, valet Fee (Not including a total of $5.00 tax per day) EVERYTHING in this property was only available at extra cost. Getting connected to the internet proved to be a VERY difficult process. Nowhere in the room were there any instructions for doing so. After a trip to the desk I was finally able to get instructions from the IT guru for the property (located not in the building but in Colorado) and log onto the service I had paid for. The most frustrating online experience I have had in many, many years though because the system constantly and intermittently lost internet service. I was able to stay connected to the network itself, but the network was not able to stay connected to the internet reliably. The hotel refunded the connection fee, of course, but that did nothing to help me do what I needed to do online. After the first night we left the room at 9AM and didn't return until 3:30 to freshen up for the evenings activities (New Orleans Bowl). The room had not been serviced when we arrived and in fact we had to call housekeeping to get someone to come to the room to service it. NOT what I call exemplary service in a property of this caliber. Overall, the next time I am in New Orleans, I will stay somewhere else, this place left me with a VERY bad taste in my mouth.

Reviews.Title: “Still Learning”
Reviews.Author: bandman
Reviews.Content: This Hyatt just reopened and they are still in the learning process. They have the potential to be a world class hotel, but they don't have a clue as to how to handle a huge crowd. I just learned that last night was the first sell out in this hotel, and when the crowd from the New Orleans Bowl returned to the hotel the staff was lost. When we valet parked they told us we had to self park several blocks away. They did take care of us when they found out we had prearranged our parking. The rooms are very minimalist. There is a very nice TV and an iPhone home player. The elevators are fun when they work. Will I return? Yes, when they have a special. Otherwise there are other Places as nice for much less money.

Reviews.Title: “First time in New Orleans...”
Reviews.Author: HockeyAJ24
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with some of the hardest working staff I've seen in a long time. True the hotel is still working out some kinks, but nothing that impacted our stay. Love the high tech in-room TV system! We appreciated the 10 min walk over to the French Quarter to work off all the great NOLA food!!! By the way, never felt unsafe walking anywhere. Keep your head up and walk with awareness and you'll be fine. A rule of thumb in ANY city. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Not Worth the Cost”
Reviews.Author: auburn8
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at the Hyatt Regency New Orleans was overall a pleasant experience. Check in was relatively painless though I agree with other reviewers that some kind of line system would be beneficial because it is luck of the draw if you get behind somebody with a problem that might take 20 minutes to solve. I got through very quickly but somebody right down from me was clearly upset he had been waiting quite some time. Be aware that there is no elevator access to your room from the lobby area. If you are carrying your own luggage you have to go to the 3rd floor and transit a large atrium area to get to the elevators that take you to your room. The elevators are quick and technologically advanced. Request an upper floor room if possible. We requested a Regency Club room because we had a busy schedule and knew from past experience with Hyatt's clubs that we could skip a meal or two and just drop by the club lounge and grab a nice snack. We were very disappointed with this property's lounge. For a city with such a "foodie" reputation you would think that management would take some pride in offering excellent food in their lounge. We've stayed at Hyatt properties in Phoenix, Orlando, Atlanta, and elsewhere and have always had excellent food. This property was very disappointing! Our room was nice sized and was very comfortable. The TV is a large computer monitor and the remote a mouse. The technology was pretty cool! The bed was very comfortable. Our bathroom, though small, was nicely appointed. We had some minor issues with lack of hot water pressure but not enough to complain about. The view from the 26th floor was very nice. Staff overall was very friendly and knowledgeable. Our only staff problem came when we checked out and tried to get our car called up. The young lady who answered the call said "We are real busy, you are just going to have to come down and wait". Other than her, the staff was professional and very nice! This hotel is a great choice for an event at the Dome or doing business in New Orleans. It is a moderate walk to the French Quarter, the museum district or the convention center. Overall, I think this is a nice hotel and will only get better when the "break-in" period is over. Right now, though I would not upgrade to a Club room. It just isn't worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but food is so-so, valet was a mess!”
Reviews.Author: JSGRAFFEO
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, we stayed in an Executive Suite and loved the views of the city! We are locals and decided to try it out for our Anniversary. Food choices are slim, although we hear that John Besh is opening a restaurant in 2012. We love going to Velocity Hall to watch football games, but the food needs improving. The Sunday morning buffet could use a few more food options, but was overall good. The Valet was terrible and desperately needs improving! On check out yesterday there was a line of at least 50 people waiting to get their cars. It was 45 degrees and windy in line. Freezing!! If this is going to be an ongoing problem there needs to be big, portable heaters outside to keep customers warm! The Valets were very nice and helpful, but they definitely looked overwhelmed! We will go back, but I hope the food and valet parking improves.

Reviews.Title: “HYATT FAIL”
Reviews.Author: gumbeaux_yaya
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice and have starved both times. If u come for a big event, there is no place nearby in the CBD to eat breakfast or late night. Room service stops at 11pm and there is only 1 Buffett to feed 700 rooms of people. The convenience store does not sell milk! They have expensive gifts and booze but no substantial breakfast, no fresh food and no milk. Starbucks has expensive coffee but no breakfast with meat and nothing filling. I NEVER WANT TO STAY HERE AGAIN. My family is hungry and irate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, shame about the hot water”
Reviews.Author: ZiggyNZ
Reviews.Content: I had one of the the best sleeps ever on level 26, the bed was so comfortable. As others have mentioned the property is still finding its rythym. The good: - love the technology, web check-in/check-out, fully interactive TV with mouse on the remote and keyboard (although I do wonder how my father would get on with this tech, he'd still be looking for the guest services folder). NFC keys for elevator and room access, self-service kiosls in the lobby to queue bust - the hotel is beautiful, an amazing atrium, loads of eating options - Regency club room is great, amazing views and good complimentary refreshment options - club rooms a good size, bathroom a bit small but was totally adequate Not so good; - boiler decided to not play ball in the morning - there was no hot water in the guest rooms for at least 90 minutes - in the main didning area for breakfast I was not serverd once in 20 minutes. I helped myself to the buffet and made a point of paying when I left at the seating station. The manager said they had 30 servers on duty, where they were I had no idea, and it was not that busy eiither I'd gladly stay again as I think these faults will be rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelscott
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and loved the hotel and the room. The lobby and public areas are beautiful, the rooms are great with queen beds and a 42 inch HD TV. The bathroom is a little small, but a large entrance way with a wardrobe instead of a closet. The elevators have a new type of digital key pad for operating the elevators instead of push buttons. The food was good and plenty of TVs in all the bars and restaurants for watching sports.

Reviews.Title: “Still working out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: mifyanks
Reviews.Content: This is a very new hotel so I'd imagine improvements are on the way but for now it's still not up to the standard I would expect from a Hyatt Regency. Aesthetically the place is beautiful. The check-in area, main lobby, restaurants, guest rooms & gym are all great looking and state of the art. Unfortunately, the service still has a ways to go. That said, it is a brand new hotel - so I'm sure some of the issues will be quickly resolved. The check in procedure was a little chaotic. The counter is large and there's not really an organized line. I was waiting behind someone figuring that the next available receptionist would take the next person in line but someone who was coming from another direction just walked to the counter at the other end when it became available. It took me 15 minutes to get checked in. Another person in my group waited nearly half an hour. When someone in our group called down for her car, the valet brought around the wrong car and it took 30 minutes for the correct car to be delivered. Room service wasn't available during lunch hours. My guestroom was very nice - and obviously everything was brand new - but the attention to detail seemed to be lacking. The folder for the notepad on the desk had a pen but no paper. And at no point during my three night stay was the paper ever replaced. There was a refrigerator in the room but surprisingly no mini-bar - just a bottle of water in the closet. The elevator system is a bit quirky. If you're on one of the lower floors (I was on the 7th floor) you can't take an elevator directly to or from the gym. You have to go to either the 3rd or 5th floor and switch elevators. It would be helpful if there was one elevator from the gym that would let you access all floors. As for location, you're in the business district so it's quiet (even a bit deserted) at night and on weekends. You're really close to the Superdome if you're in town for an event and it's only about a 10-15 minute walk to Bourbon Street. In all, I would suggest giving the place some time to find its footing before booking another stay.

Reviews.Title: “All Show and a little Go”
Reviews.Author: LaryS6143
Reviews.Content: I have to be a little lenient in that I stayed here the first weekend they were re open and lets say things were not going off without a hitch. It took a little while to get checked in, but I didn't have a reservation so they were more than accommodating. The new look of the place is gorgeous very modern and ornate but not obtrusive...just very clean and put together. Room was nice ...the first day- housekeeping didn't come the following two days. They were poorly understaffed for a very full opening weekend. They did bring me towels immediately upon request and anything else I should have needed they were quick to tend to. Quick though was not in the vocab of the in house Starbucks on the second floor...if you need caffeine one of the the 6 people working behind the counter can't help you and will screw up any instructions you might give them. Go downstairs to one of the restaurants...breakfast there is decadent and at 14 dollars CHEAP! I ate out for most meals but stopped there before my flight to grab a quick bite and was in a food coma by the time I left with a pretty great meat/cheese/fruit compote and honey spread -one for a hotel and two for a buffet style meal...overall decent stay. Hopefully they work out all the kinks.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor stay away from the Hyatt Regency New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: giants201Hoboken
Reviews.Content: I travel all the time for business and pleasure. My family and I stay at all types of hotels all over the world from Ritz Carltons to Marriots and Hyatts. When I checked into the Hyatt Regency New Orleans my family member's room had some previous guest waste all over the toilet. The housekeeper told my family member she overlooked it because the hotel had 700 rooms checking out. My room had no hotwater and even after calling management and having mainteance come up it still had no hot water. Breakfast was another joke we waited 45 minutes for scrambled eggs and when they finally came they were ice cold. The bathrooms in the suites are 36 sq ft,therefore you can not turn around. Finally, please management don't send a form letter since everyone in management knew about about our situation.

Reviews.Title: “Only with priceline”
Reviews.Author: laurabrys
Reviews.Content: We have been here for two nights and have two more left. The layout of the hotel is annoying where the elevators to the rooms are separated by two escalators, two bars and a restaurant. The rooms are fair in size, but our a/c didn't work when we arrived, so we had to call engineering to replace it. Housekeeping didn't come after our first night here, and there are no extractors in the bathrooms, so it gets very steamy. Fitness center is quite nice though with prime cardio equipment and a great view from the 32 floor. Location is within walking distance to French quarter during the day, but not at night due to crime. There used to be a shuttle before Katrina, but no mention of it now. A fine stay for a priceline hotel, but otherwise not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Run, don't walk.”
Reviews.Author: LegalEyes
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my team for business and won't be back. Wow, just weird. Room service doesn't bring water, but they have it at the store. Store is sold out. Really? Next room service meal has no utensils, staff asks if I ordered them. Really? Been if the bar is empty except for your crew and you are ordering tons of expensive drinks, be prepared to fetch it, the bar staff don't seem to understand why they are there (and no it wasn't busy). There is no restaurant (!) despite the size of the hotel, just the bar that serves food if you are lucky enough to snag attention. Awful yellow neon lighting and club music throughout were the final straw. I love modern, when pleasing. This is just the opposite. I'd rather stay in an Embassy Suites or lower end reliable chain, anything but the Hyatt. The positives: nice bell cap, nice check-in staff. That's about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: trader714
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a Executive Suite for my husband birthday on 11/11/11. First room we had a/c had issues, i called front desk and spoke to Rachel and she took care of switching our room with no problem. The have some kinks to work out, first room a/c was not working, and was not really cleaned to well, and not stocked with any amenities which i thought was strange, but the second room was perfect. The rooms are small even the executive suite was on the smaller side, but overall a very nice room. Bathrooms are small here as well. Bed was Super Comfortable, which is a plus. The hotel is beautiful and the elevator system is top notch. We did get to go up to the Regency Club and that is a nice touch, water, juice, coffee/cappuccino and sodas are free along with lil snacks throughout the day/night, also they have a continental breakfast as well. Drinks are at a discounted price. Its on the 32 floor and it has a beautiful view but you have to be in a club level room to have access to it. Overall nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful renovations”
Reviews.Author: jy5457
Reviews.Content: I actually was one of the first guests to check in on opening day. As soon as I stepped out my taxi, I was overwhelmingly greeted by a ton of doormen. (At least they were prepared!) Check in took a while because I was so early, but I was very happy with the new renovations. It does take some time to get to your room becuase the elevators are on the 3rd floor and very far from the escalator. The sportsbar/restaurant was packed for dinner. The food took awhile, but it was pretty good. I liked just about everything during my stay except that I didn't have a hairdryer. I called for one early in the morning (as I was getting ready for a meeting) and it never arrived. I had to leave for the day with wet hair! Not a great way to enter a meeting.

Reviews.Title: “What do you mean, you don't have corkscrews?”
Reviews.Author: mattypw
Reviews.Content: Ugh. Since this hotel has been through hell and back since Katrina, I wanted so badly for it to succeed. Our stay, unfortunately, was wrought with service issues, and I doubt I'd recommend this hotel to others based on that. As other reviews have said, the hotel is gigantic. The renovation looks amazing, especially in the public areas. While we didn't eat in the restaurants or bars, they looked to be very popular and cool. A lot of the banquettes have their own private flat-screen tv; this could be the next best thing to actually watching a Saints game next door in the Superdome! We were "upgraded" to a suite, which wasn't really a suite in that it's all one room with a wall down the middle that separates the bed from the couch. Not really big enough to entertain in or anything, and no privacy between the bedroom and the living area. Nicely decorated, nonetheless. The service was really the low point of the experience. I feel awful saying that, because the staff seemed so excited and eager; they just didn't seem to have the systems or communication channels that would be required in a hotel of this size. There were swarms of front desk agents standing around the lobby ready to help customers; however, if I ever needed to call down to the front desk for anything, the phone would ring for 10 minutes before someone picked it up (I'm not exaggerating. The only reason we put up with it is that it would have taken 10 minutes to walk down to the front desk anyway; the hotel is that big). I was supposed to receive a welcome amenity of wine and cheese. The front desk agent told me it would be up about a half hour after I checked in; it never showed up. We ended up buying our own wine, so we called down to ask for a corkscrew. After I was asked if I was looking for "the kind of corkscrew that opens wine" (I assured her that yes, this was the intended use of the corkscrew), I was told us that they weren't sure if they had any (!). A housekeeper showed up twenty minutes later with water glasses and told us "they're still looking for a corkscrew". We didn't hear from anyone else after that. We ran out of toilet paper (as soon as this happened, I realized that this rather unfortunate situation has never happened to me in a hotel before). 10 minutes of ringing, finally someone picked up..."yes, yes, we'll be right up with toilet paper"...and then nothing. (At the risk of getting too personal, I was lucky that there was a box of tissues in the room.) A panel in the ceiling of the shower fell out right before I got in...10 minutes of ringing...I asked them to hurry because we had dinner reservations..."I'll send someone right up," I was promised...someone showed up a half an hour later. By then, I had already had given up on the shower and just went out to eat unwashed. (Again, this review is making neither the hotel nor my resulting hygiene look particularly good. Blech.) At checkout, the front desk agents seemed shocked that I didn't receive the welcome amenity and promised a barrage of Hyatt Gold Passport points instead. I have yet to see this reflected in my account, leaving the taste in my mouth even more bitter. I know a lot of these things seem so trivial, but when every need or request you have results in some sort of service failure, it starts to get frustrating. And this was on a weekend; I can't imagine how this hotel is going to be able to deal with conventions. With a $275m renovation, you'd think they would have invested in some training or a pre-opening trial period to make sure that everything was running smoothly; it doesn't seem they did.

Reviews.Title: “unorganized”
Reviews.Author: cafiregirl
Reviews.Content: this hotel is newly reopened, it was loud, confusing, with clueless staff, rooms weren't cleaned well and overall it was not a good hotel for tourists, its more like a business persons hotel

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: We decided to try out the Hyatt during a non-Saint's football weekend. The check-in process took a bit longer as the front desk staff was still training. Very high tech elevators so make sure you understand how to use them because you don't want to end up on the wrong floor. There is no free internet regardless of whether you use your own computer or the fancy TV. The rooms are very small. I thought I was in NY because the room couldn't fit 2 adults. The bathroom is really weird. The faucet is too close to the edge so your hands cannot fit under the faucet. It was a huge mess of water when I tried to wash my hands and face. There is no toilet paper holder. The toilet paper sits on the counter so the first time I washed my hands I ruined the toilet paper because I got it all wet. The toilet is so close to the ledge that the seat does not stay up if you are a male trying to pee. The hotel does need to hire more housekeeping staff. We left the room early in the morning and came back at 4pm to change and they hadn't cleaned our room. They had 7 people to open the door but they couldn't afford 2-3 people to clean rooms? The other issue is the loud AC unit that can wake you up every time it turns on. I couldn't hear the TV because the AC was so loud. The Starbucks was good and the store next to it had some good pastries if you need something quick to start your day. The valet was pretty easy. No major issues considering there were plenty of people standing around. The bathroom is a big deal breaker. No toilet paper holder, it took us 10 minutes to get hot water (such a waste of water), only one vanity with no space in the room to have another mirror to put make-up on or even dry your hair. Towels are under the sink because there is no room for a towel rack. The toilet seat is high so short people will be uncomfortable sitting on it. It was just a weird bathroom. Overall it can be a good option if you want to be in the middle of the football frenzy but if you are there to enjoy the city I would stay at another location that has better floor plans and design.

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt Regency New Orleans Reopened”
Reviews.Author: Gypsy601
Reviews.Content: Six years after being totaled by hurricane Katrina, the Hyatt Regency New Orleans has reopened. The differences are definitely noticeable. There is no longer a ramp attaching it to the Superdome, there are more restaurants on the property, more convention space and all personnell from bell staff to reception to maid service are noticeably "guest friendly" and it is larger. We drove to New Orleans for a college football game and used the parking valet. The valet staff was courteous, friendly and helpful, but the service was s-l-o-w! That being said, keep in mind the hotel had reopened just 2 days prior to our arrival so I am sure there were some bugs still to be addressed. The parking charge is pretty steep at $38.00 per 24 hour period. You do not have to pay in-and-out fees. You can request your vehicle as often as you want for the 24-hour fee. We chose the Regency Club room category and were well pleased with our choice. Access to the Regency Club Room was the star attraction. A breakfast listed as "continental" was included but the offerings were definitely "continental plus". Also included were evening hors d'oeuvres that were generous enough not to warrant going out for dinner. We had been sightseeing all morning and attended a football game in the afternoon and by the time we returned to the hotel we really didn't want to fight the crowds downtown so the Regency Club Room was very welcome. There was a Saints game on Sunday and the traffic was getting pretty heavy by the time our game was over. For those of you who are Starbuck's groupies there is one on the 2nd floor. And for those who prefer a full buffet breakfast the "8 Block Restaurant" on the 3rd floor is amazing! We had the buffet breakfast the first morning we were there in error. As I said before, there were still a few bugs to be addressed and this was one of them. When we checked in we asked where we should go for the continental breakfast and were directed to the "8 Block". After going through the buffet line (you can also order from the menu if a buffet is not your style) and speaking to our server, something just didn't seem right. After breakfast, I went down to reception and was able to speak to someone who told us about the Regency Club Room and removed the charge for the buffet breakfast from our bill. There are several more restaurants on property, including a sushi restaurant. There is also a sundries shop selling everything from pastries and souvenirs to toothpaste. The hotel is a short distance from Union Station if anyone is traveling by train. If you want to be in the middle of the "action" in the French Quarter, it wouldn't be considered walking distance unless you really liked to walk, but if you're attending an event at the Superdome it can't be beat! Now, on the technical side, the 37" tv/computer monitor had a great picture...but for those of us who were born waaaay before computers, we had to have a technician in twice, but they worked on it Saturday while we were out and had it fixed by the time we got back. I opted not to purchased the internet package. We weren't staying long enough to pay the fees. The fees apply whether you use your own laptop or the in-room internet. The bed was wonderfully comfortable, the shower was great and we had plenty of hot water and towels. We had no problems with plumbing. Another concern was the A/C. It was noisy. We were watching TV Saturday night and when the A/C would come on we had to raise the volume on the TV.

Reviews.Title: “Will be THE place to stay once "bugs" are worked out!!”
Reviews.Author: bogeyboi
Reviews.Content: First, this hotel went through a $275 million dollar renovation and just reopened on the 19th, so I'm a bit empathetic. Second, I'm not referring to actual bugs in my header. Overall I enjoyed my week long stay here and give them a pass - they should have given the staff another month to train before reopening b/c their collective enthusiasm couldn't make up for the constant lack of attention-to-detail. For starters, rooms are small, bathrooms even smaller but both well appointed. Bed wasn't the most comfortable and you'll either have a view of the Mississippi or the new Mercedes Benz Superdome. In fact, you won't have to leave the hotel to get to the dome. Houskeeping repeatedly stocked not enough towels, had to call a few ti,es to have a drinking glass to my room as HK never left one for me. You'll have to actually close the bathroom door b/c it's that small - no room for 2 and there were complaints of NO HOT WATER!!There is a fridge (which comes empty but they'll be happy to stock for you) and a safe. Most high tech elevator set up I've seen - you slide you room key under a barcode scanner type machine and directed to the appropriate elevator. Usually by the time you get to it, the doors open. There are no floor buttons in the actual elevator. There are a host of convenience stores, Starbucks, and nice eats. 3rd floor is where they are and the food is very good and reasonably priced for a new upscale like hotel. Sports bar style restaurant has flat screens in every booth. You might notice a lot of on-the-job training going on from valet parking to wait staff. Service is a bit slow and unorganized but once worked out, this will be a very nice place to stay if you're not wanting to be in the French Quarter. I'll likely stay again on my next visit to NOLA but if they're still struggling with service issues, it will likely be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Let the good times roll!”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Camper_NOLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the new Hyatt on October 20th - the day after the grand reopening. The Hyatt has been closed since Katrina, and has been completely gutted and renovated, it's located right next to the Superdome. I was familar with the property as it existed prior to Katrina, but had never stayed in this Hyatt. They have done a great job with the renovation- it is a huge hotel (>1000 rooms) and has the feel and vibe of a hip Las Vegas property. The lobby is impressive - lots of check in counters and a very modern feel. You have to go up 2 escalators (or an elevator) to the main floor where there are several restaurants and a few bars. It's very open, modern (again a Las Vegas vibe). We ate at both the bar and the main restaurant, Block 9. We had drinks/Apps at the bar, Vitascope, which were good - the most impressive thing is the large beer selection and specialty drinks. They also offer a sushi bar in this area - we didn't try the sushi but it looked good. For just opening, the bar areas were already a happening scene. The rooms are on the small side - but are nice and modern. The bathroom is tight (only 1 sink in a double room) but nicely appointed. We had a room on the 18th floor and had an awesome view of the new lighting show at the Superdome (Now the Mercedes Benz Superdome). Service at the hotel was good - the staff are excited that the hotel is open and were very helpful. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant, 8 Block, was good - an omelet bar, lots of 'artisan' type dishes, and local southern specialties - andouille sausage, cheese grits, etc. The hotel is still working out a few kinks - the valet took a long time to return the car, and the servers in the restaurant are just learning what to recommend, etc. but overall they did a great job for the second day! The area where the Hyatt is located is the North Central Business District - and the closest hotel to the Mercedes Benz Superdome - so it will be the premier hotel for anyone attending a game, or any event at either the New Orleans Arena or Superdome . There are several bars and restaurants in the Hyatt, and there are a few bars/restaurants within walking distance - 'Walk-ons Bistreaux' (a big new sports bar) and 'Happys' another sports type theme restaurant. Both are on Poydras St. and are great choices for drinks/casual dinner. I've heard that Ste. Marie restaurant (former Cuvee chef) is great and is also within walking distance on Poydras. I believe that Champion Square (which is next door to the Hyatt) is also opening some restaurants (including Drago's the place to go for grilled oysters) Since the area is not that busy at night after business hours, and when there are no game/events, I would recommend not walking to/from the French Quarter at night. It's a short shuttle or cab ride away. If you're looking for a hip, modern hotel this would be the place to stay in New Orleans. This hotel would be a great choice for anyone looking for a 'Vegas vibe', or who is attending an event or sporting event at the arenas. Would also be a great choice for a corporate conference/meeting hotel as they have lots of brand new meeting space. One final note: they have the newer type elevator systems with a keypad where you enter your floor and a verbal prompt in English directs you to the correct elevator which will take you to your floor. There are NO BUTTONS in the elevator itself. While this didn't present a problem for us, we did have several people walk on to our elevator thinking they could hit the button inside - and this is not the case. Also - if you don't speak English I imagine this may be confusing....

HotelInfo.Name: Hyatt Regency New Orleans
HotelInfo.Address: 601 Loyola Ave, New Orleans, LA 70113
